title: Produktionsberedare
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**OM TJÄNSTEN**



Vill du vara med och omvandla tekniska idéer till effektiva produktionslösningar? Som Produktionsberedare hos oss på Sigma får du en nyckelroll i ett spännande kunduppdrag inom fordonsindustrin – där du bidrar till att skapa framtidens komponenter till några av branschens ledande fordonstillverkare.



I rollen kommer du att arbeta nära både produktutveckling och produktion. Du säkerställer att nya och befintliga produkter tillverkas på ett effektivt, hållbart och kvalitetssäkrat sätt. Arbetet innefattar bland annat att ta fram och optimera tillverkningsunderlag, arbeta med processförbättringar samt vara delaktig i industrialiseringsfasen av nya produkter. Som person är du strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Du trivs i samarbete med andra, men har också förmågan att driva dina uppgifter självständigt.



I det här uppdraget sker mycket av det dagliga arbetet i nära samarbete med operatörer och tekniker på plats i produktion. För att kommunikationen ska fungera smidigt och för att säkerställa kvalitet och säkerhet i produktionen behöver du därför kunna uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


Uppdraget är hos kund ca 10-12 mil norr om Göteborg, och passar dig extra bra som bor i eller i närheten av exempelvis Uddevalla, Trollhättan eller Vänersborg.



**ERFARENHETSKRAV**



Vi söker dig som har:


* Några års erfarenhet av produktionsteknik eller produktionsberedning, gärna inom plastkomponenter eller fordonsindustrin.
* Ingenjörsutbildning, inom maskinteknik, produktion eller liknande område.
* Förmåga att läsa och förstå ritningar och tekniska specifikationer.
* Intresse för förbättringsarbete och vana att arbeta nära produktionen.
* Krav på goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**VAD KAN VI ERBJUDA?**



Som anställd hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta inom flera olika områden hos våra kunder - helt enkelt det bästa med att vara konsult - men med tryggheten från en och samma arbetsgivare! Vi levererar spetskompetens inom områden som Produktutveckling, UX & Design, PLM, Industriell IT, Produktionsteknik och Projektledning. Väl i uppdrag sitter du antingen på plats hos kund eller i projektuppdrag från vårat härliga kontor beläget i hjärtat av Lindholmen Sciencepark**.**



Vi tycker om att göra saker ihop och strävar efter en bra mix av jobb och fritid. Det kan vara AWs, event, träningsaktiviteter, alpresor eller inspirationsföreläsningar. Vi har gjort många roliga resor tillsammans och nyss kom vi hem från Sydafrika(!) där vi firade 10 år som konsultbolag!



Kompetensutveckling har alltid varit viktigt för oss och förutom utvecklingsmöjligheter i ditt konsultuppdrag och diverse tekniska utbildningar har vi interna program för personlig utveckling.



Vi tror också att självbestämmande, delaktighet och inflytande skapar den motivation som krävs för att du ska lyckas nå dina personliga mål. Våra medarbetare har valt oss som arbetsgivare för att vi delar just denna syn på karriären, framtiden och livet i stort. Hos oss är vem du är lika viktigt som vad du gör. Ambitionen är att hitta en form som ger dig möjlighet att växa och utvecklas till något stort tillsammans med våra uppdragsgivare.



**SIGMA GROUP**
  

Som en del av Sigmagruppen erbjuder vi det bästa av två världar; stabilitet och entreprenörsanda.



Vi är det lilla bolaget i det stora Sigma och består alltså av ett flertal bolag inom olika tekniska kompetensområden. Vi är idag över 5000 anställda och har verksamhet i 14 länder. Detta gör oss till Sveriges största privatägda konsultgrupp.


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Simon Karlsson,  

simon.karlsson@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Produktionsberedare
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry West
* #### **LOCATION**


Göteborg, Trollhättan, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing engineering incl. Logistics, Project Management
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-11-05
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-12-06
* #### **CONTACT**


Simon Karlsson, simon.karlsson@sigma.se, +46736284005

title: Senior Fullstack focus Frontend (React, TypeScript, AWS)
description:
Volvo Group Connected Solutions is looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer with a primary focus on frontend development to Zone Management Team. You will be a key contributor to our user experience, driving development for key applications in Volvo Connect using React and TypeScript. While your core strength is the frontend, you'll also leverage your Node JS, Java/Spring Boot and AWS experience to design and implement robust APIs and backend services to ensure a seamless end-to-end product.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead React/TypeScript development to build engaging and high-performance user interfaces.
* Contribute to Full-Stack feature development, including API design and backend services in Java/Spring Boot on AWS.
* Ensure application quality, performance, and security across the stack.
* Collaborate closely with UX, Product Owners, testers and other developers in our agile team.
* Mentor colleagues and drive technical best practices.

**Required Skills:**

* Minimum 8 years of experience in software development.
* Strong proficiency in React, TypeScript/JavaScript, and modern state management (e.g., Redux, GraphQL).
* Solid experience with Java and Spring Boot.
* Experience with AWS and cloud-native application deployment.
* Familiarity with test automation frameworks (e.g., Jest, Cypress).
* Excellent communication skills are a must. Swedish skills is a bonus!

title: Game Designer
description:
**Why you want to be a Game Designer at Chief Rebel**


We offer a platform for you to shape the player's journey through dungeons, carefully designed layouts, epic boss fights, and engaging enemy encounters. This is an opportunity to make an impact by taking ownership of handcrafted levels, designing memorable boss battles, and crafting challenging enemy encounters. As a Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you will have the chance to showcase your skills in level design while also contributing to other aspects of game design, such as boss and enemy encounters. However this role will mostly focus on Dungeons.

**About the role**


We are looking for a Game Designer focusing on Dungeons to join us! This role is a temporary position, running until August 2026.


As a skilled Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you will be at the forefront of creating remarkable game levels and encounters. Your expertise in level design, including layout, boss battles, and enemy encounters, will be instrumental in shaping our gameplay experiences. Collaborating closely with the environment team, artists, animators, programmers, and game director, you will lead the charge in translating our envisioned levels and encounters with great replayability. Your proficiency in level design, storytelling, and player guidance will set the bar for excellence.

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Taking a proactive role in designing and building immersive levels, boss battles, and enemy encounters in collaboration with Feature Teams.
* Developing onboarding elements and tutorials to enhance the player experience.
* Applying UX principles to ensure exceptional player engagement, readability, and enjoyment.
* Maintaining a satisfying flow and pacing throughout combat scenarios and boss battles.
* Collaborating closely with the environment and gameplay team to create cohesive aesthetics, ambiance, and memorable encounters.
* Making a significant impact on the overall appeal and impact of the game through your handcrafted levels, boss battles, and enemy encounters.

**Skills needed**


To excel as a Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you should possess the following skills and qualifications:

* Passion for cooperative gameplay and a solid understanding of MMOs, MOBAs, or ARPGs.
* Extensive experience and expertise in level design, with a strong emphasis on fulfilling the player's fantasy and guiding them through the experience.
* Proven track record in scripting, navmeshes, lighting, and designing boss and enemy encounters.
* Proficiency in developing onboarding elements and designing effective tutorials.
* Advanced knowledge of player engagement, pacing, and storytelling techniques.
* Keen attention to detail, ensuring exceptional readability, immersion, and an enjoyable player experience.
* Previous experience in shipping games and a deep understanding of the game development process.

**Application**


To apply, please submit your resume and portfolio.

**About Chief Rebel**


Chief Rebel is a game development studio located in Stockholm, Sweden. We make stylized games with deeply involved mechanics. www.chiefrebel.com

title: Design Lead (B2B)
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**

*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*

 **Firstly, a bit about the team**


We're the team behind Arrive's B2B business — one of the company’s fastest-growing and most strategically important areas. As B2B Design Lead, you’ll help shape products that solve real-world problems for businesses managing fleets and mobility at scale.


Our mission? To become the trusted global mobility partner that boosts productivity and satisfaction through efficient and sustainable solutions. Whether it's streamlining parking expenses for SMBs or building data-powered platforms for enterprise fleets, we’re on a journey — from simplifying today’s admin to enabling tomorrow’s ecosystem of mobility services.

 **What you’ll be doing**


The B2B Design Lead at Arrive takes a strong and holistic ownership of the end to end user experience that’s under the remit of the department they’re working in.


This role entails a mix of leading a small team as well as hands-on contributions to raise the bar on the quality of the experiences offered to Arrive's users.


As B2B Design Lead you’ll report directly to the Head of Product Design and will collaborate closely with senior stakeholders in product, engineering and design, to shape the next steps of how the products should look, work and feel moving forward.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Through close collaboration with key stakeholders, ensure that the user experience of Arrive's products are the best they can possibly be.
* Coach, support and collaborate with a small, distributed team of skilled product designers to set both them and the department up for success. This includes spending time in 1:1’s, working with recruitment, onboarding new joiners, as well continuously improving ways of working, processes and overall maturity of design within the department.
* Whilst you’ll work with a team of designers, you’re also expected to have solid hands-on skills that you don’t mind leveraging with relative frequency. Your craft is at a level where you have an ability to truly elevate the quality of the products from a design standpoint.
* Aside from working with cross functional collaborators across the department, you’ll also work frequently with others in the wider organization: e.g. designers, UX researchers, UX writers and the design system team.

 **What you’ll bring to the team**

* We expect you to have at least 5+ years of experience in design with 3+ years of lead/management/coaching experience.
* Solid experience working with cross functional teams, preferably in a product/SaaS context.
* We expect you to be a strong communicator in both written and verbal form.
* Track record of product-thinking, outcome-centric, high quality projects.
* Impeccable craft skills. Know-how in design tools and prototyping is a given. Understanding for or skills in UX research, UX writing, motion design, design systems, are seen as beneficial.

  

We expect you to share an outstanding portfolio, giving a sense for your track record of shipping excellent products.

 **About us**

*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile, YourParkingSpace and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*

title: Senior Account Executive (M/F) - CDI
description:
Since 2014, Wiremind has positioned itself as a **technical company** transforming the world of transport and events with a 360° approach combining **UX, software, and AI**.


Our expertise lies primarily in **optimizing and marketing** our clients' capacity. We work on various projects such as **ticket forecasting and pricing**, **3D optimization of air freight or scraping competitor prices**. Our applications are the preferred tool **of companies** such as SNCF, United Airlines, Qatar Airways or even PSG to visualize, analyze and optimize their capacity.


Dynamic and ambitious, we strive to maintain our technical DNA which is the engine of our success. The company, profitable and self-financed since its creation 10 years ago, is mainly composed **of engineers and experts** and currently supports the growth of our **business model** based on "software-as-a-service" solutions.

### **Your missions**

As a **Senior Sales Executive**, you will lead the business development efforts for our SaaS solutions tailored to the **railway and bus passenger industry**. You will be responsible for managing the entire sales cycle, from identifying opportunities to closing deals, while building strong relationships with airline decision-makers across the globe.

**️ Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Railway & Bus Market Development**

* Identify and prospect target **railway operators**, **urban transit authorities**, and **bus companies** across regions aligned with our ICP and buying personas.
* Execute the **go-to-market strategy** for our ground transportation SaaS solutions.
* Represent Wiremind at **transport and mobility industry events** (e.g., UITP, InnoTrans, regional rail forums).

**2. Full Sales Cycle Ownership**

* Qualify leads and convert them into sales opportunities.
* Conduct compelling product presentations and team up with pre-sales for in-depth demos (e.g., revenue management, demand forecasting, network planning).
* Lead RFP responses and contract negotiations with public and private transport organizations.

**3. Strategic Account Management**

* Build and maintain long-term relationships with key stakeholders (e.g., Commercial Directors, Operations, Planning Heads, CIOs).
* Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities across product lines.
* Act as a trusted advisor for clients and liaise internally to advocate for their needs.

**4. Sales Performance & Reporting**

* Maintain an accurate sales pipeline in CRM.
* Provide regular forecasts and market insights to leadership.
* Collaborate with marketing, product, and customer success teams to refine strategy and adapt to ground transport sector needs.

**Your profile**
----------------

* You have minimum 5–8 years of B2B SaaS sales experience, ideally including public transport or mobility sector exposure.
* You have a proven track record of closing six-figure deals in complex sales cycles.
* You are familiar with transport planning, ticketing, pricing, or operations in the railway/bus industry.
* Exceptional communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
* Strong consultative sales approach with a focus on value-based selling.
* Fluent in English; additional languages (e.g., French, German, Spanish) are a plus.
* Willingness to travel internationally up to 30–40%.

**Bonus:**

* Experience with transport systems or planning software.
* Understanding of SaaS metrics and enterprise licensing models.

### **Our benefits**

By joining us, you will integrate:

* A self-financed startup with a strong technical identity!
* Beautiful 900 m² offices in the heart of Paris (Bd Poissonnière)
* Attractive remuneration indexed on performance
* A caring and stimulating team that encourages skills development through initiative and autonomy
* A learning environment with opportunities for evolution ‍


You will also benefit from:

* Training on demand
* A hybrid policy: 2 days of remote work per week and the possibility to work occasionally from abroad
* A great company culture (monthly afterworks, regular meetings on technology and products, annual off-site seminars, team-building…)
* An annual budget for your IT equipment
* A partnership with the People & Baby network of inter-company nurseries to help with childcare for children aged 0 to 3
  




### **Our Recruitment Process**

* A screening interview with Anne-Laure, our **Senior** **Talent Manager**


* An interview with the **Hiring Manager**


* A **technical test or case study** to be prepared


* A last interview **at our offices** to discuss your technical test or case study and meet with members of the team
  

Wiremind is committed to **equality of opportunity, diversity, and fairness**. We encourage all **candidates** with the necessary experience to apply for our job offers.

title: Chef Kundupplevelse till Apotek Hjärtat
description:
**Så här jobbar du som Chef för Kundupplevelse på Hjärtat**


Som Chef för Kundupplevelse har du en central roll i att forma hur våra kunder upplever Hjärtat – både digitalt och i butik. Du leder ett team av specialister inom CRO, kundanalys och UX/UI-design, och ser till att vi förstår våra kunder på djupet. Du arbetar nära andra delar av organisationen för att driva utveckling som gör skillnad i hela kundresan. Tillsammans med ditt team skapar du lösningar som bygger lojalitet, stärker varumärket och ökar försäljningen.

*Dina uppgifter handlar bland annat om att:*

* Leda och utveckla kundupplevelseteamet och skapa förutsättningar för ett datadrivet arbetssätt.
* Samla in, analysera och sprida kundinsikter internt.
* Utveckla och förbättra kundresor över alla kanaler.
* Stötta utvecklingsprojekt med kundinsikter och lösningsdesign.
* Ansvara för design och utveckling av Hjärtats digitala ytor samt efterlevnad av tillgänglighetsdirektiv (WCAG)
* Vara ambassadör för kundinsikt och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.

**Är du den vi söker?**


Du är en engagerad och kommunikativ ledare som drivs av att skapa struktur och tydliga arbetssätt som förbättrar både kundupplevelse och affär. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö med mycket samarbete, där du har förmågan att se möjligheter och hitta lösningar. Med din analytiska- och strategiska förmåga kan du prioritera utifrån insikt, effekt och genomförbarhet. Du leder med tydlighet och får med dig andra i förändring och utveckling.

*Vi tror att du har:*

* Gedigen erfarenhet av kundinsikt och kundupplevelse, gärna inom e-handel.
* Relevant akademisk examen.
* Dokumenterad ledarerfarenhet och tidigare personalansvar.
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete med hjälp av agila metoder och processer.

 **Hitta hem hos oss**  

På Hjärtat har vi ett fantastiskt uppdrag: vi hjälper människor att må bättre. Vi finns för alla i Sverige – för de sjuka och för de friska, genom livets alla faser. Med 400 apotek i hela landet och en e-handel som aldrig stänger, finns vi alltid nära. Vi är över 4000 kollegor som tillsammans möter våra kunder med omtanke, var de än befinner sig. Tillsammans bygger vi en kultur där vi är ett lag som litar på varandra, ser varandras förmågor och där alla kan bidra och påverka. Där vi alltid utgår från vårt samhällsuppdrag och där det finns plats för nya idéer och innovation. För oss är det viktigt att ta vara på våra medarbetares kunskap och tankar och vår hemvist i ICA Gruppen ger stora möjligheter till både personlig och yrkesmässig utveckling. Här finns en plats för dig med Hjärtat på rätt ställe.

**Din ansökan**  

På Hjärtat strävar vi efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka. Vi välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund! Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag 15/11, skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå arbetspsykologiskatester och bakgrundskontroller innan anställning. All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes.


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid eller enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta Daniel Norén, daniel.noren@apotekhjartat.se, för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Sanna Smidvik, sanna.smidvik@ica.se.

title: Webbstrateg
description:
*Som Webbstrateg på Spiris tar du helhetsansvaret för att vår webbplats utvecklas till att bli det mest kraftfulla verktyget för att attrahera, engagera och konvertera kunder. Du kombinerar strategiskt tänk med ett skarpt öga för detaljer och ser till att förverkliga visionen om en webb som driver tillväxt, skapar kundvärde och stärker vår affär.*

**Vad kommer du arbeta med?**


Vår förväntan är att du tar fullt ägarskap över vår webbplats som digital produkt, där allt från strategi till användarupplevelse och konvertering är en del av ditt ansvar. Webben är för oss en affärskritisk kanal som guidar våra kunder genom hela resan – från första kontakt till återkommande affär.


Du blir en nyckelperson i marknads- och säljorganisationen på Spiris och arbetar tätt tillsammans med kollegor inom utveckling, UX, analys och innehåll. Genom datadrivna insikter skapar du en webbupplevelse som både inspirerar besökare och bidrar direkt till våra mål. I rollen kommer du att:

* Leda och utveckla webbstrategin med tydliga KPI:er för leads, engagemang och konvertering.
* Säkerställa att webbplatsen stödjer kampanjer, contentplaner, säljstrategier samt varumärkesriktlinjer.
* Prioritera och driva webbens utvecklingsbacklog tillsammans med Web Lead från utvecklingsteamet.
* Samarbeta med webbanalytiker och CRO-specialister för att testa, mäta och optimera.
* Koordinera insatser mellan marknad, sälj, IT och Customer Success för att möta både användarbehov och affärskrav.
* Säkerställa att webbplatsen ligger i framkant inom SEO, tillgänglighet och användarupplevelse.
* Bidra till att stärka och utveckla den digitala upplevelsen av Spiris som varumärke i linje med positionering och kundlöfte.

**Vad har du gjort tidigare?**


Du har lett framgångsrika webb- och digitala satsningar där strategin varit lika viktig som detaljerna. Med bevisad erfarenhet av att arbeta datadrivet och mot tydliga KPI:er har du optimerat användarupplevelser som samtidigt stärkt affären. I tidigare roller har du tagit idéer från vision till konkret resultat – och sett till att varje insats har bidragit direkt till tillväxt och kundvärde.


För att lyckas har du:

* Stor erfarenhet av att driva och utveckla B2B-webbplatser framgångsrikt med fokus på leadsgenerering och konvertering.
* Kompetens inom SEO, UX och webboptimering.
* Vana att samarbeta över team och inom olika discipliner.
* Förmåga att ta ut en långsiktig strategi och omsätta den i effektiva projekt.
* Erfarenhet av CMS och förståelse för hur teknik och marknadsföring möts.
* Kommunikations- eller marknadsföringsutbildning, gärna kompletterad med kurser/certifikat inom analys, UX och SEO.

**Livet hos oss**


Vi lyfter människor som brinner för sitt område och uppmuntrar dig att testa nytt, utmana dig själv och växa tillsammans med oss – både som specialist och som kollega. Våra medarbetare lyfter ofta kulturen, samarbetet och engagemanget som några av de största anledningarna att vara här.


Hos oss är hybridarbete en självklarhet. Vi erbjuder moderna kontor i Växjö, Malmö, Göteborg och Stockholm, där du både kan inspireras av kollegor och få flexibiliteten att jobba där du är som mest effektiv.


Tillsammans är vi runt 500 medarbetare som skapar en arbetsplats där du kan vara precis som du är – och där vi hjälper varandra att utveckla både företaget och oss själva.

**Är det här din nästa utmaning?**


Vänta inte! Ansök redan idag, dock senast 23 november. Vi hanterar ansökningar och intervjuer löpande. För mer information om tjänsten kontakta Linda Olsson (Head of Sales & Marketing) på linda.olsson@spiris.se.


Tester och bakgrundskontroller ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.

title: LIA på Åhléns e-com VT26
description:
**Om LIA på Åhléns**

  

Vi på Åhléns sätter ett stort värde i att erbjuda LIA-platser till studenter. Vi vill dela med oss av våra kunskaper och erfarenheter men också inspirera dig till att vara en del av vår vision. För oss ger samarbete med studenter och skolor ett värdefullt utbyte som bidrar till utveckling både för oss och för dig som kommer hit. Nu söker vi en praktikant till vårt ecom-team för vårterminen 2026!

**Vad innehåller praktiken?**

  

Vi erbjuder LIA-plats i Åhléns online- och eCommerceteam där rollen i viss mån kan anpassas utefter en inriktning som är relevant för dig och det du studerar. Du kommer få möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och kompetens inom SEO genom att arbeta med digitalt innehåll på ahlens.se i form av bland annat, metadata, internlänkning, copywriting men även digital aktivering. Du kommer få möjlighet att arbeta både individuellt och i team tillsammans med hängivna och erfarna kollegor med spetskompetens inom SEO, CRO, UX, digital analys och digital försäljning.

 *Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:*

* Sökordsanalys
* Innehållsplanering
* Skapa och publicera digitalt innehåll i CMS och andra system
* Editering av befintligt innehåll
* Koppla relevanta produkter till innehåll
* Uppföljning på resultat av implementerat innehåll

**Vem är du?**


För att vara kvalificerad för praktik hos oss ser vi att du har:

* En pågående eftergymnasial utbildning inom webb, e-handel eller marknadsföring
* En godkänd praktikperiod via ditt universitet eller högskola, alternativt arbetsförmedlingen
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i excel och powerpoint är meriterande


Praktikperioden omfattar **minst 10 veckor** med start våren 2026.


Som praktikant på Åhléns blir du en i teamet och får delta i det dagliga arbetet. Du får mycket eget ansvar och vi uppskattar att du vill dela med dig av dina idéer.


Åhléns är en organisation i högt tempo, där mycket händer. Med dig i laget blir vi ännu ännu bättre!

  

Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Hos oss på Åhléns blir du en del av ett passionerat team som drivs av affärsmannaskap och entreprenörskap. Vi ger dig förtroende och möjligheten att växa i en utvecklande miljö. Med det hälsar vi dig varmt välkommen till Åhléns!
company_description: Åhléns AB, grundat 1899, är ett svenskt detaljhandelsföretag som ingår i Axel Johnson AB.

title: UX Designer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* Create motion graphics and visual designs that align with Ericsson’s design standards.
* Produce high-quality multimedia assets (videos, animations, illustrations, icons, etc.) based on project requirements.
* Design and refine UX/UI components, layouts, and visual elements ensuring consistency, accessibility, and alignment with user and business needs.
* Develop visual models and concepts that are coherent with Ericsson’s visual language and usage guidelines.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—design, development, communications, and learning—to ensure cohesive and aligned design outputs.
* Contribute to UX/UI activities including wireframing, prototyping, user flows, and usability enhancements.

* Hands-on experience with Adobe Premiere, Final Cut, After Effects, Audacity/Audition, or similar multimedia and design tools.
* Strong experience in graphic design and video editing.

* Excellent organization, communication, and collaboration skills.
* High attention to detail and a strong commitment to quality design output.
* Strong sense of visual storytelling and ability to convey messages effectively through design.


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: CRO internship
description:
**Turn Data into Impact**
 Are you excited by experimentation, user experience, and making data-driven decisions that create real change?
   

  

 At Conversionista!, we’re looking for a CRO Intern who’s eager to explore how insights and design come together to drive measurable business impact. This is your chance to dive deep into experimentation and/or UX - while also getting hands-on experience across different areas of conversion rate optimization.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with some of Nordic’s top CRO experts, take part in real client projects, and help turn data and hypotheses into better digital experiences.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Contribute to the design and execution of A/B tests and experiments
* Support in collecting, structuring, and analyzing data across platforms and channels
* Collaborate with UX designers, analysts, and strategists to create data-driven experiences
* Help prepare reports and insights, turning results into actionable recommendations for clients
* Explore and learn from different expertize within the CRO field - from analytics to UX design to experimentation strategy


**Who We’re Looking For**
 You might be a student in UX design, digital analytics, interaction design, or similar, with a growing curiosity for experimentation and data-driven ways of working. You’re curious about
 *why* 
 users behave the way they do and
 *what happens if we change this button or that flow* 
 .
   

  

 Whether You’re More Analytical Or Creative, What Matters Most Is That You Love To Learn And Want To See Your Ideas Make a Measurable Difference.You’ll Thrive Here If You’re
   

  

* Curious and eager to learn - you like to explore, ask questions and grow thorough new experiences
* Self-driven - you find your way forward and seek information rather than wait for instructions
* Communicative and collaborative - you enjoy working with others and contribute to a positive team dynamic
* Adaptable - you’re comfortable in changing environment and open to trying ne things
* In your final year of studies in a relevant program


****What’s in it for you****
* Training and mentorship from senior CRO experts, supporting your growth throughout the internship
* A chance to explore and gaining knowledge across all areas of CRO and access to our exploratory knowledge clusters
* Hands-on experience with real client projects and meaningful results
* Take part in shaping the future of CRO with AI-driven methods.
* Be part of Eidra, a vibrant collective of companies across design, strategy, technology, and innovation.


**Ready to make data talk?**
 Apply now and send your CV and a few words about why you’d love to join Conversionista! and why you are the right fit for this internship - we’ll review applications on a rolling basis.
 **Practical bits**
* Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg (we’re looking for one intern in each office)
* Start: According to your LIA schedule (we’re flexible!)


**Who We Are**
 Conversionista! is Nordic’s leading CRO company, transforming data into insights and measurable growth. We’re part of Eidra, a collective of creative and data-driven agencies shaping the future of digital experiences. (edited)
   

  

 We are conversion optimizers who help our clients use actual data instead of guesses. Armed with scientific methods, we reveal our customers’ growth potential and help them reach their business goals.
   

  

 We currently have over 60 conversion heroes in our five offices in Stockholm, Amsterdam, Oslo, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective, we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Design Lead
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Battlefield is a storied franchise renowned for uncompromising combat gameplay for over two decades. 100 million players and 5 billion hours played later, the Battlefield team is looking to define the future of the first-person shooter. United the banner of Battlefield Studios, 4 world-class teams across Criterion, DICE, Motive and Ripple Effect have come together to focus on the future of the franchise, a connected Battlefield universe filled with immersive experiences built on our unique DNA.
   

  

 LET’S PUSH THINGS FORWARD
   

  

 DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!
   

  

 We’re always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.
   

  

 At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.
   

  

 We’re all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work closely with the Creative Director to develop the Vision for Battlefield
* Oversee development process from concept to final release collaborating with design, art, programming, and production teams.
* A focus and understanding on Experience and encounter design
* Work with Narrative, Level design, Cinematics and Audio to bring experiences together ensuring continuity and creative agreement
* Ensure the game meets quality standards and player expectations
* Adjust game design based on feedback and player testing results.
* Present project updates to senior management.
* Review all game design content and assets.
* Provide leadership and mentorship to design team members, promoting a positive and creative and inclusive work environment.
* Collaborate to ensure the game is completed on time and within budget.
* Coordinate with external partners, work with marketing and PR teams to promote the game where needed.
* Stay updated with competitors, industry trends and incorporate new technologies


**Requirements**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in game development in a Creative leadership role.
* Experienced with successful game projects, first person shooter games but also acceptable would be in Single Player / Campaign experiences
* Experience creating innovative, immersive, high quality gaming experiences.
* Inspire and motivate a team.
* Ability to make critical decisions under pressure.
* Experience with play testing and gathering player feedback.
* You will manage budgets and resources
* Experience with multiple game development tools and software.
* Experience with project management methodologies.
* Deep passion for video games both as a creator and as a player
* Interest in a varied genre of games, especially first person shooters and military themed ones


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Design Lead (Stockholm/Hybrid, SE)
description:
(B2B)
   

  

**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
 As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.
   

  

**Firstly, a Bit About The Team**
 We're the team behind Arrive's B2B business — one of the company’s fastest-growing and most strategically important areas. As B2B Design Lead, you’ll help shape products that solve real-world problems for businesses managing fleets and mobility at scale.
   

  

 Our mission? To become the trusted global mobility partner that boosts productivity and satisfaction through efficient and sustainable solutions. Whether it's streamlining parking expenses for SMBs or building data-powered platforms for enterprise fleets, we’re on a journey — from simplifying today’s admin to enabling tomorrow’s ecosystem of mobility services.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The B2B Design Lead at Arrive takes a strong and holistic ownership of the end to end user experience that’s under the remit of the department they’re working in.
   

  

 This role entails a mix of leading a small team as well as hands-on contributions to raise the bar on the quality of the experiences offered to Arrive's users.
   

  

 As B2B Design Lead you’ll report directly to the Head of Product Design and will collaborate closely with senior stakeholders in product, engineering and design, to shape the next steps of how the products should look, work and feel moving forward.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Through close collaboration with key stakeholders, ensure that the user experience of Arrive's products are the best they can possibly be.
* Coach, support and collaborate with a small, distributed team of skilled product designers to set both them and the department up for success. This includes spending time in 1:1’s, working with recruitment, onboarding new joiners, as well continuously improving ways of working, processes and overall maturity of design within the department.
* Whilst you’ll work with a team of designers, you’re also expected to have solid hands-on skills that you don’t mind leveraging with relative frequency. Your craft is at a level where you have an ability to truly elevate the quality of the products from a design standpoint.
* Aside from working with cross functional collaborators across the department, you’ll also work frequently with others in the wider organization: e.g. designers, UX researchers, UX writers and the design system team.


 What you’ll bring to the team
   

  

* We expect you to have at least 5+ years of experience in design with 3+ years of lead/management/coaching experience.
* Solid experience working with cross functional teams, preferably in a product/SaaS context.
* We expect you to be a strong communicator in both written and verbal form.
* Track record of product-thinking, outcome-centric, high quality projects.
* Impeccable craft skills. Know-how in design tools and prototyping is a given. Understanding for or skills in UX research, UX writing, motion design, design systems, are seen as beneficial.


 We expect you to share an outstanding portfolio, giving a sense for your track record of shipping excellent products.
   

  

**About Us**
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile, YourParkingSpace and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.
   

  

**Department**
 Parking
   

  

**Locations**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Remote status**
 Hybrid
   

  

**About Arrive**
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Product Design Lead
description:
Join Greenely's mission to lead Europe's energy transition. We are dedicated to reducing household energy bills to zero by optimizing energy usage and enabling virtual power generation. As we navigate the complexities of the energy sector, we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Product Design Lead** 
 to lead the product design development of our app and home electricity ecosystem. If you’re passionate about understanding customer needs, people management, balancing commercial considerations, and driving impactful product design strategies, we want you on our team.
   

  

 As a Product Design Lead at Greenely, you will be at the heart of our product design strategy, driving the vision, development, and implementation of our innovative solutions. You will lead the product design lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring that our platform consistently meets and exceeds customer expectations while delivering commercial success. Your customer-focused approach will be instrumental in creating products that resonate with users and contribute to Greenely’s mission. Your expertise in creating seamless user experiences and visually compelling and efficient designs will play a key role in shaping the future of our products.
   

  

******What you’ll be doing******
* Lead product design work end-to-end in the Greenely app as well as in other channels
* Shape and lead a team of product designers.
* Report to the CPO and represent and drive the design agenda within Product and Tech leadership
* Translates brand and product vision into coherent, scalable design systems and experiences across markets and platforms.
* Partner with Product, Tech, and Marketing leadership to shape product strategy.
* Conduct user research and usability testing to inform design decisions.
* Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that enhance user experience.
* Leads creation and governance of a unified design language that scales across markets and products while enabling local relevance.
* Drive innovation by staying up-to-date with design trends and best practices.


****What you'll need to succeed****
* Solid experience in product design, with a proven track record of leading design efforts from discovery to launch.
* People leadership experience with emphasis on being a people-oriented leader
* Experience creating product design from ground up at multi-product consumer app companies in multi-markets.
* Strong understanding of UX principles and the ability to simplify complex user flows.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe Creative Suite.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present and justify design decisions.
* A results-driven mindset, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


**What We Can Offer You 🏢👩‍💻**
* Flexibility: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* Growth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* Influence and Impact: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* Innovative Environment: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.


**About Greenely**
 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!
   

  

 WE ARE
 **bold and push the limit.**
 WE
 **energize each other** 
****.****
 WE
 **t** 
******hink like owners.******
 WE
 ****lead with knowledge.****
**Kindly, we do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. Thank you for your understanding.**
 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer by using technology. We are a digital energy provider that helps people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing the home and car's electricity usage with smart technology in an app.
   

  

 Greenely, with the support of Nordic venture capital companies, has a mission to make it possible for households all over the world to connect, control and optimize their energy usage. We ultimately believe that the best electricity is the one that is not used at all, both for the wallet and the planet!

title: Content and CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) Specialist
description:
Join one of Sweden’s most loved global brands in our mission to make life easier and more fun for families with young children!
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Content and CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) Specialist** 
 to join our D2C team at our headquarters in Sundbyberg. In this role, you will work in an international environment, with great colleagues and play a key part in optimizing our digital presence and driving e-commerce performance.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





 70% of time:
 


* Coordinate online campaigns and product launches in alignment with the Global Commercial Plan.
* Upload and maintain product content and assets in the e-commerce CMS and ensure product information accuracy.
* Align with regional teams to execute local commercial initiatives (e.g., Gift with Purchase promotions, localized campaigns, etc.).
* Merchandise the product assortment according to sales performance and regional needs.
* Curate and maintain featured products and cross-sell opportunities to optimize conversion and user engagement.



  





 30% of time:
 


* Collaborate with the Data Analyst and other stakeholders to develop and implement a comprehensive CRO strategy, ensuring sustainable growth in our conversion rate.
* Assist when needed with data analysis and reporting in coordination with the Data Analyst to track performance and identify improvement opportunities.
* Conduct site monitoring to ensure proper functionality, content accuracy, and user experience.
* Provide support for ad hoc projects and cross-functional initiatives.



  





**Are you the one?** 




  





 Qualifications
 


* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, E-commerce, or related field.
* +3 years of experience in e-commerce, digital marketing, or online merchandising.
* Strong understanding of CMS tools and product data management.
* Experience with Google Tag Manager would be appreciated.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with global and regional teams.
* Analytical mindset with familiarity in interpreting sales and campaign data.
* Fluent English is required, while Swedish and/or any other languages are a plus.



  





 This is a permanent position with a six-month probation period within the D2C team, reporting to the Global Direct-to-Consumer Manager. The position is based at BabyBjörn's HQ in Sundbyberg.
 



  





**We look forward to receiving your application!** 




  





 Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so submit yours as soon as possible. The final deadline is November 30, 2025. Apply via Easy Apply on LinkedIn.
 



  





 For questions about the position, contact HR Business Partner Malena Lindblad at malena.lindblad@babybjorn.com or Global Direct-to-Consumer Manager José Ángel Sarmento at joseangel.sarmiento@babybjorn.com.
 



  





*BabyBjörn AB is a Swedish, family-owned company that has around 190 employees within its Groups and develops, markets, and distributes children´s products, primarily for the age group 0-3 years. The company was founded in 1961, and since then more than 50 million children have been carried in our baby carriers. We have a turnover today of more than SEK 1 billion, and 95% of our sales are exports to more than fifty countries. As we exist for all types of families, no matter their structure, lifestyle, or identity, we strive for this to be reflected in our organization as well. More information is available at www.babybjorn.com* 




  





*Important information when applying to BabyBjörn AB:* 




*By applying, you consent to BabyBjörn AB storing and potentially using your personal data for recruitment purposes for a period of 24 months following the date on which the data was obtained. Your personal data will not be processed for any purpose other than previously stated, and your data will not be transferred to a third party. For more information about where and for how long we process your personal data, as well as more information about your rights regarding erasure and data portability, please contact us at mydata@babybjorn.com.*

title: Intern
description:
**Job Description**
**Project Description**
 This project aims to improve the usability, design consistency, and scalability of the existing Confluence space. The students will begin with a comprehensive review to identify areas for enhancement in navigation, layout, and accessibility. In addition, user insights will be gathered through virtual interviews to inform the design of reusable templates and scalable structures suitable for regional adaptation. Based on this assessment, they will implement UX improvements to create a more intuitive and visually cohesive experience.
   

  

 To support long-term use, the deliverables will include a style guide, a user-friendly manual outlining best practices, and 8-10 confluence page templates.
   

  

 All updates will be designed to support cross-country collaboration and localization. The students may also provide recommendations for future integration of AI tools, such as chatbots, to enhance user support and engagement as time allows.

 Accountability, Accountability, APA Style Writing, Best Practices Research, Chatbots, Clinical Research, Cloud Data Catalog, Communication, Data Analysis, Database Management, Data Science, Data Security, Data Visualization, Data Wrangling, Detail-Oriented, Event Planning, Key Informant Interviews, Key Performance Indicators (KPI), Language Localization, Microsoft Office, Navigation, Process Descriptions, Project Management, Python (Programming Language), Software Proficiency {+ 4 more}
