title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Tech with a Human Touch – Senior Data Engineer** 




 At ANIMARUM, we believe technology should empower people. We are seeking a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 to help us establish and grow our internal data engineering team. In this role, you will design and build modern, scalable data products
 
 that deliver real impact for our clients.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Recruit and lead data engineers, conducting technical interviews to build and grow our internal data engineering team.
* Develop reliable data flows to turn raw data into useful information.
* Design & optimize data solutions on Snowflake and GCP.
* Work with Python, SQL, data modeling to enable reliable, scalable pipelines.
* Setting up ETL /ELT pipelines to collect, transform and store data.
* Manage CI/CD, Terraform, Kubernetes and ensure automation, security & performance.
* Collaborate with product owners, data scientists and engineers to deliver value.
* Make sure data is accurate, consistent and well-documented.



  





**What we are looking for** 



* 5+ years as a Data Engineer or similar role.
* Experience in Python, Java and/or Scala
* Strong Snowflake, GCP & SQL skills.
* Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD, and streaming tools (Kafka).
* Collaborative, curious, and solution-oriented mindset.
* Fluent in Swedish.



  





**Nice to have:** 
 Airflow/Argo, observability tools (Grafana/Kibana), data visualization experience. Experience in Machinelearning and PowerBI background
 



  





**Why ANIMARUM** 




 At ANIMARUM, it is not just about the job – it is about being part of a supportive team where everyone can grow and succeed.
 



  





**We offer:** 



* **A human-centered culture** 
 where people truly matter.
* **Work-life balance** 
 – flexibility to combine career and personal life.
* **Benefits that make a difference:** 
 wellness allowance (5000 SEK), company car/bike options, SL travel card.
* **Giving back** 
 – the chance to donate to a charity of your choice every year.
* **Competitive pay & stock options** 
 – because our people are our greatest asset.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We're looking for data analysts in Stockholm or Gothenburg to start this fall. This position is perfect for recent graduates with a Bachelor's or Master's degree ready to launch their careers in data analytics.
   

  

**About Conversionista**
 Conversionista is part of Eidra, and we specialize in helping businesses understand their data and make better decisions. Beyond analytics, we also help businesses improve their websites and digital experiences to achieve better results - whether that's more sales, sign-ups, or user engagement. We also work with user experience research and digital strategy.
   

  

 Our insights team combines different approaches to get the full picture, we triangulate findings from both qualitative and quantitative research, drawing from multiple data sources to ensure robust conclusions.
   

  

**Our Analytics Work Focuses On**
* Data analytics - Working with raw data to understand behavior patterns and customer journeys
* Data preparation and analytics engineering - Transforming tables and datasets for dashboards and analysis
* Experimentation - Conducting A/B tests and other controlled experiments to measure business impact
* Statistical analysis - Applying hypothesis testing and statistical methods to validate findings
* Experiment modeling - Modeling experiment results and metrics to quantify business impact
* KPI tracking and business metrics - Monitoring performance indicators that matter to business success
* Ad-hoc analysis - Answering specific business questions through data exploration


 We work extensively with web data, including Google Analytics exports in BigQuery. Understanding how events are tracked online is a major advantage in this role.
   

  

**What we don't do:** 
 We don't build predictive models, machine learning algorithms, or complex AI systems. Our focus is on understanding what happened and why, not predicting what will happen.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As an analyst, you'll dive deep into data and uncover insights that drive business success. Your role goes beyond collecting data, you'll make it accessible and understandable for others. You'll enable colleagues and clients to quickly access crucial information for important decisions.
   

  

 This role is based in central Stockholm or Gothenburg. We work from our office or at client locations - this is not a remote position.
   

  

 You'll join a team that prioritizes helping and supporting each other. Your colleagues are passionate and knowledgeable, constantly pushing themselves and each other to excel.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 We look for people who share our foundational values.
   

  

* You are solution-oriented. You focus on finding solutions, not just pointing out problems. You take initiative and look for smart ways to create real value.
* You are a team player. You enjoy working with others and put the team first. You share your knowledge, give helpful feedback, and are open to learning from your colleagues.
* You have a positive attitude. You see challenges as opportunities to learn and grow. You are helpful and create a positive atmosphere for your team and our clients.
* You are professional and committed. You take responsibility for your work and deliver on your promises. You communicate clearly and act with integrity.


 What We're Looking For
   

  

**Essential Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (data science, statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering, or similar)
* Strong programming skills in SQL and Python
* Experience with data visualization techniques
* Keen eye for detail and strong analytical mindset
* Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
* Adaptability to work with various clients and environments
* Professional English proficiency


**Preferred Experience**
* Cloud-based data infrastructure (Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Databricks, et al.)
* Web, product, or marketing analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, Mixpanel, et al)
* Statistical analysis and experimental methodology
* Experience designing and analyzing experiments
* Swedish language skills


**About Eidra**
 As part of Eidra, we embrace core values that guide how we work and interact with each other and our clients. We believe in continuous learning, collaboration, and delivering meaningful results.
   

  

 Start Date
   

  

 Mark your calendar for January 12, 2025 - that's when your onboarding starts. We're excited to welcome you aboard!
   

  

 Ready to turn data into insights that matter? Apply today.
   

  

**Applications open until Monday, November 10, 2025 at 23:59 CET**
 We are conversion optimizers who help our clients use actual data instead of guesses. Armed with scientific methods, we reveal our customers’ growth potential and help them reach their business goals.
   

  

 We currently have over 60 conversion heroes in our five offices in Stockholm, Amsterdam, Oslo, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective, we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Major Account Manager Defense
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 The Major Account Manager Defense partners with our Defense customers to secure their entire digital experience. You’re motivated by the desire to solve critical challenges facing our customer’s secure environment, so you’re prepared to connect them with a solution for every stage of threat prevention. This role is a significant driver of company revenue and growth. As an experienced and dynamic sales professional, you’re responsible for leading and driving sales engagements.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is leading the charge in platformization, offering best-in-breed solutions that enable customers to build a truly zero-trust security architecture and navigate critical transformations. To ensure our sales team is equipped to guide customers, we've developed FLIGHT, an immersive onboarding program. Flight blends virtual and in-person learning at our headquarters, where new sales hires will participate in dynamic cohorts, fully dedicated to their training without customer distractions. This focused approach ensures they emerge as well-prepared sales professionals, ready to help customers leverage our comprehensive portfolio.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* As a Major Account Manager Defense, you will drive and orchestrate large complex sales cycles and work with our internal partners and teams to best serve the customer
* Your consultative selling experience will identify business challenges and create solutions for prospects and our customers
* Understand the competitive landscape and customer needs so you can effectively position the portfolio of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Create clear goals and complete accurate forecasting through developing a detailed territory plan
* Leverage prospect stories to create a compelling value proposition with insights into value for that specific account
* Stay updated on industry news and trends, and how they affect Palo Alto Networks products and services
* Travel as necessary within your territory, and to company-wide meetings


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* Experience and knowledge of selling large Enterprise IT solutions to Defense customers.
* Fluent Swedish.
* Demonstrated experience selling complex solutions, value selling, and/or consultative sales techniques
* Technical aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems
* Identifies problems, reviews data, determines the root causes, and provides scalable solutions
* Cultivate relationships with our channel partners to bring channel-centric go-to-market approach for our customers
* Demonstrates in depth knowledge of the full sales cycle and the ability to follow a structured sales process
* Ability to take a holistic approach to problem solving by understanding the bigger picture, and considering complex interrelationships and outcomes
* Excellent time management skills, and work with high levels of autonomy and self-direction


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Tech Director
description:
Welcome to
 **Umain** 
 - a digital product consultancy based in the heart of Stockholm, Sweden, and a part of
 **Eidra** 
 . We're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto
 **"Shape, Ship, Scale,"** 
 we empower our team to envision the future and play a pivotal role in building it for our clients. We're a dynamic group where you can shape groundbreaking technical solutions, ship them to market, and scale your influence across various industries.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for a
 **Tech Director** 
 ready to lead this journey, bringing technical expertise, strategic vision, and a collaborative spirit along with them. Whether you're a seasoned leader or eager to take on bigger challenges, this role offers the opportunity to work on exciting projects and lead teams through the complex landscape of modern digital solutions.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to lead unique projects that push the boundaries of what's possible in technology.
* A fun and fair work environment with opportunities to expand your technical leadership and strategic skills alongside highly ambitious colleagues.
* A personal coach and a setting where you can grow both professionally and personally.
* The opportunity to work in multidisciplinary agile teams, collaborating with experts across design, development, and strategy.


**As a Tech Director at Umain, your role will involve:**
* Technical Leadership: Define and communicate technical vision for multiple projects, ensuring they are innovative, scalable, and aligned with Umain's strategic goals.
* Solution Architecture: Oversee the design and development of technical solutions that meet client needs and industry standards in scalability, security, and sustainability.
* Client Engagement: Act as the technical interface with clients, translating their business needs into technical strategies and delivering clear, impactful solutions.
* Project Oversight: Monitor and support project teams, resolving technical challenges, and ensuring timely, high-quality deliveries.
* Mentorship: Guide and mentor development teams, promoting best practices and continuous learning.


**Who You Are**
* You're a Tech Director with a passion for leadership, technology, and problem-solving.
* You thrive in dynamic environments, eager to take on new challenges and grow your technical influence.
* You believe in the power of collaboration and diversity, recognizing the impact you can make by working closely with cross-functional teams.
* You're an innovator who values technology's role in shaping the future.


**Why Umain?**
* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and transparency, which is why we've established a clear career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities. Your growth is important to us, and you'll work closely with your coach to build a development plan that supports your career goals.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, we embrace diversity and understand that life doesn't stop when you come to work. We've created a supportive environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds and life stages. Whether you’re caring for your family, your pets, or yourself, we’re committed to helping you find balance.
* Innovation and Learning: Technology is ever-evolving, and at Umain, we’re committed to continuous learning. You'll work with a talented group of developers, designers, and analysts to tackle new challenges, share knowledge, and grow together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We value talent, drive, and creativity over formal education. If you have the ambition to succeed and the passion for technology, Umain is the place where you can thrive, no matter your educational background.


**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a
 **Tech Director** 
 who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Business & Technical Migration Consultant
description:
**Business & Technical Migration Consultant** 




**Digital : Pega** 




**Sweden- Stockholm** 




**6-8 Years** 




**English** 




**Onsite** 




**6 Months** 




  





 1. Lead requirement analysis and definitions. This includes analyzing business needs, investigate technical possibilities and then define a viable technical solution that is anchored among core program stakeholders.
 



 The person should also, in collaboration with the business, be responsible for and lead the definition of the migration plan for the whole program.
 



 The consultant should have experience and participate in technical testing. It is, therefore, preferred that the consultant have worked with business-related requirement areas and have experience of analyzing business needs and translating these into technically viable solutions.
 



 2. The consultant should have experience in transformation work and support and lead communication and training initiatives as well as UAT.
 



 It is beneficial if the consultant has experience of working with PEGA

title: Data Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* At least 4+ year’s work experience including hands-on as Data engineer on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Experience in GCP tools – Dataflow and Bigquery
* Experience in Data Build Tool (DBT)
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
* Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
* Experience in working with data visualization tools
* Fluent in English both written and verbal


**Meritorious**
* Business understanding of retail industry


**Application deadline:** 
 09-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Klienttekniker
description:
Vi söker nu en erfaren klienttekniker till ett uppdrag hos en större offentlig verksamhet. Du kommer att tillhöra ett team som arbetar med klientutveckling och ansvarar för att säkerställa att organisationens Windowsbaserade klientplattform är stabil, säker och uppdaterad.
 



 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med kollegor inom Digital Arbetsplats och IT, där du arbetar både operativt och förbättringsdrivet med klientplattformens funktion och utveckling.
 


 Dina arbetsuppgifter
 * Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av Windows-klientplattformen
* Säkerställa att plattformen uppfyller säkerhetskrav och interna riktlinjer
* Genomföra Windows-uppdateringar och klientdistributioner via Configuration Manager
* Självständig felsökning och problemlösning i en Windows Enterprise-miljö


**Skallkrav för rollen:** 
* Minst 5 års sammanhängande erfarenhet av
 **Microsoft Configuration Manager** 
**(SCCM)**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av uppdateringar av Windows-klienter via Configuration Manager
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av avancerad teknisk felsökning i en Windows Enterprise-miljö
* Erfarenhet av
 **Horizon VDI**
* Erfarenhet av
 **paketering och distribution**
* Erfarenhet av
 **Active Directory Group Policies** 
 (skapa, ändra, felsöka)
* God erfarenhet av
 **PowerShell** 
 för installation och konfiguration



  





 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad och självgående, med ett genuint intresse för att skapa en välfungerande och säker klientmiljö. Du trivs med att samarbeta med kollegor men är samtidigt trygg i att ta egna initiativ och driva ditt arbete framåt. Du har en lösningsorienterad inställning, tycker om att analysera problem och finner gärna förbättringsmöjligheter som gynnar både användare och verksamhet.
 



**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
  Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Investment Banking Analyst - Leveraged Finance, Stockholm Office
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you looking for a position in a highly professional international environment with development potential? Are you about to complete or have you recently completed your university degree in finance, business, or economics with a solid focus on financial products and markets and commenced or looking to kick-off a career in finance? Then we have an interesting opportunity for you in Stockholm.*
***Investment Banking Analyst - Leveraged Finance, Stockholm Office***
*Within Leveraged Finance, we specifically serve Danske Bank’s Private Equity clients through the origination, structuring, and execution of leveraged buyout financings, refinancings, recapitalizations, and fund financings. Our Pan-Nordic team consists of c. 30 professionals working closely with our London-based Syndications desk and other relevant units within the investment banking division to ensure strong coverage of Nordic, European, and international financial sponsors. As a leading Underwriter and Mandated Lead Arranger of Nordic syndicated Loans, we consistently place among the most active banks in terms of transaction volume in Bloomberg league tables, ahead of several international investment banks and regional commercial banks. Building on this momentum, we are seeking an Analyst to join our fast-paced, deal-centric environment and to actively participate in live transactions while building strong credit analysis experience.*
*In this role, your role responsibilities will be:*
* Participating in the origination and execution of new transactions
* Financial modelling to assess debt capacity and capital structure alternatives across loans and high yield bonds
* Evaluating information memoranda and commercial / financial due diligence reports
* Preparation of internal and external presentations
* Portfolio management activities related to our Private Equity coverage


***Are you an analytical and innovative colleague?***
*Being an Analyst means that we will focus and contribute to your professional and personal development. We expect you to be eager to learn, have an innovative mind-set, not to be afraid of asking questions and taking responsibility for exciting and important projects.*
*To achieve your goals in Leveraged Finance, you should have solid analytical skills and enjoy working in a progressive and innovative environment. It is also important that you are a collaborator and have professional communication skills, as you will be in touch with external and internal stakeholders on a regular basis.*
*You most likely have an MSc in Finance, Business, or Economics, but your degree could be well within another field – what matters is that you can demonstrate a strong academic track record combined with an analytical mindset. Previous experience from banking, or a similar sector, is an advantage.*
*Fluency in one of the Nordic languages and English is a requirement as we operate in an international environment. Additionally, competences in Excel, PowerPoint and Word are critical as well as a high level of general IT proficiency.*
***We empower you to grow***
*If you want to develop your career by gaining knowledge of the investment banking industry, we offer a high level of responsibility as well as an inspiring team and committed colleagues who empower you to grow. We offer you an inclusive work environment where you will contribute to our growth.*
*This is a fantastic opportunity for you to accelerate your career by working together with true experts and get feedback and support from inspiring leaders. We have a respectful and inclusive culture in which we support each other to reach our goals as a team. Furthermore, you will be a part of a programme, where you will get a deep knowledge of investment banking in Danske Bank, as well as getting a solid network across the entire Nordics with other Analysts.*
***Are you our new analyst?***
*We would like to welcome you on board in a timely manner, so please apply sooner rather than later, as we are looking through applications on an ongoing basis, at the latest by 3 November 2025.*
*Please include CV, cover letter, and academic transcript in your application.*
*If you have any questions regarding the position, please reach out to: Fredrik Trygve, Associate Director,* 
***fredrik.trygve@danskebank.com***
*We look forward to your application!*
**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Testledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av testledning i tekniska utvecklingsprojekt, minst (5) år
* Erfarenhet av att dokumentera testfall och testrapporter minst (5) år
* Erfarenhet av granskning av krav och arkitekturdokumentation och därefter framtagande av teststrategi, testplaner mm, minst (3) år.
* Erfarenhet av manuella (utforskande) tester minst (3) år
* Erfarenhet av testkedjan som helhet (enhetstest, komponenttest, funktionella systemtester, regressionstester, acceptanstester,IFK-tester, end-to-end-tester, tillgänglighetstester minst (3) år
* Erfarenhet av teambaserad utveckling enligt agila principer i minst (3) år
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhet i relation till test/QA i)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av från ett eller flera uppdrag och olika organisationer/kunder avseende framtagning av testfall och utveckling av maskinella tester gällande elektronisk identifiering och signering
* Erfarenhet att skapa automatiserade tester
* Minst 1 års arbete med Git-repositories
* Minst 1 års arbete i Linux
* Minst 1 års arbete med med bygg-, test- och leveransflöden i containerbaserade miljöer
* Minst 1 års arbete med SQL-Databaser


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 10-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Full Stack Engineer - Erika Insurance** 




 Do you want to help shape the future of our platforms in a modern Azure environment and leverage AI and automation throughout the development lifecycle? We are looking for a
 **Full Stack Engineer** 
 who combines technical expertise in .NET and cloud architecture with a strong sense of structure, quality, and agile methodologies. You’ll be a key member of a small team where your contribution will have a direct impact, while also being part of a truly global business.
 



  





 Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible. Submit your application today!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Work on architecture and development in .NET/C#, Vue.js., Azure – from backend to integrations and user interfaces – ensuring high-quality deliveries and clean code.
* Participate in, and occasionally lead, technical testing and test automation initiatives.
* Contribute to the development of new and improved security strategies.
* Operate within structured yet pragmatic workflows, using backlogs and visual tools to provide clarity and focus for the team and stakeholders.
* Play an important role in ensuring the team works efficiently and transparently.



  





 You will report directly to Erika’s EVP Technology.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* Relevant IT education and at least 2 years of experience with .NET/C#, Azure, Vue.js., or related technologies.
* Relevant experience of testing.
* Understanding of API architecture and design patterns, including REST.
* Commitment to secure coding practices and awareness of compliance/privacy considerations.
* Enjoys working in an agile environment and has an interest in improving structure, workflows, backlogs, and visual tools to support team success.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.



  





**Desirable** 



* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps tools.
* Advanced experience in Azure, such as API gateways, Function Apps, Front Door, Data Factory and SQL server.
* Experience with Azure B2C, especially custom policies.
* UI design and prototyping experience in Figma.
* Experience with AI-driven development.
* Strong interest in emerging machine learning.



  





**We Offer** 



* An organization with few boundaries on what’s possible.
* The opportunity to help develop the next generation of our platforms in a modern cloud environment, applying AI and automation.
* Significant responsibility and varied tasks.
* The chance to take on challenges through collaboration with an action-oriented mindset.
* A work environment where your experience is valued, and where we encourage initiative and continuous improvement.
* The ability to combine strategic and technical development with influence over work methods and structure.
* A small core team within a truly global business.



  





**Other Information** 



* Start: Immediately
* Scope: Full-time
* Location: In-person - Strandvägen, Stockholm
* Recruiting Manager: Stefan Eriksson



  





**About Erika Insurance** 




 Erika Insurance, part of EF Education First, is a Swedish insurance company. For over 30 years, our mission has been to protect travelers as they discover new places, explore new cultures, and learn more about the world and themselves. We are a small and dynamic team in a flat organization where ideas become reality in a short time span. Learn more at https://erikainsurance.com.
 



  





**About EF Education First** 




 Some companies are in the business of technology. Others in finance, sports, or soft drinks. At EF, we’re in a different kind of business – one that’s less tangible, but far more important. Because what we do makes everything else possible. We’re in the Business of Understanding – between people – between cultures.
 



  





 For 60 years, we’ve been the leader in international educational programs and experiences designed to foster such understanding. Through language learning, cultural exchange, academic studies, and educational travel, we create immersive experiences that challenge biases, open minds, and pave the way for a more understanding world.
 



  





 You’ll find our 115 offices in some of the world’s greatest cities, filled with smart, driven people who push each other to be better every day. Yes, we have technology, finance, and even sports with our own professional cycling team – and we have an insurance company. But it’s what we do with these resources –building understanding, breaking down barriers, and creating a better world – that makes all the difference.
 



 Learn more at https://ef.com

title: Customer Success Engineer - Experimentation Platform
description:
Interested in driving Spotify’s experimentation philosophy across the company while being the first line of support for our platform? Spotify’s Confidence team is looking for a Customer Success Engineer who will serve our internal customers —more than 300 product and platform teams— combining technical depth, business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills to provide strategic guidance and automate problem‑solving.
   

  

 We’re seeking a versatile engineer skilled in backend development, SDK development, and customer interaction. Your primary responsibility will be to provide first‑response support to internal Spotify teams using Confidence, our experimentation platform, and to build and maintain strong relationships that ensure their success and satisfaction. Join a high-paced, startup-like team of engineers, designers, data scientists and product managers to drive the adoption, reliability, and effectiveness of our experimentation platform across Spotify. While the role is internal‑facing, Confidence is being built as a product that can serve other businesses; you’ll help shape reusable, productizable solutions. We operate with a startup mindset inside Spotify—expect ambiguity, shifting priorities, and broad ownership.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Nurture strong relationships with our internal customers (Spotify teams) by providing the support, information and training needed to achieve their desired outcomes.
* Monitor and respond to internal support channels for Confidence across 300+ teams, alongside a data science counterpart. Triage and solve issues, raising bugs and complex issues to appropriate teams.
* Own first-line triage for incidents impacting Confidence users at Spotify and coordinate with engineering for timely resolution.
* Independently resolve most incoming issues using common debugging approaches (e.g., writing queries, reading and interpreting GCP logs, and performing basic code-level investigation).
* Group and synthesize recurring inquiries/issues to advocate for deeper, longer‑term remediation.
* Propose and drive tooling and automation that reduces support cost and improves developer experience.
* Contribute small improvements to SDKs, samples, or docs when it unblocks teams.
* Identify points of friction in the onboarding and adoption experience.
* Represent the voice of the internal customer and influence the product roadmap to ensure customer satisfaction.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have an understanding of how developers work, and experienced with modern infrastructure - preferably within an enterprise environment.
* You have experience with experimentation (A/B testing), or a strong interest to learn quickly; comfortable with experiment design, metrics, guardrails, and interpreting results in production at a practical level.
* You have the ability to debug issues independently by reading Java code, understanding GCP logs, and writing queries.
* You are familiar with modern data warehouses and analytics stacks (e.g., Databricks, BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift).
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing customer issues.
* You have excellent written and verbal communicator; calm under pressure and able to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical users.
* Hands-on experience working with experimentation platforms is a plus!


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Product Owner
description:
Nästa år fyller Indiska 125 år – och med vår historia finns oändliga möjligheter att skapa digital inspiration och upplevelser som berör. Vi befinner oss i en spännande fas där vi moderniserar kundresan, stärker våra digitala plattformar och bygger framtidens Indiska. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva vår digitala utveckling som Product Owner – en nyckelroll i att skapa värde för både kund och affär.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Product Owner på Indiska ansvarar du för att våra digitala produkter och system kontinuerligt utvecklas med så stor affärsnytta som möjligt. Du fungerar som en brygga mellan verksamheten, våra utvecklingspartners och olika interna team – där du översätter behov till tydliga prioriteringar och konkreta lösningar.
   

  

 Du har ett helhetsansvar för produktens roadmap och säkerställer att utvecklingen sker i linje med både affärsmål och kundupplevelse. Tillsammans med E-com-teamet och IT driver du förbättringar som stärker Indiskas digitala ekosystem – från e-handel och integrationer till dataflöden och affärsrelaterade system.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du bland annat att:
   

  

* Planera och driva produktens roadmap i nära dialog med IT-Manager och verksamheten.
* Definiera och prioritera backlog baserat på affärsnytta, data och användarbehov.
* Säkerställa att produkten uppfyller legala krav, teknisk kvalitet och prestanda.
* Fungera som kravställare gentemot systemleverantörer och samarbetspartners.
* Analysera behov, hitta förbättringspotential och driva proaktiva initiativ.
* Hantera releaser, buggar och uppföljning av tekniska KPI:er.
* Ansvara för budget och uppföljning av utvecklingskostnader.


 Du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt – med fokus på att skapa affärsvärde, stabilitet och utvecklingskraft i Indiskas digitala plattformar.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi tror att du har 3–5 års erfarenhet av liknande roll, gärna från retail eller e-handel, och en god teknisk förståelse. Du har erfarenhet av systemintegrationer och projektledning, och trivs i en miljö där förändring är vardag. Har du dessutom arbetat med Power BI, Dynamics 365 eller andra affärssystem är det meriterande.
   

  

 Du har vana att arbeta tvärfunktionellt och vet hur man balanserar användarbehov, teknik och affärsmål. Med din kommunikativa förmåga skapar du samsyn och engagemang – oavsett om du samarbetar med utvecklare, E-com, kollegor i butik eller ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 Som person är du nyfiken och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera analys med kreativitet och vara med och bygga något nytt.
   

  

 Innovativa lösningar kommer naturligt, liksom ett tydligt fokus på resultat och kvalitet.
   

  

 Du skapar snabbt förtroende, samarbetar effektivt och prioriterar det som är viktigast.
   

  

 Som lagspelare delar du gärna med dig av kunskap och bidrar till en positiv teamkultur.
   

  

 Du är trygg i en föränderlig miljö, trivs i korsfunktionella samarbeten och använder ditt affärsdriv, din tekniska förståelse och din nyfikenhet för att driva utveckling och skapa värde i organisationen.
   

  

**Varför Indiska?**
 Indiska är ett svenskt livsstilsföretag etablerat 1901. Vi erbjuder en livfull blandning av mode, inredning och accessoarer – med inspiration från våra resor och en passion för hållbarhet, färg och form. Du hittar oss i våra 45 butiker i Sverige och Finland, samt online på indiska.com.
   

  

 Vi är ett företag i förändring – med korta beslutsvägar, stort engagemang och ett varmt hjärta. I den här rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Jobba tätt med affärsverksamheten och vara en viktig röst i beslutsprocesserna.
* Möjlighet att själv påverka prioriteringar, projekt och produktens utveckling.
* Frihet under ansvar och förtroende att driva dina idéer från tanke till resultat.
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där innovation, nyfikenhet och eget initiativ värdesätts.


 Du blir en central del av vår digitala transformationsresa, där tradition möter framtid och det finns gott om utrymme att bygga nytt. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt moderna kontor vid Torsplan i Stockholm.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi hoppas det! Vi intervjuar löpande, så ansök så snart som möjligt men senast den 30 november. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Forward Deployed ML Engineer
description:
**About the Company** 




 The company is a fast-growing AI infrastructure startup with offices in Stockholm, NYC, and San Francisco. They’ve reached high 8-figure ARR and recently raised a Series B at a $1.1B valuation. Thousands of customers rely on them for production AI workloads. Working at the company means joining one of the fastest-growing AI infrastructure organisations at an early stage, with ample opportunities to grow. Their team includes creators of popular open-source projects, academic researchers, international olympiad medalists, and experienced engineering and product leaders with decades of experience.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




 The company is looking for a Forward Deployed ML Engineer to help solve some of the most challenging AI/ML problems their customers face. In this role, the engineer will:
 


* Help customers (such as Lovable, Suno, and Mistral AI) architect and build complex AI applications
* Lead technical discovery sessions to understand customer infrastructure, requirements, and challenges
* Design, present, and implement technical solutions that meet customer needs
* Architect migration paths from existing cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure) to the company’s serverless platform
* Conduct demos, proof-of-concepts, and experiments to showcase the platform’s capabilities
* Optimise performance for open-source models and frameworks
* Collaborate with product and engineering teams to communicate customer feedback and influence the product roadmap
* Contribute to the core product and help the community build on top of it



  





**Qualifications** 
 :
 



 We are looking for somebody who has:
 


* At least a few years of professional ML engineering experience (or solutions engineering or similar)
* Strong Python skills (essential for the role)
* Experience with cloud platforms, containerization, and distributed systems
* Understanding of ML/AI infrastructure, MLOps workflows, and system design
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt explanations to different audiences
* Strong problem-solving, judgment, and business acumen
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams



  





  





**Why join the company?** 



* Work on cutting-edge AI/ML infrastructure used by innovative startups and enterprise clients
* Be part of a highly technical, ambitious, and supportive team
* Influence product development and customer success at scale
* Enjoy learning opportunities and potential for career growth in a fast-growing company



  





  





 Sound like a fit? We’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 For more information or questions, contact zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com
 



  





  





***Please note that we are a recruitment consultancy hiring on behalf of a client***

title: Styr- och reglertekniker – Telge Nät
description:
Välj Telge – här får du kombinera affärsmässighet med samhällsnytta och som medarbetare får du frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka.
   

  

 Så här säger Anders Viberg, Gruppchef Anläggningar VA om rollen:
   

  

 ”Hos oss får du inte bara ett spännande och varierande arbete. Du blir också en del av ett team med härliga kollegor och en arbetsplats med hög standard. Vi brinner för att ständigt förbättra och säkra driften i våra anläggningar. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra verklig skillnad.”
   

  

 Uppdrag och kompetenskrav
   

  

 Som styr- och reglertekniker arbetar du med underhåll, optimering och dokumentation av VA:s styr- och reglersystem. I arbetet ingår programmering och felsökning i styr- och driftövervakningssystem inom SCADA-miljö. Samt att optimera och utveckla befintlig processövervakning. Du ansvarar även för informationsutbyte mellan VA-enheten och IT-systemförvaltning. Som styr- och reglertekniker ingår du i en grupp som hjälps åt att lösa uppgifter och vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Detta är en ny roll för oss på Telge och vi vill att du är med och formar den rollen.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du
   

  

* Har en utbildning i styr- och reglerteknik, el eller automation på minst gymnasienivå eller motsvarande.
* Har programmeringsvana och några års erfarenhet av arbete med styrsystem. Du är även van vid att programmera PLC och vana av Dripdrop, Mitsubishi och ABB:s styrenheter.
* Har erfarenhet av ombyggnation i styrskåp.
* Är ansvarstagande, självgående och problemlösande med god samarbetsförmåga.
* Ser förbättringsmöjligheter och gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra.
* Har god samarbetsförmåga och samverkar genom att främja och utveckla andras idéer.


 Om du har erfarenhet av någon eller några av följande är det ett plus:
   

  

* Kunskap om SCADA-system och Cactus Eye, arbete inom VA-verksamhet.
* Kunskaper om styrning av pumpflöden, el-behörighet.
* Vana av arbete med stora processenheter.


 Bra svenska och kunskaper i Office-paketet är andra förmågor som också behövs för den här tjänsten. B-körkort är ett krav. Tjänsten kan komma att omfattas av bakgrundskontroll och säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Välj Telge
   

  

 Inom Telge finns alla möjligheter för dig att själv forma din framtid. Här finns det plats att växa, både i sin yrkesroll och som människa. Telge är en arbetsplats med trygga anställningsvillkor. Du som anställd hos oss omfattas av kollektivavtal där viktiga saker som försäkringar och pension ingår.
   

  

 Här får du mindre pussel och mer liv. Att ha balans mellan arbetslivet och den privata sfären är viktig för ett hållbart liv. Så långt det är möjligt at vi flexibla arbetstider där var och en styr över sin tid. Vi har en rad förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till löneväxling så att du kan växla in din lön mot extra tjänstepensionssparande.
   

  

 Läs mer om några av våra medarbetare som valt Telge: Vi valde Telge
   

  

 Mångfald inkludering och trygghet
   

  

 Vi på Telge arbetar aktivt för mångfald och inkludering och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser. En trygg och säker arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet. Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i våra rekryteringsprocesser till chefs- och specialisttjänster och vi genomför återkommande, slumpmässiga drogtester bland alla våra medarbetare.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdatum
   

  

 30 november 2025
   

  

 Några frågor?
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Då är det rekryterande chef Anders Viberg du ska kontakta, på 08-550 212 61. Fackliga kontakter är vision@telge.se för Vision och Magnus Enderin för SACO, du når båda på 08-550 220 00.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på att läsa mer om oss?
   

  

 Läs mer om oss som arbetsgivare: Jobba hos oss
   

  

 Läs mer om Telge Nät
   

  

 Styr- och reglertekniker – Telge Nät
   

  

 https:/ / www.telge.se/ jobba-hos-oss/ lediga-tjanster/ styr--och-reglertekniker--telge-nat/

 This role demands an expert proficient in managing enterprise-scale hybrid infrastructure and capable of providing strategic technical guidance. A strong grasp of Zero Trust Security principles and modern infrastructure best practices is essential

title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
**CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER**
**Permobil** 
 is a global leader in advanced mobility and assistive technology solutions, dedicated to empowering people living with disabilities through innovation and clinical insight. Founded in Sweden in 1967, the company combines a legacy of compassion and technical excellence with a strong global presence – operating in over 70 countries with 2,000 employees. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB, Permobil has the stability and long-term vision to continue driving evidence-based innovation that enhances independence, dignity, and quality of life for its users.
   

  

**Position Overview** 
  

  

 The opportunity to join Permobil in the newly established role as
 **Chief Operating Officer** 
 comes at a pivotal moment in the company’s evolution. Under the leadership of President & CEO Chuck Witkowski, Permobil is accelerating its transformation into an even more agile, data-driven, and globally integrated organization.
   

  

 The Chief Operating Officers will play a critical role in shaping and executing this transformation, driving operational excellence across global supply chains, manufacturing, quality, and service delivery, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and cross-functional collaboration.
   

  

 This is more than a leadership role, it’s a chance to help redefine what’s possible in the world of assistive technology. The incoming COO will join a highly experienced and mission-driven executive team, working at the intersection of healthcare, technology, and human impact. For a leader who thrives in complex, purpose-led environments, this is a rare opportunity to make a lasting difference, both within the organization and in the lives of thousands of people around the world who rely on Permobil’s solutions every day.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Align manufacturing and supply chain strategies with Permobil’s vision, partnering with innovation teams to scale new designs into production and developing KPIs for operational excellence,
* Champion Extreme Manufacturing (XM) practices, fostering a culture of rapid prototyping, digital manufacturing, and continuous improvement,
* Direct global operations across manufacturing, procurement, logistics, and supply chain, optimizing processes for quality, scalability, and efficiency,
* Build and maintain a resilient supplier network, optimize inventory and logistics, and collaborate with R&D to integrate new technologies into the supply chain,
* Embed sustainability and ethical standards into all operations, ensuring compliance and minimizing environmental impact,
* Drive the adoption of Extreme Manufacturing (XM) principles and advanced technologies (e.g., 3D printing, AI, robotics) to accelerate innovation and enable modular, efficient production systems,
* Monitor financial performance, ensuring cost optimization and identifying opportunities for productivity gains and value creation,
* Lead, coach, and empower high-performing global teams, fostering collaboration, innovation, and a unified company culture,
* Proactively identify and mitigate operational and supply chain risks, building agile systems to adapt to change and ensure continuity,
* Provide regular updates to global management, representing operations and supply chain in strategic forums and ensuring alignment with company goals.


**Qualifications & Skills:**
* A bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations management, supply chain, or a related field is required (an MBA or equivalent advanced degree is preferred),
* Extensive experience in global operations, manufacturing, and supply chain management, ideally in the medical device or advanced manufacturing sectors,
* Proven track record of implementing advanced manufacturing methodologies (e.g., lean, agile, digital manufacturing),
* Experience leading large-scale operational transformations and digitalization initiatives,
* Strong commercial and financial acumen with experience in P&L management,
* Understanding of diverse cultures and international corporate operations,
* Comprehensive understanding of regulatory frameworks and technological trends in manufacturing and supply chain,
* Deep knowledge of Extreme Manufacturing principles and ability to drive their adoption across a global organization,
* Proven ability to manage large-scale budgets and drive cost optimization and productivity improvements,
* Experience in leading and motivating diverse teams, building a strong company culture, and nurturing talent,
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to engage and influence key stakeholders globally.


**Who are you?**
 You are a visionary leader with a sharp strategic mind, always looking beyond the horizon to anticipate market trends and drive innovation. Your ability to translate big-picture thinking into actionable strategies sets you apart, ensuring operational agility and sustained growth. In times of change, you remain resilient and adaptable, confidently guiding teams through transformation and embracing new opportunities. Integrity is at the core of your leadership—you uphold the highest ethical standards, foster a culture of transparency, and hold yourself and others accountable. Your commitment to strong governance and responsible decision-making inspires trust and empowers those around you to achieve excellence.
   

  

  

  

**Why is this role a perfect next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day.  Everything we do leads to improving the lives of the people who use our products. Through our evidence-based innovations, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future.  We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you personally make could change the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **November 30th** 
 at the latest. We welcome applicants from all locations.
   

  

 The recruitment process is managed in partnership with Korn Ferry.
   

  

 For more information about the position and recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com or Jennie Olsson, Senior Associate at Korn Ferry, jennie.olsson@kornferry.com
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.

title: eCommerce/Retail Program Manager
description:
We are looking for a
 **eCommerce/Retail Program Manager** 
 who has 15+ years of experience
 



  





**Experience Required** 



* Five or more years of experience in an upper-management role, preferably in program management
* Exceptional skills in leadership, time management, facilitation, and organization
* Experience in managing stakeholders
* Working knowledge of digital marketing
* Outstanding knowledge of change management principles and performance evaluation processes



  





**Generic Managerial Skills** 



* Write and update titles, descriptions, and attributes with search engine optimization in mind
* Ensure high-quality photos and consistent information across platforms
* Track listing errors that can block visibility or affect rankings
* Strong interpersonal skills and effective collaboration with team members, clients, and others
* Experience in leading a technical team and interacting with stakeholders for requirement gathering and Analysis
* Interacting with offshore team and coordinating delivery



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Program Manager with eCommerce experience is must, should be well versed with MS Office tools
* Develop and maintain the overall program roadmap, timelines, and governance structure
* Coordinate across multiple teams, including IT, digital, marketing, product management, operations, and customer service
* Ensure clear and transparent communication with business stakeholders and facilitate collaboration between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure shared understanding and buy-in
* Provide regular updates on program status, risks, and issues to executive sponsors and stakeholders and prepare materials such as slide decks for steering committee meetings and governance board meetings
* Serve as the primary point of contact for senior leadership, external vendors and partners
* work closely with change management teams to develop training, communication, and rollout plans
* Ensure the solution meets business requirements, compliance standards, and quality benchmarks



  





**Company Description:** 




 Techaxis is a EU-based firm that specializes in discovering, engaging, and placing top talent globally, for full-time or contract positions in leadership and mid to senior-level positions for companies in the technology, healthcare, energy, and education space. Techaxis Inc. is headquartered in Northern Virginia, USA. We are ranked #3294 in Inc 5000 and #105 in Inc 5000 DC Metro Series, SWaM, and WBE Certified technology talent search firm.
 



  





**Equal Opportunities Employer:** 




 Our clients provide equal opportunities to all its employees and all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to their race, caste, religion, color, ancestry, marital status, sex, age, nationality, disability, and veteran status. Employees of our client shall be treated with dignity and in accordance with their policy to maintain a work environment free of sexual harassment, whether physical, verbal, or psychological. Employee policies and practices shall be administered in a manner that would ensure that in all matters equal opportunity is provided to those eligible and the decisions are merit-based.

title: Chief Commercial Officer
description:
**O’Learys is looking for a bold, tech-driven and results-oriented Chief Commercial Officer to shape the future of our business.** 
 This is not a traditional C-suite role — it’s for someone who combines commercial sharpness with modern marketing execution, an AI-first mindset and passion for creating measurable impact. AI-native is how we market, personalize and operate effectively to reach our targets — it’s not just about using tools, but about building a culture where AI drives smarter decisions, faster execution, and better results.
   

  

 As our CCO, you’ll lead with a mix of strategic vision and hands-on execution, using digital tools and AI to accelerate our marketing, CRM, and guest experience. Since opening in 1988, O’Learys has grown into so much more than a traditional sports bar. Today, we offer a one-of-a-kind experience that combines delicious American-inspired food, thrilling sports, and interactive social activities – all under one roof. It’s this unique mix that keeps guests staying longer, coming back often, and creating unforgettable moments together.
   

  

**As O’Learys CCO, you will:**
* Set and execute the commercial strategy across marketing, brand, CRM, and offering (food, beverage and activities).
* Provide world-class support to O’Learys franchisees to reach like-for-like growth.
* Use new technologies and AI tools to improve efficiency, personalization, and performance in marketing and communication.
* Lead, inspire, and coach a strong commercial team of 10 people.
* Negotiate partnerships and manage key stakeholders to drive top-line growth.
* Ensure O’Learys Group remains at the forefront of digital innovation.
* Be part of the Management Team, and play an active role in shaping the company’s future.


**A glimpse into a day of our CCO:** 
 Start the day by reviewing last week’s sales and KPIs together with the team, celebrating wins and spotting opportunities for growth. Collaborate with the CRM Manager to shape the next phase of our loyalty program strategy. Later, meet one of our franchisees on-site to explore new ways O’Learys can support them in reaching their targets.
   

  

 In your first year, you’ll focus on launching our CRM and loyalty program, boosting online conversion, rolling out a new booking widget, amplifying our marketing impact and ensuring our support toolbox is used to its full potential.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re not the “old-school” marketing executive — you’re part strategist, part doer, and 100% growth-oriented. You combine commercial instinct with a digital mindset and thrive in fast-moving environments. We believe you are a generalist who knows how to make things happen - you manage projects and teams with confidence, collaboration, and humility.
   

  

**You bring:**
* A strong grasp of digital marketing tools, automation, and AI (e.g. Meta/Google Ads, CRM platforms, ChatGPT, Midjourney, etc.).
* Proven results in driving measurable business impact.
* Sharp negotiation and project management skills — you know how to set high standards and get things done.
* Experience leading teams and cross-functional projects in dynamic organizations.
* We do not require industry-specific experience. With the right mindset and approach, we believe you can effectively familiarize yourself with and navigate a variety of situations and challenges.


**Personal Qualities**
* Entrepreneurial, bold, and commercially driven.
* Confident and clear communicator — you inspire both your team and stakeholders.
* Curious, hands-on, and hungry to test new ideas and tools.
* Strong sense of accountability — you care about performance.


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to shape the commercial future of O’Learys.
* A high-energy culture where ideas, speed, and execution matter.
* A team of driven, passionate colleagues who love what they do.
* The chance to be part of renowned brand with a truly engaging core offering.

title: Data Engineer (Databricks)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Data Engineer with a Databricks focus, you will be building scalable and secure data platforms. You will leverage your expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, as well as Azure to design, develop, and implement data warehouses, data lakehouses, and AI/ML models that fuel our data-driven operations.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key part in:*
* Designing and building high-performance data pipelines: Utilize Databricks and Apache Spark to extract, transform, and load data into Azure Data Lake Storage and other Azure services.
* Develop and maintain secure data warehouses and data lakehouses: Implement data models, data quality checks, and governance practices to ensure reliable and accurate data.
* Building and deploying AI/ML models: Integrate Machine Learning into data pipelines, leverage Databricks ML and Azure ML to develop predictive models and drive business insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with business analysts, data scientists, and DevOps engineers to ensure successful data platform implementations.


**Your profile**
* Professional experience of working with Data Engineering
* Fluent Swedish skills - you have the ability to communicate in a professional context
* Proven expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, and data pipeline development and strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including Azure Data Lake Storage, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory.
* Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages like Python and hands-on experience with AI/ML concepts and tools.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies in line with your ambitions.


**Your Application**
*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Security GRC Analyst
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 Juni is seeking a Security GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) Analyst to play a crucial role in aligning our information security posture with industry best practices, regulatory requirements, and internal policies. As a Level 2 analyst, you will demonstrate significant independence in your work, taking ownership of maintaining and improving our security governance framework. This role is key to managing risks, ensuring compliance, and fostering a strong security culture across the organisation. You will work closely with various departments to implement, monitor, and enhance our security controls.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

**Governance & Documentation**
* Maintain and update core security documentation, including policies, procedures, and instructions, ensuring they remain current and relevant.
* Identify, collect, and analyse data to track key security performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics, generating reports and dashboards to communicate security performance to stakeholders


**Risk Management**
* Maintain the risk register and support daily risk management activities with growing independence.
* Follow up on the remediation of risks identified in new projects, third-party engagements, and other business initiatives.
* Conduct thorough security posture assessments of new vendors and perform periodic reviews of existing ones.
* Support our 3rd party procurement process.


**Compliance & Controls**
* Monitor the implementation and effectiveness of security controls across the organisation.
* Coordinate and support activities to maintain key security certifications, including PCI-DSS and ISO 27001.
* Coordinate and support the implementation of remediation plans to address identified compliance gaps.
* Provide support in responding to security-related questions during partner due diligence and assist in providing necessary information for cyber insurance renewals.
* Coordinate and support internal audits by providing requested information and addressing audit findings.


**Collaboration & Business Acumen**
* Develop and implement tailored security training and awareness programs for different roles, complementing existing initiatives.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of the Digital Operational Resilience Strategy.
* Understand the business context behind the team's work and make decisions aligned with overall team and company objectives.


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Slack
* G-suite
* Formalize
* Linear
* Vanta


**Qualifications 👑**
* 2 to 4 years of experience in information security governance, risk, or compliance roles.
* Demonstrated experience with compliance frameworks and regulations (e.g., PCI DSS, ISO 27001, GDPR, PSD2, EBA outsourcing and DORA).
* Knowledge of security frameworks (e.g., CIS Controls, NIST CSF).
* Solid understanding of risk assessment methodologies and hands-on experience with risk registers and third-party risk management.
* Experience in coordinating activities for security certifications and audits.
* Ability to develop and track security metrics (KPIs).
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organisational skills.
* Excellent communication skills, comfortable presenting to various stakeholders.
* A proactive and independent worker who is also a strong team player.
* Experience in the financial services or fintech industry is a plus.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation. 30 days.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


**Additional Information 📌**
* Please note that we are unable to sponsor work visas at this time. Therefore, having a valid work permit for Sweden is a requirement for this role.
* Dear recruitment agencies: we love your enthusiasm, but no calls, emails, or carrier pigeons, please. We’re keeping this one in-house


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Konsultansvarig Managementkonsult
description:
***Att driva förändring är svårt. Att förenkla den – det är en konst.
   

  

 På BiTA hjälper vi verksamheter att utvecklas genom att få ihop människor, teknik och arbetssätt. Vi kallar det Operativ Excellens – och vi söker dig som vill vara med och skapa den.***
**Rollen**
 Som Konsultansvarig Managementkonsult får du en central roll i att bygga och utveckla BiTAs affär. Du arbetar i gränslandet mellan strategi och leverans, där du både leder och själv deltar i uppdrag som gör skillnad för våra kunder.
   

  

 Du:
   

  

* Driver uppdrag inom IT Service Management, förändringsledning och verksamhetsutveckling.
