* Bidrar aktivt till affärsutveckling och försäljning – du ser möjligheter, tar initiativ och gillar att vara nära kund.
* Har leveransansvar för andra konsulter och säkerställer kvalitet, kundnöjdhet och teamkänsla.
* Är med och formar vårt erbjudande och vår kultur – BiTA vill växa, och du har chansen att påverka riktningen.
* Kort sagt: du blir en nyckelspelare i ett bolag som värderar kvalitet, hjärta och affärssinne lika högt.


**Vem vi tror att du är**
 Du är en erfaren managementkonsult som trivs med att både tänka och göra.
   

  

 Du har arbetat med att utveckla IT-nära verksamheter och vet hur man skapar struktur, kultur och engagemang i förändring.
   

  

 Du har troligen erfarenhet av:
   

  

* IT Service Management och ramverk som ITIL, pm³, DevOps eller ISO/IEC 27001.
* Att driva förändrings- och förbättringsarbete i komplexa organisationer.
* Affärsutveckling, kunddialoger och försäljning – du gillar att påverka och skapa nya möjligheter.
* Att leda andra konsulter eller leveranser – du får energi av att se andra lyckas.


 Hos oss kombinerar du eget ansvar med samarbete i teamet, alltid med sikte på hög kvalitet och kundnytta.
   

  

**Om BiTA**
 Vi är skickliga på att förstå, förklara och stötta i digitalisering och verksamhetsutveckling.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder IT-driven verksamhetsutveckling till offentliga och privata verksamheter som vill göra skillnad och samtidigt förbättra sin förmåga att skapa intern effektivitet och leverera kundnytta – vi kallar det för Operativ Excellens.
   

  

 Vi är inte perfekta, långt ifrån. Men vi anstränger oss varje dag att göra våra kunder och oss själva bättre än vi var igår. Vi vill ha nya kollegor som tillsammans med oss utvecklar verksamheten och delar vår vision att förenkla förändring.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.
 



  





 Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 We are looking for a versatile data engineer with strong software engineering skills to join our Partner Ecosystem team. In this role, you will be a major contributor in designing and implementing the big data pipelines—real-time and batch-powering our products. Moreover, you will contribute in enabling Hive Products by working closely with our partner video platforms, such as Microsoft Teams Town Hall and Vimeo!
 



  





**Working As a Data Engineer, You Will** 



* Design and implement big data pipelines on top of our data platform.
* Develop solutions leveraging our tech stack: Spark/Scala, Databricks and Delta lake.
* Work on end-to-end delivery of data to our applications.
* Contribute to shaping our product by bringing insights and innovative ideas to discussions.
* Collaborate with the team to engineer high-quality and reliable solutions.
* Help analyze our data to improve our products



  





**Working In Partner Eco, You Will** 



* Design and implement our clients for the collection of data
* Work closely with our partner developers to enable Hive with high quality
* Own the data from the collection to its manipulation
* Align and want to live by our core values: customer-centricity, innovation, and empowerment.



  





**More Details** 




**Role type:** 
 Full-timewith a standard probation period
 



**Start date:** 
 Jan/Feb 2026 (flexible)
 



**Working hours:** 
 Align with CET (Central European Time)
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: ±2 days/week in the office), can consider Berlin, Germany
 



*🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!* 




  





**Who we are looking for** 




 We're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation — but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We also don’t expect you to tick every box. If you’re excited about this role and ready to learn, we’d love to hear from you!
 



**We Are Looking For Someone With** 



* Bachelors within Computer Science or a similar field, or equivalent experience
* Expert in Apache Spark and/or other distributed data processing frameworks
* Experience in delivering tested and maintainable code in projects with multiple contributors
* Knowledgeable in cloud environments and familiar with common cloud-native data storages



**We See It As a Bonus If You Have** 



* Experience in TypeScript or JavaScript
* Prior experience working with video streaming solutions, networking, and/or peer-to-peer
* Experience with mentorship or informal leadership



**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are** 



* A team player, who shares information and expertise, promotes team effectiveness by facilitating and building on the ideas of others
* Resourceful, who are quick to change behavior to adapt to changing circumstances
* A problem solver, who loves challenges and finding creative, practical solutions
* A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood
* Service-minded, who has a visible approach and shows sincere interest in customers and their concerns



  





**Why join Hive?** 



* Global Impact: Partner with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and diverse environment that values curiosity, rapid learning, and new perspectives.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.
* Great Benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!
* Flexibility: We value flexibility and trust. Whether you’re balancing personal commitments or exploring new ideas, you’ll find support and autonomy here with flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.



  





**Recruitment process: what to expect** 




 To apply, please submit your CV and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English. Please submit applications by November 21st.
 



  





 Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:
 


1. Intro call: Meet our People & Talent Partner for a chat about your background, motivation, and what excites you about Hive. You’ll also learn more about our culture and how we work.
2. Hiring manager interview: Meet Claudio, one of our Engineering Managers and your potential future manager. This conversation focuses on your experience, career goals, and how you could contribute to the team.
3. Technical interview: Complete an at-home assessment, which will form the basis of a technical discussion with members of the Partner Ecosystem team. Together, you’ll explore your approach to problem-solving and technical design.
4. Data engineering interview: Meet a member of our Data Guild for a final conversation focused on team fit, ways of working, and your approach to data engineering. This is also your chance to ask questions and get a deeper sense of our data culture at Hive.
5. Reference checks: We take security seriously and conduct two reference checks as part of our compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
6. Decision: Timely feedback and next steps - our goal is to complete the process within around 4 weeks, depending on your availability.

title: Manager - Acceleration Team
description:
*Saab is evolving fast — and software and AI are at the core. Be part of that acceleration. Join the team that empowers Saab’s developers — and play a key role in modernising our software engineering landscape.*
 Your role
   

  

 In this role, you will lead an acceleration team within Common Tech, consisting of software developers who work closely with our business areas in developing SAAB wide modules and products. You will work closely with internal stakeholders and customers to ensure that your team’s initiatives deliver real value to the business.
   

  

 You are responsible for providing structure, clarity and direction in ongoing projects, creating the conditions for your team to succeed. The work involves close collaboration with leaders and colleagues across the organisation, and your leadership will be key to maintaining progress and alignment.
   

  

 As line manager, you have overall responsibility for the team and its operations. This includes leading and coaching team members to build engagement, development and performance, as well as managing all personnel-related matters such as recruitment, onboarding, competence development, budgeting and financial follow-up.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a strategic mindset who can also bring structure and clarity to complex work, and who is an inclusive and supportive leader, able to balance strategic and operational perspectives while fostering collaboration and development within their team.
   

  

 The key requirements for this role include:
   

  

* Proven experience leading technically complex or software-intensive projects.
* Understanding of industrial system development processes.
* Experience in leading and coaching teams to achieve engagement, development, and results.
* Strong organisational and planning skills to maintain structure and progress in projects.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Marketing & Digital Associate (Student placement)
description:
**Marketing and Digital Assistant**
* Location: Kungsholmen, Stockholm, Sweden
* Job type: This is a part-time position (maximum 15 hours per week) for 11 months, requiring office presence 1-2 days per week.


**About The Job**
 Are you ready to shape the future of healthcare? At Sanofi Sweden, we believe in the power of fresh perspectives and innovative thinking that students bring to our organization. As a cornerstone of our corporate culture, student engagement drives innovation and helps us reimagine healthcare solutions for tomorrow.
   

  

 As our Marketing and Digital Assistant, you'll dive into exciting projects that matter. You'll create compelling digital content, contribute to real marketing campaigns, and collaborate with industry professionals who value your unique insights. This hands-on role gives you the chance to see your ideas come to life while building a portfolio of work that stands out to future employers.
   

  

 Join us and turn classroom theory into real-world impact. Develop in-demand skills in digital marketing, gain exposure to global healthcare initiatives, and build your professional network—all while helping advance healthcare solutions that improve lives across Sweden and beyond.
   

  

 This isn't just work experience—it's your launchpad into an exciting career in healthcare innovation!
   

  

**About Sanofi**
 We’re an R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company committed to improving people’s lives and delivering compelling growth. Our deep understanding of the immune system – and innovative pipeline – enables us to invent medicines and vaccines that treat and protect millions of people around the world. Together, we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Supporting campaigns and projects: assist in creating, coordinating, and rolling out local marketing and digital initiatives that align with Sanofi’s strategy
* Contributing to communications: help prepare engaging content (presentations, newsletters, social media materials) that connect with both internal and external audiences
* Organizing events and meetings: take part in planning and running team activities, workshops, or external events that bring colleagues and partners together
* Data & insights: collect, analyze, and present data to support decision-making and show impact from projects
* Collaboration & cross-learning: work closely with colleagues from different teams and functions, experiencing firsthand what it’s like to be part of an international, matrix organization
* Continuous improvement: share fresh ideas, challenge the status quo, and suggest new ways of working to make our processes smoother and more impactful


**About You**
**We are looking for motivated and curious students who:**
* Are currently enrolled in a university program (life sciences, pharmacy, business, or related fields)
* Are eager to learn, collaborate, and contribute – and bring fresh ideas to the table
* Have good communication skills and are comfortable expressing ideas in both Swedish and English
* Enjoy working with digital tools, social media, and data, and can adapt quickly to new systems (experience in MS Office 365 is a plus)
* Are proactive, organized, and able to manage multiple tasks while staying detail-oriented
* Are excited about building networks and learning in an international environment
* Can commute easily to the Stockholm office


**Why choose us?**
* Opportunity to kickstart your career in the healthcare industry with potential for future growth
* Gain hands-on experience in a leading global healthcare company while pursuing your studies
* Work alongside experienced professionals in an international, matrix organization
* Contribute to meaningful projects that impact patients’ lives
* Be part of a supportive and inclusive team culture
* Flexible work arrangement that allows you to balance your studies and work


**Pursue
 *Progress* 
 . Discover
 *Extraordinary* 
 .**
 Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
   

  

 Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
   

  

 null
 **Pursue** 
*Progress* 
 .
 **Discover** 
*Extraordinary* 
 .
   

  

 Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a data-driven and results-oriented
 **Growth Manager** 
 to join our marketing team at
 **Barnebys** 
 . In this role, you will be responsible for driving scalable growth across our digital ecosystem — optimizing traffic acquisition, conversion, and retention for both B2B and B2C audiences.
 



  





 You will own the strategy and execution of growth initiatives across channels, combining analytics, experimentation, and creativity to accelerate user acquisition and business outcomes.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Develop and execute growth strategies** 
 to increase qualified traffic, improve conversion rates, and drive overall user engagement, by finding new traffic sources, creating new partnerships, and taking advantage of modern tools and technologies like AI.
* **Monitor and optimize acquisition channels** 
 (organic, paid, referral, and partnerships) to ensure efficient and sustainable traffic growth.
* **Design, run, and analyze experiments** 
 (A/B tests, landing pages, onboarding flows) to validate hypotheses and uncover growth opportunities.
* **Own end-to-end funnel analytics** 
 , identifying bottlenecks and opportunities across the user journey, and exceeding traffic goals
* **Collaborate cross-functionally** 
 with product, marketing, and design teams to enhance the user experience and maximize ROAS from campaigns.
* **Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports** 
 to track key metrics such as customer acquisition costs, conversion rates, and retention.
* **Provide actionable insights** 
 from data to inform decision-making and influence both marketing strategy and product roadmap.
* Stay up-to-date with
 **growth marketing trends, tools, and best practices** 
 , ensuring Barnebys remains at the forefront of digital innovation.



  





**Requirements** 



* 5+ years of experience in
 **growth marketing, performance marketing, or conversion optimization** 
 .
* Proven track record of
 **driving measurable growth** 
 through data-led experimentation and optimization.
* Strong understanding of
 **digital acquisition channels** 
 , marketing funnels, and customer lifecycle metrics.
* Proficiency with
 **Google Analytics, Tag Manager** 
 , and marketing automation or attribution tools.
* Experience with
 **data visualization** 
 (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and
 **A/B testing platforms** 
 .
* Solid grasp of
 **SEO, SEM, CRO, and user journey optimization** 
 .
* Exceptional
 **analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills** 
 — able to translate complex data into clear business recommendations. You love digging into funnels, cohorts, and data insights.
* Entrepreneurial mindset:
 **curious, experimental, self-starter** 
 , and comfortable working across multiple growth levers.
* Bonus if you have experience from
 **e-commerce or the auction industry** 
 .



  





**What We Offer** 



* A dynamic, collaborative work environment at the intersection of design, auctions, and technology.
* The opportunity to lead data-driven growth initiatives with real impact on global user engagement and client success.
* Access to rich datasets and a passionate, cross-functional team ready to experiment and innovate.



  





**Working Location** 




 We value in-person collaboration and expect regular presence at our
 **central Stockholm office** 
 .
 



  





**About Barnebys** 




 At Barnebys, we're not just changing the auction industry – we're
 **revolutionizing it** 
 . As a cutting-edge tech company and an independent marketplace, we're building a world-class ecosystem for art, antiques, and collectibles.
 



  





 Our platform supports every step of the auction process – from registration to bidding and secure payments – and is trusted by industry leaders. With over
 **600,000 items** 
 available for sale, a comprehensive
 **database of auction results** 
 , and
 **powerful valuation tools** 
 , Barnebys is the go-to solution for collectors, galleries, and auction houses worldwide.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Help shape the future of data at Schibsted**
 Are you passionate about creating clarity in complex tech environments and connecting dots across teams, needs and platforms? We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our Data Platforms team within Schibsted’s Data & AI organisation. In this role, you’ll report to team's Engineering Manager and together you'll drive strategic planning, support stakeholder collaboration, and help ensure our data platform delivers clear value across Schibsted’s media brands in the Nordics.
   

  

 Your work will include shaping and communicating the platform roadmap, aligning with business needs, and gathering use cases across the organisation. You’ll act as a key contact for platform users, support cross-team coordination, and contribute to long-term strategic direction — always with a focus on clarity, collaboration and real impact.
   

  

 We believe this is a great role for someone who thrives in collaborative, cross-functional environments and who is motivated by helping strong technical teams succeed at scale.
   

  

 You’ll likely thrive here if you're a strong communicator with a track record of simplifying complexity, someone who collaborates naturally across tech, product and data teams, and is skilled in stakeholder management. Curiosity, adaptability and comfort in agile, technical settings will also serve you well.
   

  

 As for experience, we’re looking for someone with a background in product, project or program management — ideally within data, ad-tech or infrastructure domains. Familiarity with modern data and analytical tools like Snowflake, Amplitude, dbt or Kafka is a big plus, as is experience from data engineering, analytics or tracking. If you’ve worked in large, matrix organisations and know how to bring structure and focus, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 At Schibsted, we don’t just talk about impact — we build for it. We offer:
   

  

* Professional development – access to Schibsted Learning Lab
* Health & wellbeing support
* Modern equipment & tools – Mac/PC, phone, relevant software
* Meaningful mission – working with brands that support democracy, trust, and independent journalism
* Internal mobility – career growth opportunities across brands and teams

title: Teknisk Projektledning
description:
**Om uppdraget:**
 Vår kund ska implementera en flygplatsdriftsplan (AOP) för Arlanda flygplats. Syftet med AOP:n är att skapa en gemensam situationsbild för flygplatsens olika intressenter, öka förutsägbarheten och effektiviteten i verksamheten, samt fungera som ett verktyg för att minimera effekterna av störningar.
   

  

 Som en del av detta arbete kommer vår kund att upphandla en SaaS-lösning som kommer att användas av flygplatsens operativa intressenter – såsom flygplatsoperatören, marktjänstföretaget, flygbolaget, flygtrafiktjänstleverantören, gränspolisen, tull etc.
   

  

 Den upphandlade lösningen kommer att integreras med flera olika datakällor och system via kundens integrationsplattform med hjälp av API:er. Prognosmodeller för kapacitets- och efterfrågeinformation kommer att utvecklas av kunden, medan dataaggregering och beräkning av KPI:er kommer att hanteras i kundens BI-plattform.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning:**
 Vi söker en erfaren teknisk projektledare som ansvarar för implementeringen av
 **AOP-lösningen** 
 i sin helhet – både införandet av den upphandlade lösningen och utvecklingen av de komponenter som ligger på kundens sida.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med projektets huvudprojektledare och omfattar ansvar för den tekniska delen av leveransen. Du kommer att arbeta i en komplex miljö med många intressenter och bidra till att säkerställa kvalitet, stabila leveranser och effektiva integrationslösningar.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är driven, noggrann, lyhörd och kommunikativ, med en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende och samverka över organisationsgränser.
   

  

**Skallkrav:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av teknisk projektledning av komplexa IT-projekt, inklusive multi-cloud-miljöer (t.ex. Azure, Google Cloud eller AWS).
* Du ska ha drivit tekniska projekt med dokumenterat goda resultat och fokus på leverans, kvalitet och samarbete.
* Bakgrund inom systemutveckling.
* Stor kunskap om, och erfarenhet av, agil arbetsmetodik, inklusive planering och ledning av sprintar.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta tätt med projektledare, IT-arkitekter, utvecklare och externa leverantörer.
* Mycket god samarbets- och ledarskapsförmåga, med starka färdigheter i kommunikation och problemlösning i komplexa miljöer.
* Stor teknisk förståelse inom systemutveckling, systemintegration, BI och molnlösningar.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet


**Meriterande :**
* Erfarenhet av att konfigurera federerad autentisering och Azure Entra ID.


**Erfarenhet:**
**Kunskap** 
 : Hög kompetens inom området.
   

  

**Erfarenhet** 
 : God kunskap och erfarenhet inom åberopat område, vanligtvis som konsult.
   

  

**Ledning** 
 : Kan ta ansvar för kompetensområdet och leda en mindre grupp.
   

  

**Självständighet** 
 :Kan arbeta självständigt.
   

  

**Startdatum:** 
 2026-01-14
 **Längd:** 
 2027-12-31
   

  

**Möjlighet till distansarbete/Flextid:** 
 Ja, när arbetet tillåter. Kontoret ligger på Arlanda flygplats.
   

  

**Arbetstid: 100% -40 /h**
**Möjlighet till förlängning:** 
 Ja
   

  

**Information gällande säkerhetsprövning:**
 Varje kund ställer höga krav på konsultens säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll och undertecknande av säkerhetsskyddsavtal enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan genomföras av konsulten och konsultens arbetsgivare innan uppdragsavtalet kan verkställas.
   

  

**Intervju:**
 Konsult/Leverantör kan bli kallad till intervju för att fastställa kvalifikationskrav vid behov.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-11-06. Vi erbjuder dock ofta löpande erbjudanden. Det innebär att vi ibland tar bort uppdraget från vår webbplats tidigare än sista ansökningsdag. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du ansöker omgående.
   

  

**Nödvändiga färdigheter:**
 Google Cloud, Driva tekniska projekt, Azure, Entra ID/Azure AD, Erfarenhet av att driva komplexa IT-projekt, Systemintegration
   

  

 Minst 5 års erfarenhet av teknisk projektledning, BAKGRUND INOM SYSTEMUTVECKLING, Agila, agila arbetsmetoder
   

  

**Språk**
 Engelska, Svenska

title: Projektledare/Digital Produktägare i Stockholm
description:
**Just nu söker vi konsulter till hösten 2025. Vi är öppna för dialog om tidigare anställning givet att vi gemensamt kan säkra ett uppdrag tidigare.**
**Om oss**
 B3 Business Transformation är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom digitalisering och förändringsarbete. Vi brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder genom att leda komplexa projekt och utveckla nya arbetssätt. Vi fortsätter att växa och söker nu erfarna konsulter till vårt team med projektledare och strateger. Vill du utvecklas och inspireras i en miljö med erfarna, trevliga och prestigelösa kollegor i spännande uppdrag? Vi försöker leva som vi lär genom att kultur, utveckling och samarbete i teamet och bolaget med ett agilt och självorganiserande mindset som baseras på nyfikenhet, lust och utbyte av erfarenheter.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Som en del av vårt team får du tillgång till en dynamisk arbetsplats där din utveckling står i fokus. Vi erbjuder kompetensutveckling med tillgång till branschledande utbildningar och certifieringar. Du får möjlighet till spännande och varierande uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor. Vår arbetskultur präglas av öppenhet, samarbete och ambition att ligga i framkant. Du får också möjlighet att påverka och bidra till långsiktig förändring hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som konsult hos oss kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa uppdrag hos välkända kunder.
   

  

 Som projektledare arbetar du med att stötta kunders förändringsarbete - från strategi hela vägen till ett förändrat beteende och nya eller förbättrade IT-stöd. Du arbetar ofta med ledningen hos våra kunder för att ta fram tydliga beslutsunderlag och roadmaps för genomförande och du coachar organisationen i införande av nya arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som digital produktägare kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa projekt eller agila strömmar hos välkända kunder. Du får ta ansvar för att leverera meningsfulla och hållbara digitala produkter utifrån agila arbetssätt, användarcentrering samt data- och AI-drivet. Det handlar främst om initiativ som syftar till att utveckla det digitala kundmötet och se till att processer och system finns på baksidan stödjer förflyttningen. Ofta ingår även i uppdragen att stötta kundens organisation och leda förändring mot att jobba effektivt och modernt med agila metoder för att hantera vision, roadmap, backlog etc, samt i olika utsträckning även hantera kommersiella och affärsutvecklingsfrågor.
   

  

 Utöver rollerna ovan tror vi du kan ta någon eller några av rollerna som programledare, kravanalytiker, scrum Master, verksamhetsutvecklare eller andra liknande roller.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi är erfarna konsulter med bred branscherfarenhet och har vana av förändringsarbete genom digitalisering. Vi söker dig som har liknande erfarenheter som konsult och minst 5 års erfarenhet av digitala förändringsprojekt och en stark förståelse för hur digitalisering kan stärka affären och möjliggöra nya arbetssätt. Du vill vara aktiv och delaktig i den fortsatta utvecklingen av B3 Business Transformation och kan proaktivt vara med och bygga våra egna nätverk som bidrar till nya affärer och relationer. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att arbeta såväl strategiskt, taktiskt som operativt.
   

  

 I rollen som Projektledare ser vi gärna att du:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för arbetet kring organisation, roller, arbetssätt, styrning och kultur i större digitaliserings- och IT-projekt
* Intar rådgivarrollen och är trygga med att såväl utmana som stötta så väl ledningspersoner och verksamhet, samt har god förståelse av vad konsultmässighet innebär
* Har erfarenhet av att driva projekt från strategi till förvaltning


 I rollen som Digital Produktägare ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda agila digitala projekt och/eller agila produktteam som exempelvis större webbprojekt, digital självservice, digital försäljning/growth eller implementering av CRM
* En god förståelse för det digitala kundmötet, affär, design/UX, teknik och moderna agila arbetssätt


**Det är toppen om du även har erfarenhet av**
* Någon eller några verksamheter inom medlemsorganisationer, kommunal verksamhet, offentlig sektor, logistik, retail, återvinning och hållbarhetsområdet eller försvar
* Har relevanta certifieringar inom områden som SAFe, Prosci Change Management och andra specifika områden
* Produkter eller sammanhang där traditionell och/eller generativ AI har varit en del

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 2+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO (Nils)


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Processoperatör - Dagskift
description:
**Är du en problemlösare med öga för detaljer som vill arbeta med den senaste tekniken i en högteknologisk miljö?**
 Som processoperatör hos oss på Silex blir du en viktig del av ett världsledande företag inom MEMS-industrin. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en renrumsmiljö och bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens teknik.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Silex och vad vi gör? Läs mer här.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I den här rollen kommer du att arbeta från hjärtat av Silex – i den så kallade ”fabben” – där cirka 180 processoperatörer arbetar i femskift, dygnet runt, året om. Som processoperatör kommer du att vara delaktig i flera olika tillverkningssteg med varierande utrustning i renrumsmiljö.
   

  

 Just nu söker vi personer till dagskiftet: måndag–torsdag 06:50–14:45, fredag 06:50–13:30.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
 Arbetet utförs i renrum med renrumskläder (renrumsdräkt, skyddsglasögon, munskydd etc.). I rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Processa skivor enligt givna instruktioner i Silex körjournal
* Utföra mikroskopavsyning av enskilda kiselskivor
* Medverka vid och genomföra processkontroller av utrustning
* Arbeta med varierande uppgifter beroende på område – t.ex. SPC:er, maskinbearbetning, kvalitetstestning, mikroskopavsyningar, hantering av kemikalier och ugnar m.m.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har gymnasieexamen
* Talar flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
* Har erfarenhet från produktion, lager eller annat strukturerat arbete med tydliga rutiner och krav


**Som person är du:**
* Tekniskt intresserad och nyfiken på att lära dig och utvecklas inom en högteknologisk verksamhet
* Noggrann och har en stadig hand för precisionsarbete
* Strukturerad och har förmåga att planera och prioritera ditt arbete
* Lugn, med ett gott humör även i stressiga situationer
* En teamplayer med god samarbetsförmåga som prestigelöst fokuserar på gemensamma mål


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
* Ett nära samarbete med fantastiska kollegor
* Arbete med den allra senaste tekniken inom MEMS
* En plats på ett ledande företag som driver teknikutvecklingen framåt
* Stort kunskapsutbyte med världsledande experter inom MEMS-processintegration och -utveckling


**Om Silex:**
 Silex är världens största och mest avancerade renodlade MEMS-foundry med huvudkontor i Stockholm. MEMS finns i nästan all modern teknik – från personliga enheter och fordonselektronik till medicinsk utrustning och värmehanteringssystem.
   

  

 Med ett team av expertingenjörer, operatörer, tekniker, specialister och andra nyckelpersoner förverkligar Silex idéer och koncept från branschens ledande MEMS-innovatörer.
   

  

 Silex samlar några av de mest talangfulla, nyfikna, visionära och målinriktade personerna för att tillsammans med kunder bryta ny mark och utveckla den senaste MEMS-teknologin för globala tillämpningar. Hos oss arbetar du med världens största teknikföretag och innovationsledare inom medicin, life science, konsumentelektronik, telekommunikation, fordonsindustri och tillverkningsindustri.
   

  

**Övrig information:**
 För att ansöka, ladda upp ditt CV och svara på några korta frågor.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen är kompetensbaserad och kommer inledas med personlighetstest och logiktest. Dessa tester kommer följas av telefonavstämning, gruppintervju och referenstagning. Vi genomför även bakgrundskontroll och drogtest innan anställning. Som arbetsgivare tillämpar vi även slumpmässiga alkohol- och drogtester under anställningen.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan – bli en del av vår spännande resa!**
**About Silex**
 Sweden’s Silex Microsystems manufactures mechanical and electrical systems in micro scale, in the form of MEMS chips. MEMS technology makes it possible to produce pressure sensors that are small enough to be injected into the human bloodstream. Silex was founded in 2000, and now has an annual turnover of approximately SEK 1 billion and 350 employees. With around 80 active customers globally, Silex is one of the world’s leading independent MEMS manufacturers.
   

  

**Silex** 
 is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry. With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, engineers, support staff, specialists, and much more besides, Silex transforms the visionary ideas of the world’s leading MEMS innovators into reality.

title: Senior Buyer Indirect Procurement Nordics
description:
**Do you want to make the world a safer place?** 




*We are seeking a talented and hands-on* 
 Senior Buyer, Indirect Procurement Nordics,
 *to join our Nordic Headquarters in Solna (Stockholm).* 




  





**About the job** 




 As a Senior Buyer for Indirect Procurement at Verisure, you will be responsible for executing the indirect procurement function in the Nordics across assigned categories. Your mission is to generate value while ensuring compliance and effective risk management, from purchase requisition and negotiation to purchase order.
 



  





 This will include contributing to a Procurement Plan that maximizes advantages for Verisure, leading the execution of tenders (RFPs) from specification to contract signature, and influencing stakeholders to define and standardize their requirements, while ensuring compliance with Procurement processes and policy.
 



  





**What you’ll be up to** 
 :
 


* Execution of the Procurement Plan on categories under your responsibility, maximizing value and savings across the organization
* **Collaborate, support, and influence** 
 business leaders across all stages of procurement, from requisition to purchase order
* **Lead tenders (RFPs),** 
 supplier qualification, negotiation, and contract award in coordination with Legal and internal stakeholders
* **Draft and negotiate contracts** 
 ensuring compliance with company policies
* **Gather and define specifications** 
 for products and services in collaboration with business areas
* **Conduct market and spend analysis** 
 to identify opportunities and risks
* **Follow and report** 
 on risk mitigation actions and escalate issues when required
* **Monitor supplier performance** 
 against agreed KPIs and manage supplier relationships
* **Lead improvements** 
 within the Procurement department, including processes and policies
* **Support hands-on the ERP (Oracle) implementation** 
 and contribute to related change management initiatives



  





 It’s a communicative role where you will be the key link between business areas and suppliers. You’ll lead procurement discussions, represent the business in negotiations, and secure the best proposals for internal clients. By advising on supplier selection and keeping all parties informed, you’ll drive alignment, transparency, and successful outcomes throughout the process.
 



  





**About you** 




 To thrive and succeed as a Senior Buyer, we believe you are an excellent communicator and skilled negotiator, with the ability to influence stakeholders and lead procurement activities end-to-end. You are structured, analytical, and thrive in a fast-paced setting.
 



  





 We believe you have proven experience in sourcing indirect products and services, preferably in a large, complex organization. Your ability to adapt to new environments and maintain a customer-focused mindset will help you succeed in this role.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* Fluency in Swedish and English, with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of an organization
* A university degree or vocational education in Procurement, Business Administration, or Engineering
* Experience in international procurement environments, collaborating with global teams and suppliers across multiple markets
* Hands-on experience across the full P2P process
* Advanced level in Microsoft Office. In particular, Excel and PowerPoint



  





**Also, great if you have:** 



* Experience in marketing and IT/Telco procurement, including sourcing and managing suppliers within areas such as media, creative, and digital services
* Experience with eProcurement tools (e.g. Jaggaer, Ariba) and ERP systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP)



  





 If this sounds like you, or you believe you have what it takes to excel,
 **apply today!** 




  





**Verisure - 35 years of delivering peace of mind.**

title: Karma Sales Academy, Stockholm
description:
Karma is changing how restaurants run their business. With our platform – Karma OS – we give restaurant owners the tools to increase revenue, reduce waste, and create better guest experiences using data. An industry that's long deserved better tech. We're growing fast, we're profitable, and now we're building the sales team that will take us to the next level and enable our international expansion.
   

  

 We've got the biggest restaurant groups in the Nordics already using our platform - and we're growing our Sales Academy to find and forge tomorrow's sales superstars!
   

  

**💰 Paid Sales Training with Base Salary + Commission to launch your sales career 🚀**
 This Isn't Just a Trainee Program - It's An Intensive, Paid Full-time Sales Training Program Led By Our Top Performer, Head Of Sales And Expansion Jonatan. You'll Master Our Product Suite, Sales Methodology, And Restaurant Industry In a Structured Program That Turns Theory Into Practice
   

  

**MONTH 1:** 
 Get a crash course and first in class training in Sales wonderful world
   

  

**MONTH 2:** 
 Join the frontlines, participating in calls and meetings
   

  

**MONTH 3:** 
 Take the wheel, running your own sales conversations
   

  

**📈 Your Career At Karma**
 Sales Development Rep (Month 1-6) → Junior Account Executive (Month 7-12) → Account Executive (18-24 months) -> Senior Account Executive (>24 months) -> Launch new market. Not 5 years. Not "maybe someday." 18-24 months.
   

  

 Your performance will be evaluated during the first 3 months (an ongoing after that), as we work together to ensure you're set up for success. Successful graduates will get a diploma for completing the 3 months, signed by Jonatan and our CEO Hjalmar. And for top performers who truly excel - you'll earn a permanent position on our sales team selling the Karma dream!
   

  

**Your toolkit**
 💳
 **Karma POS** 
 : Our point-of-sale system
   

  

 📱
 **Karma Order & Pay** 
 : Digital ordering with QR codes
   

  

 ❤️
 **Karma Marketing & Loyalty** 
 : Customer retention magic
   

  

 Not telecom. Not insurance.
 **Tech that actually makes a difference.**
**What Really Matters To Us**
* Dreams of winning: Your competitive spirit is wide awake and the thought of smashing targets makes your heart race
* Attitude is everything: We'll take fire and enthusiasm over a fancy resume
* Learn like a sponge: You have an exceptional capacity to absorb and retain new information
* Born with the hustle gene: You possess an drive that sets you apart from other, and takes initiative without being prompted
* Challenger mindset: You're curious, bold and unafraid
* Swedish speaker: With enough English to keep conversations flowing


**What's In It For You**
 As a participant in our Sales Academy, you'll gain mastery of skills that define top performers:
   

  

* Master the Challenger and SPIN sales methodologies
* Acquire essential project management skills to handle complex sales cycles
* Learn sales pipeline management strategies that maximize efficiency and results
* Gain useful expertise in forecasting
* Continuously sharpen your skills and boost your performance by mastering the art of converting leads into opportunities

title: Europe Supply Chain Operations & Planning Manager
description:
Blueair, as part of Unilever, is a rapidly growing global brand with consumer health at its core. We believe that no matter where you live, your lifestyle, or your specific health needs, air health is vital to your wellbeing. Over the last 30 years, Blueair has built a team of creative thinkers, health enthusiasts, and innovators who are passionate about our impactful products.
   

  

**Your future role**
 Blueair is seeking an experienced
 **Europe Supply Chain Operations & Planning Manager** 
 to lead demand and supply planning, 3PL operations, and regional logistics execution for our growing European business.
   

  

 As the regional supply chain lead, you’ll ensure our European and UK warehouse operations run smoothly, inventory flows efficiently, and planning inputs are accurate for our global S&OP cycle. You’ll partner closely with cross-functional teams across procurement, logistics, and finance to drive process discipline, operational visibility, and scalability as Blueair continues expanding DTC, Amazon, and omni-retail channels across Europe.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead regional demand and supply planning — aligning forecasts, inventory, and inbound shipments from China.
* Manage day-to-day performance and relationships with 3PL partners in Germany and the UK.
* Monitor and improve key metrics: on-time shipment, inventory accuracy, cost-to-serve, and warehouse efficiency.
* Ensure trade and customs compliance for EU–UK transfers and exports under approved SOPs.
* Facilitate EMEA S&OP reviews and provide regional data inputs into the global planning process.
* Identify process and system improvements to strengthen visibility, reduce cost, and enable future growth.
* Managing SC budget ownership, with clear accountability for managing cost-to-serve and optimizing SCC.


**What You’ll Bring**
* 7+ years of experience in supply chain operations, planning, or logistics management within Europe.
* Proven track record working with 3PLs and managing regional warehouse operations.
* Strong understanding of EU/UK customs, VAT, and intra-company stock transfers.
* Experience in managing e-commerce fulfillment environments such as Amazon or DTC
* Proficiency in ERP systems (NetSuite or similar), Excel, and ideally Power BI.
* Excellent communicator who thrives in a global, cross-cultural environment.
* Fluent in English; additional European languages a plus.


**Why Blueair**
 This is a rare opportunity to
 **build and lead the future of Blueair’s European supply chain** 
 , shaping best practices across planning, logistics, and compliance. You’ll join a high-performance global team that values initiative, ownership, and operational excellence.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At Blueair you’ll be part of a global team with creative minds collaborating from around the world. We work across time zones, so some flexibility in working hours is part of the adventure. It’s a chance to connect with passionate teammates worldwide, gain diverse perspectives, and help build a brand that resonates across cultures.
   

  

 Blueair offers you an exciting role in a fast-growing purpose-driven international company. In addition to great benefits, such as, wellness hours and Benify, you will have the opportunity to team up with passionate and highly skilled colleagues from all over the world. Our office is located in Stockholm city and offers a nice environment. At Blueair your day will consist of doing great work and having fun while doing so
   

  

 Blueair is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Your application**
 Please share your profile with us in English. We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.
   

  

*We have already chosen our sourcing channels for this recruitment process and kindly ask to not be contacted by advertising agents, recruitment agencies or staffing companies.*

title: Funktionsansvarig
description:
**Att jobba som funktionsansvarig**
 I rollen som funktionsansvarig kommer du få ta ett helhetsansvar för våra infrastrukturella basplattformar inom Compute, Storage, Network och Datacenter området. Du blir en nyckelperson i att forma och förvalta Skandias nuvarande och framtidens tekniska plattformar samt processer där stort fokus ligger på långsiktighet och driftstabilitet.
   

  

 Du kommer att agera förvaltningsledare och ta ansvar för såväl strategisk inriktning som operativt ledarskap. Det innebär att du leder funktionens arbete i samverkan med både interna kollegor och externa leverantörer. En viktig del av ditt uppdrag blir att leda projekt med både tidplan och budget samtidigt som du driver tekniska initiativ och följer upp roadmap, förvaltningsplaner och resultat.
   

  

 Ansvarsområdet för rollen innebär bland annat att:
   

  

* Utforma, utveckla och förvalta funktionens arbetssätt, metoder, verktyg och kompetensbehov
* Leda och följa upp tekniska roadmaps, förvaltningsplaner och budget
* Säkerställa uppföljning av interna och externa leveranser enligt Skandias operativa processer
* Driva effektivisering och innovation i IT:s operationella processer
* Bevaka tekniktrender och aktivt bidra till vår strategiska utvecklingsplanering


 Den tekniska miljön är bred och under utveckling. Du kommer arbeta med:
   

  

* Compute & Storage: Virtualisering, Backup, SAN/NAS, Serverplattformar
* Network: Switching, Routing, Brandväggar, Lastbalansering, DNS/DHCP/IPAM
* Datacenter: Fysisk och virtuell infrastruktur, kapacitetshantering, automation


 Teamet du kommer tillhöra består av ett tiotal specialister som arbetar med Skandias applikations- och infrastrukturstöd. Gruppen ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och 3:e nivåsupport av infrastrukturnära plattformar. Vi sitter tillsammans i våra lokaler i Stockholm. Vår arbetskultur kännetecknas av kunskapsutbyte och ett teknikintresse där teamsamarbete står i fokus.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till IT-gruppchef applikation- och infrastruktur.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har mångårig erfarenhet inom teknikområdet med fokus på infrastruktur, inklusive Compute, Storage, Network och Datacenter. Du har arbetat med teknisk projektledning eller liknande roller, där du tagit både det operativa och strategiska ansvar för drift, utveckling, samordning av infrastrukturella plattformar samt budget och planering. Likaså har du en vana att samverka med externa leverantörer och att arbeta nära både teknik, verksamhet och ledning. Din förståelse för informationssäkerhet är god där du känner till regelverk som DORA och ISO/IEC 27002. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från bank/försäkringssektorn och certifiering inom SAFe eller ITIL.
   

  

 Du är driven och målinriktad person som tar initiativ och arbetar strukturerat. Din kommunikativa förmåga är viktig i rollen där samarbete både med interna och externa intressenter är betydande.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Alexander Larre på alexander.larre@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Design Lead (Stockholm/Hybrid, SE)
description:
(B2B)
   

  

**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
 As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.
   

  

**Firstly, a Bit About The Team**
 We're the team behind Arrive's B2B business — one of the company’s fastest-growing and most strategically important areas. As B2B Design Lead, you’ll help shape products that solve real-world problems for businesses managing fleets and mobility at scale.
   

  

 Our mission? To become the trusted global mobility partner that boosts productivity and satisfaction through efficient and sustainable solutions. Whether it's streamlining parking expenses for SMBs or building data-powered platforms for enterprise fleets, we’re on a journey — from simplifying today’s admin to enabling tomorrow’s ecosystem of mobility services.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The B2B Design Lead at Arrive takes a strong and holistic ownership of the end to end user experience that’s under the remit of the department they’re working in.
   

  

 This role entails a mix of leading a small team as well as hands-on contributions to raise the bar on the quality of the experiences offered to Arrive's users.
   

  

 As B2B Design Lead you’ll report directly to the Head of Product Design and will collaborate closely with senior stakeholders in product, engineering and design, to shape the next steps of how the products should look, work and feel moving forward.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Through close collaboration with key stakeholders, ensure that the user experience of Arrive's products are the best they can possibly be.
* Coach, support and collaborate with a small, distributed team of skilled product designers to set both them and the department up for success. This includes spending time in 1:1’s, working with recruitment, onboarding new joiners, as well continuously improving ways of working, processes and overall maturity of design within the department.
* Whilst you’ll work with a team of designers, you’re also expected to have solid hands-on skills that you don’t mind leveraging with relative frequency. Your craft is at a level where you have an ability to truly elevate the quality of the products from a design standpoint.
* Aside from working with cross functional collaborators across the department, you’ll also work frequently with others in the wider organization: e.g. designers, UX researchers, UX writers and the design system team.


 What you’ll bring to the team
   

  

* We expect you to have at least 5+ years of experience in design with 3+ years of lead/management/coaching experience.
* Solid experience working with cross functional teams, preferably in a product/SaaS context.
* We expect you to be a strong communicator in both written and verbal form.
* Track record of product-thinking, outcome-centric, high quality projects.
* Impeccable craft skills. Know-how in design tools and prototyping is a given. Understanding for or skills in UX research, UX writing, motion design, design systems, are seen as beneficial.


 We expect you to share an outstanding portfolio, giving a sense for your track record of shipping excellent products.
   

  

**About Us**
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile, YourParkingSpace and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.
   

  

**Department**
 Parking
   

  

**Locations**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Remote status**
 Hybrid
   

  

**About Arrive**
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Client Services Manager
description:
*Are you driven by developing and leading technical and competent colleagues? At Lumera, we are now looking for a Client Services Manager who, with commitment and coaching, will lead application consultants and solution architects. You will have a central role in developing the services business and enabling team members to grow with Lumera.*
**What you will contribute** 
**with**
 We continue to grow and are now looking our team with a Client Services Manager within Global Services. You will have personnel responsibility for 15-20 Application Consultants and Solution Architects, staffing responsibility, conduct development dialogues, recruitment, onboard new employees, and much more. One of your most important goals is to enable employees to deliver and grow within Lumera with the right skills and commitment. You will be part of the management team for Client Services and are expected to contribute to the development of our services business.
   

  

 Client Services is part of Lumera's delivery- and customer organization Global Services, which works with the implementation and management of our product and delivers services related to customers' business and business development. The work takes place in implementation projects and customer teams where specialists support the organization and customers broadly. Everyone works closely with our customers, as well as other internal divisions.
   

  

 You report to Gitte Belander, Head of Client Services within Global Services.
   

  

**Who are you?**
* You have documented experience as a manager with personnel and staffing responsibility, preferably from consulting or product companies.
* Experience working as a consultant within IT
* Experience from the Life and Pension industry, product companies, and agile organizations is highly meritorious
* You have an academic degree.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* You are a natural leader with great commitment and drive who inspires others. Additionally, you are a humble team player who loves to solve problems.


**What** 
**we offer you**
* Wonderful and genuinely committed colleagues who always support each other
* Varied and fun work with a complex and socially important product
* Development opportunities internally: with us, you get the chance to develop, grow, and take responsibility early
* Central (and brand new!) office at Regeringsgatan with the possibility of hybrid work two days a week
* Focus on employee well-being: feel free to ask us about our benefits package!
* Be part of a company that is now scaling up and investing internationally


**Does it sound good? Then we want to** 
**get in touch with you!**
 Apply with a CV or LinkedIn profile. We encourage you not to wait too long to apply as we conduct interviews continuously. The start date for the position is by agreement. A background check will be conducted before a hiring decision is made.
   

  

 Questions? Contact the recruiting manager Gitte Belander gitte.belander@lumera.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Lumera**
 Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
   

  

 The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
   

  

 We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Global Product Manager - Communication Software
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 Are you passionate about shaping the future of software products that connect people and drive meaningful outcomes? We are seeking a strategic and visionary
 **Global Product Manager** 
 to lead one or more products within our Communication Software portfolio. In this role, you will be responsible for setting the long-term vision and strategy, driving product discovery, and ensuring commercial success through market insights, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration. You will work closely with Tech, Design, and Product Managers in other teams and with multiple internal groups.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Vision, Strategy & Roadmapping**
* Define the long-term product vision and strategy.
* Set product roadmaps aligned with portfolio strategy and business objectives.
* Convert user and customer insights into actionable requirements and roadmap items.


**Discovery, Research & Validation**
* Drive discovery and rapid experimentation.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify innovation opportunities and growth drivers.
* Analyze financial feasibility and growth potential for product initiatives.
* Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders and partners to gather insights and test assumptions.


**Product Lifecycle Management**
* Launch new products and manage end-of-life plans for sunset-stage products.


**Collaboration & Communication**
* Collaborate closely with Design, Engineering, Market Units, and other Product Managers to ensure alignment and data-driven decisions.
* Communicate product vision and outcomes clearly across internal and external teams.
* Represent and advocate for the product publicly as a strong voice and ambassador.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in business or technology.
* 5+ years of experience in software product management and SaaS.
* Data-informed decision-maker, with experience in using data to inform product strategy and measure performance.
* Proven success in developing go-to-market strategies for new and emerging segments.
* Strong commercial and business acumen.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work across teams and stakeholders.
* Strong internal drive and motivation to challenge the status quo.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to gather teams around common objectives.
* Thorough understanding of great product experiences.


**Preferred Certifications**
* Certification in product management methodologies
* Training or certification in customer-centric design or technology product design
* Professional development in scaled agile frameworks or enterprise product management


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work environment
* Occasional international travel required to engage with global teams, customers, and markets.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Systemförvaltare till Patientnära produkter och tjänster
description:
Vill du vara med och driva den digitala utvecklingen inom vården? Vi söker nu en systemförvaltare till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset som vill bidra till att utveckla framtidens patientnära IT-stöd och skapa förutsättningar för en mer datadriven vård. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* att arbeta i en verksamhet med ett meningsfullt uppdrag som bidrar till förbättrad vård för patienter
* samarbete med engagerade kollegor inom både vård och IT
* möjligheten att påverka och driva utveckling i en komplex och samhällsviktig organisation.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets uppdrag är att bedriva högspecialiserad sjukvård. Vår vision
 *”Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag”* 
 vägleder oss i arbetet mot medicinska framsteg och ett tydligt värdeskapande för patienter och samhälle.
   

  

 För att möjliggöra nästa steg i den medicinska utvecklingen satsar vi på modernisering av våra informationsstrukturer och en ökad digitalisering. Målet är att i allt högre grad kunna styra vårdleveransen datadrivet och använda digital information som beslutsstöd.
   

  

 Nu söker vi förstärkning till vår avdelning som arbetar med förvaltning kopplad till patientnära processer inom Karolinska. Du blir en del av en organisation i en spännande fas av förändring och utveckling där du får möjlighet att påverka, men också behöver trivas i en miljö med högt tempo och många parallella leveranser.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med förvaltningsaktiviteter enligt prioriteringar som tas fram tillsammans med produktledning och teamet för området Patientnära. Teamet ansvarar idag för lösningar som Alltid Öppet och 1177.
   

  

* fånga, analysera och formulera krav på IT-stödet ur ett verksamhetsperspektiv
* säkra användbarheten ur ett användarperspektiv, bl.a. genom support, information och utbildning
* koordinera intressenter inom regionen: sjukhus­enheter, primärvård, kommunal hemsjukvård, teknikutvecklare och IT-avdelning.
* samordna arbetet när nya vårdteam och patientgrupper ansluts till de system du ansvarar för förvaltning av.


 Du kommer att ha ett särskilt leveransansvar för tjänster som är kopplade till vårt program för sjukhusvård i hemmet, Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset@home. Som systemförvaltare ansvarar du för förvaltning av det regiongemensamma system för distansmonitorering av vitalparametrar som införs med start under Q1 2026.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* har god förmåga att uttrycka dig både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska
* god förmåga att analysera komplexa frågeställningar. Du är lyhörd och kan på ett pedagogiskt sätt, muntligt och skriftligt, kommunicera resultatet
* kan planera och genomföra stora leveranser
* är kommunikativ och pedagogisk samt har förmågan att förenkla tekniskt komplexa processer. Du har en hög social förmåga där du är van att bemöta människor på ett professionellt sätt samt att du trivs med många kontaktytor.


**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Minst gymnasieexamen
* Några års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning
* Erfarenhet av journalsystem
* Erfarenhet av kravhantering av IT-system
* Erfarenhet av insamling och strukturering av information


**Meriterande**
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av analys av förändringar i system och dess påverkan på verksamheten
* Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildning för stora grupper.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vision sektion Karolinska
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se

title: (Sr.) Field Application Engineer
description:
****Job Req ID: 27843****
**About Supermicro**
 Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The (Sr.) Field Application Engineer (FAE) will be part of a growing, dynamic, highly-focused team responsible for developing new or existing opportunities in the global IT market. The FAE will be required to work with customers from ground to executive-level, manage projects hand in hand with internal and external teams, and help grow the business whenever possible. Customer and solution focus, are two key factors for this position, as well as business continuity and support. The FAE must work with multiple departments to ensure new projects and existing projects are initiated or maintained towards customer requirements.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Works closely with the sales and extended teams to map end-user customer business, partner requirements and provide most optimized technical solutions
* Provides technical leadership in Pre-Sales and oversee implementation of such solutions
* Highly technical problem solver who understands system architecture, hardware and software interaction
* Should possess basic HW debug skills
* Manage and leads product HW and SW engineers during product development
* Manage and leads teams during investigation and resolution of problems in the field
* Has a good understanding of firmware, drivers, OS, Applications and their interaction that can cause system issues
* Develop and review systems solutions, technical bid responses and presentations
* Work cross-department to ensure customer satisfaction and timely resolution of issues
* Ability to build and demonstrate proof-of-concept that meets or exceeds customer business needs
* Ability to present the corporate brand, product messaging and solutions to customers
* Visit on-site facilities and operations to enable solution integration and issue resolution
* Some travel required (up to 25%)


**Qualifications**
