* Bachelors' or Masters' degree in engineering discipline; computer science, computer engineering and electrical engineering preferred
* Excellent communication skills and business sense required
* Minimum 5 year related experience with Compute/Storage Server or Data Center or IT Infrastructure experience desired
* Strong background and experience with x86-based server architecture
* Solid HW system design and diagnostics skills
* Familiarity with Firmware, Linux, Windows and virtualization platforms is a plus
* Strong technical communication and leadership skills to lead investigations with engineers of multiple disciplines
* Individual must be able to work effectively in a high pressure environment


****EEO Statement****
 Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Account Manager, Sweden Public Sector
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 As Account Executive you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology and increase adoption and market segment presence of AWS in the Swedish Public Sector.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess both a sales / account management and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the executive level as well as with software developers and IT architects and have gained experience in the Public Sector in particular with Central Government. You will be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver results.
   

  

 You are an exceptionally strong and creative thinker who thrives in a team environment and embraces all aspects of selling and who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on targets. You enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Effectively engage C-level business & technical executives within the assigned Customers
* Leverage executive Customer relationships to build trust with AWS leadership & accelerate strategic enterprise opportunities to ensure customer satisfaction
* Build/Own the strategic plan for the Customer you own, to drive business growth objectives
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
* Achieve goals and strategic objectives including revenue, pipeline and repeatable solutions
* Drive Customer strategy using industry vertical solutions, business transformation initiatives and deliver high quality Customer outcomes
* Work with cross functional teams & Partners to create and execute on strategic business plans, practice development and marketing, to execute achievement against Customers goals
* Help to drive business growth and expansion in a defined territory
* Manage numerous Customers concurrently & long-term
* Accelerate customer adoption & develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Travel as necessary


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* tech sales experienc ein public sector in sweden


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Swedish


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3103174

title: AI & Automation Specialist
description:
*Do you love working with AI, Coding and building Automations that leads to finding smarter ways to get things done? We are now offering you a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the future of work at Tacton!*
 At Tacton, we’re on a journey to rethink how we work – and we’re now looking for our very first AI & Automation Specialist to help us make it happen.
   

  

 In this brand-new role, you’ll be advising the team around possibilities with AI, building and implementing AI agents, writing code using coding agents, and automate using the tools of tomorrow. In essence, your main scope will be to make work more efficient for everyone at Tacton. This isn’t a traditional developer job – it’s a place for curious minds who want to turn bold ideas into real impact.
   

  

 You’ll report to Carsten Lentz, Global Sr. VP of Sales Engineering, and join our 30-person Commercial team (Sales, Sales Engineering and Marketing). Most of your work will support them directly — but you’ll also get to collaborate with many others across Tacton, from IT, R&D and Services.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Dive into processes and find opportunities for AI and automation improvements
* Create quick prototypes and MVPs to show the art of the possible
* Build process automations using tools like Power Automate and n8n
* Vibe Code impactful applications using the newest agentic coding frameworks
* Create tangible value with GPTs and embed them into daily work
* Help the Commercial team adopt new AI tools and ways of working
* Share what you build — so others can further build on your ideas
* Be a change agent for all the cool things you and the team will create


**What We’re Looking For**
 You don’t need to know everything – but you should love exploring, learning, and trying new things.
   

  

* 2–4 years of experience in AI development and automation
* Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or similar
* Skills in Python (bonus points for JavaScript)
* Hands-on experience with building GPTs and or AI agents
* Creative thinker who can turn complex tech concepts into a simple solutions
* Fundamental understanding and usage of Prompting, RAG, LLM


**Nice-to-have (but Not Must-have)**
* Cloud AI (Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI)
* SQL/database knowledge
* RPA experience (UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere)


**Why you’ll love working here**
* A creative, supporting and collaborative team where new ideas are encouraged
* Freedom to experiment and learn by doing
* Create impact when you immediate see the impact of your initiatives
* Work with the latest AI tools and automation platforms
* A global SaaS company where your ideas will have visible impact
* Hybrid work and a fun, forward-thinking culture built on trust and innovation


**Apply now**
 If you’re passionate about AI and love solving problems in smart, new ways – this is your chance to make an impact while learning every day.
   

  

 Send us your CV and a short note on how you’ve used AI or automation in your projects, studies, or work. Apply no later than December 1st –
 *we can’t wait to hear from you!*
**Employment:** 
 Fulltime, 12 months contract. This role is based in our Stockholm office, and we follow a hybrid model with three in-office days per week.
   

  

**Benefits At Tacton**
* At Tacton, we’ve been building CPQ software for over 20 years. We’re a financially stable company with global enterprise customers
* We offer flexibility in how we work and a culture that values learning and collaboration
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve.
* Premium occupational pension
* Generous wellness allowance – 5,000 SEK annually to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care, including specialist consultations and treatments.
* Weekly treats – because good food brings people together.


 Learn more at
 **tacton.com/about**
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Finance Manager
description:
**Why Grasp** 




 Grasp is an AI platform for the financial advisory industry. The $1.4 trillion financial advisory industry relies heavily on costly and scarce cognitive labor. The industry is so inefficient that advisory firms can charge millions of dollars for teams of junior employees, whose work is 90% manual and repetitive. It is clear that AI will automate large parts of this work and provide a massive uplift in productivity.
 



  





 Our platform uses the latest advances in AI to solve the time-consuming and complex workflows unique to the financial advisory industry. Since launching our product early 2024, we have grown rapidly to support almost 200 customers across 25 countries, secured backing by top-tier investors, and are now scaling our team quickly in our Stockholm and London offices.
 



  





**About the role** 





 As Finance Manager at Grasp, you’ll have a unique opportunity to help shape the finance function of a fast-growing startup serving global customers. You’ll work broadly with both accounting and reporting, focusing on taking responsibility for the overall financial picture and contributing to the company’s continued growth. Until now, the finance function has been outsourced, but it’s now being brought in-house – giving you the opportunity to truly build and develop these functions. The role includes, among other things:
 



* Bookkeeping, invoicing, VAT and tax management, payroll, expenses, and receipts
* Responsibility for financial statements and annual reports
* Preparing monthly financial reports (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow, KPIs)
* Consolidating the Swedish and UK entities
* Improving and structuring reporting to the CEO and investors
* Participating in projects such as the transition to K3 and later IFRS
* Contributing to budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling in Excel
* Developing and improving processes and driving ad-hoc projects related to the company’s growth
* Working on structure and bringing the finance function in-house, with the long-term goal of building a complete internal finance department



  






 To thrive in this role, you have experience managing accounting from start to finish—ideally as a senior accountant, company accountant, or Finance Manager in a SaaS scale-up—with responsibility for overall accounting, reporting, and financial structure. You have solid knowledge of Fortnox (or equivalent) and Excel, experience with the K3 accounting framework, and consolidation. Excellent English skills are essential, as part of the team operates exclusively in English. Experience from SaaS companies is highly valued, and it’s a plus if you’ve worked with Nordea, Pleo, or Wise. Previous experience in bringing an outsourced finance function in-house and building it up is also an advantage.
 




  





 Location: In-office in Stockholm.

title: Data Scientist Axfood
description:
Do you also believe in everyone's right to affordable, good and sustainable food? Do you want to be part of a journey in an exciting industry where innovation, commitment and drive are important ingredients? Welcome to the Axfood family!
   

  

 Through our group's many brands, competencies and backgrounds, we have the power to make a difference together - for real. Now we are looking for you who want to be part of developing tomorrow's grocery trade.
   

  

**Become one of us**
 As a Data Scientist at Axfood AB, you’ll join our AI team — a key part of the central Strategy & Business Development department. Our mission is to make Axfood a leader in AI innovation and transformation across the grocery retail industry and turn data into real business impact.
   

  

 We build and run end-to-end machine learning and advanced analytics solutions that help Axfood become even more data-driven. The team develops models for multiple parts of the Group — including e-commerce, loyalty (e.g., Willys Plus, Klubb Hemköp), digital marketing, and broader AI initiatives including GenAI applications — and we collaborate closely with IT, business development, e-commerce specialists, analysts and many more.
   

  

 Being a Data Scientist at Axfood, you will be working with a modern, cloud-based platform to build models. You will develop models using Python and SQL for programming and mainly using AWS SageMaker and Airflow for development and orchestration of pipelines.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop, productionize, and iterate on ML and analytics models that create measurable value across Axfood.
* Work end-to-end: problem framing & design → feature engineering & modeling → pipelines/MLOps → monitoring & continuous improvement.
* Apply methods such as predictive modeling, recommender systems, clustering, and generative-AI solutions.
* Take ownership of our deliveries and partner with stakeholders — with room for creativity, rapid experimentation, and direct impact on outcomes.


**Our tech environment**
* Languages & tools: Python, SQL
* Platform & orchestration: AWS (incl. SageMaker, Bedrock), Airflow
* Ways of working: Git and CI/CD
* Data: Very large, diverse datasets from across the Group


**We believe you have**
* At least a couple of years’ experience as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer.
* A relevant degree (e.g., mathematics, computer science, physics, statistics, data science, or a comparable engineering degree).
* Hands-on experience with ML algorithms — and you write scalable, production-ready code.
* Understanding of MLOps and experience deploying/monitoring models in real environments.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills. You’re proficient in English and Swedish (our company language is Swedish).


**Preferred:**
* Experience with generative AI applications.
* Airflow (or similar) and working with very large datasets.
* Cloud platforms such as AWS (preferred), Azure, or GCP.


**What You’ll Bring**
 You are driven and conscientious, with a strong desire to create change — in the way we build models and in the business.
   

  

**We invite you to apply**
 We hope we have captured your interest! You are warmly welcome to apply for the position via the “Apply now” link. Please note that we only accept applications submitted through this link. The recruitment process is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the final application date, so we encourage you to send in your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Björn Blomqvist, e-mail: bjorn.blomqvist@axfood.se. The final application date is 2025-11-23.
   

  

*To ensure we find the right person for the role, our recruitment process includes both tests and interviews.*
*We verify ID and conduct background checks for all recruitments.*
 Please note that during this recruitment process, we will never ask you to log in with your BankID or scan any QR codes. If you have any questions, please contact our Employee Support at jobb@axfood.se.
   

  

**About The Company**
 Our group includes the retail chains Willys, Hemköp, and City Gross, as well as Tempo, Handlar’n, and Matöppet. Wholesale operations are conducted through Snabbgross, and our support company Dagab is responsible for the Group’s product development, purchasing, and logistics. The Axfood family also includes Urban Deli and the partly owned Apohem and Eurocash. Together, the Group has more than 15,000 employees and a turnover exceeding SEK 80 billion. Behind the store front, our Group-wide functions include business development, finance, real estate, HR, IT, and communications. Axfood is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, and its main owner is Axel Johnson AB.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: HvSS söker IT-samordnare och elsäkerhetshandläggare
description:
HvSS är under tillväxt vi är nu lite drygt 50 personer som tjänstgör på förbandet. Vid staben tjänstgör för närvarande 16 personer i olika funktioner. Befattningen är en hybrid som främst jobbar inom IT-stöd för övriga anställda vid HvSS. Som elsäkerhetshandläggare stödjer du C HvSS att vidmakthålla systematiskt elsäkerhetsarbete i verksamheten. Du kommer att svara för elsäkerhetsdokumentation och deltar i det systematiska arbetsmiljöarbetet. Du deltar vid revisioner och följer upp avvikelser. Tjänsten är placerad på G6 som idag är tre befattningar som stödjer skolan inom IT- och samband.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
 Du kommer att vara delaktig i teknikuppgraderingar, stödjer framtagning av kontinuitetsplan och incidentplan för IT-system.
   

  

 Stötta funktionsansvariga vid framtagande av lokal ackreditering av IT-system.
   

  

 Vara kravställare och ansvara för uppföljning av SLA.
   

  

 Samordna och förmedla information rörande IT-regler och struktur samt finnas som användarstöd och kontaktperson för skolans IT-system.
   

  

 Dukning av lektionssalar med IT-utrustning och säkerställa funktionalitet.
   

  

 Delta i olika projekt inom funktionerna.
   

  

 Utbilda och rådgöra inom såväl IT- som Elsäkerhetsområden.
   

  

 Beredd att lösa av chef tillkommande uppgifter inom ramen för eget kompetensområde och utbildning.
   

  

 Beredd att medverka i övrigt förekommande ärenden vid HvSS.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer** 
 :
   

  

 Adekvat gymnasieutbildning med godkända betyg
   

  

 Relevant utbildning eller yrkeslivserfarenhet inom IT- och/eller elsäkerhet som arbetsgivaren finner relevant.
   

  

 Dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet av data- och systemvana
   

  

 Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift på hög nivå
   

  

 B körkort manuell växellåda
   

  

**Meriterande:**
 Erfarenhet från Försvarsmakten eller annan statlig myndighet
   

  

 Genomfört Försvarsmaktens IT-kurser vid LedSS
   

  

 Genomfört Försvarsmaktens Elsäkerhetshandläggarutbildning
   

  

 Utbildning inom signalskydd
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Dina personliga egenskaper präglas av stor noggrannhet och högt säkerhetstänkande. Du har god pedagogisk- och kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i rollen som utbildare.
   

  

 Du är självgående, driven och prestigelös.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen är du social, serviceinriktad och ansvarskännande
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Övrigt:**
 Befattningen är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning inom ramen för Försvarsmaktens lönestruktur.
   

  

 Arbetsort Vällinge/Norsborg
   

  

**Upplysningar om tjänsten kan lämnas via:**
 Förvaltare Magnus Kann magnus.kann@mil.se
   

  

 OFR/S Lennart Klingare
   

  

 OFR/O Lars-Erik Lindblad
   

  

**Samtliga nås via FM växel: 010- 825 40 00**
 Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas med motivering varför du är lämpad för befattningen.
   

  

 Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-11-27
   

  

 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.
   

  

 , Försvarsmakten är en av Sveriges största myndigheter med mer än 50000 medarbetare och frivilliga. Försvarsmakten är ständigt beredd att hävda Sveriges territorium, genomföra internationella insatser, samt att stödja samhället vid större kriser. Ytterst är Försvarsmaktens uppgift att värna demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter. Hos oss kan du göra skillnad. Försvarsmakten eftersträvar mångfald eftersom det berikar vår verksamhet. I Försvarsmakten finns en värdegrund där såväl professionell utveckling som personlig hälsa lyfts fram. Försvarsmakten erbjuder många interna karriärmöjligheter, friskvårdsmöjligheter och en rimlig balans mellan arbete, privat- och familjeliv. Hemvärnets stridsskola, HvSS, har uppgiften att leda chefsutbildning, utbildningssamordning och kvalitetsuppföljning avseende all utbildning riktad mot hemvärnsförband samt utveckling av utbildningsmetoder, organisation samt taktik och stridsteknik. Skolan är belägen i naturskönt område mellan Mälaren och Bornsjön ca 1,2 mil norr om Södertälje. Körkort och bil är en nödvändighet då vi saknar förbindelser med kollektivtrafik.,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Software Engineer (Scala), Remote
description:
Everything we do is for our customers!
   

  

 Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a unified commerce experience that our customers need, transforming ecommerce, retail, marketing automation, merchandising, helpdesk and AI operations with one platform designed to scale for fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by customer obsession, extreme urgency, excellence and resourcefulness to to power 5,000+ global brands while we head to 100,000+.
   

  

 Driven by the same customer-centric mentality as above, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're a driver and not passenger and are ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Thrive on change and grow beyond limits! We are looking for a bold thinker who sees a chance to learn and define what's possible with every challenge! Ready to make an impact? Welcome to Maropost and you can turn ideas into action!
   

  

 We are looking for an open-minded and enthusiastic intermediate-level Scala Engineer to join our backend team. We are a passionate and highly collaborative team with a bias for quality and continuous improvement. If you are looking for an environment where you can learn and see your ideas come to life, let's talk!
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours).
   

  

**What You'll Be Responsible For**
* Design and write sustainable, easy-to-read, and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed.
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries
* Review feedback on the specs and the code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Make recommendations regarding introducing new tools and improving processes.
* Continuous learning of different programming paradigms and new technologies
* Work with a highly collaborative group of engineers.


**What You'll Bring To Maropost** 
  

  

* 3+ years of experience in Scala.
* 2+ years' experience with mapping business domains into SQL schemas.
* Experience with message-based architectures (we use Pulsar).
* Knowledge in API design (REST or GraphQL).
* Understand and work with modern cloud-native infrastructure (we deploy to Kubernetes).
* Responsible for builds and CI/CD processes (we use CircleCI for builds and GitOps with ArgoCD for back-end deployments).
* Excellent communication skills, a bias for feedback and continuous improvement, combined with the ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
* The ability to take ownership and initiatives over tasks/projects and share any new ideas with the team.
* You exemplify Maropost’s Values:
+ Customer Obsessed
+ Extreme Urgency
+ Excellence
+ Resourceful


 Message from the Founders: Maropost is looking for builders - people who want to drive our business forward at all costs in order to achieve the goals we have both short and long term for the results and outcomes that that will bring to us all.
   

  

 If that isn't for you that’s ok, for those of you that it is please get in touch with us!

title: SAP Solution Architect – Finance to Cash
description:
**Om uppdraget**
 En av våra industrikunder genomför ett omfattande moderniseringsprogram för att harmonisera sina arbetssätt och implementera ett nytt ERP-system baserat på SAP S/4HANA. Vi söker nu en erfaren
 **SAP Solution Architect** 
 med fokus på
 **Finance to Cash** 
 , som kan ta ett helhetsansvar för den finansiella lösningen och säkerställa att den stödjer verksamhetens mål och regulatoriska krav.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med både affärssidan och projektorganisationen, samt med externa implementationspartners. Du blir en nyckelperson i kundens Finance to Cash-workstream inom ett större transformationsprogram.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som SAP Solution Architect för Finance ansvarar du för att:
   

  

* Utveckla och underhålla end-to-end SAP-lösningar inom Finance och Controlling.
* Delta i både implementationsprojekt och i den löpande förvaltningsorganisationen.
* Samarbeta med interna finance-team, projektintressenter och externa leverantörer för att förstå affärsbehov och processer.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturen stödjer flera regioner och juridiska enheter.
* Dokumentera lösningsarkitektur enligt givna standarder.
* Förstå befintlig systemmiljö och integrationslandskap för att stödja övergången till den nya plattformen.
* Ge expertstöd inom SAP Finance och bidra till incidenthantering samt problemlösning.


**Skallkrav**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT, ekonomi eller motsvarande.
* Flera års erfarenhet av ERP-system, med djup kompetens inom SAP S/4HANA Finance (Financial Accounting och Controlling).
* Minst två fullständiga SAP-implementeringar med förståelse för organisatoriska förändringsutmaningar.
* Förmåga att designa och dokumentera tvärfunktionella lösningar med koppling till Sales, Logistics, Sourcing och Plant Maintenance.
* Kunskap om skatte- och momsprocesser i SAP.
* Erfarenhet av Application Maintenance Management (förvaltningsledning).


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från pappers-, massa- eller tillverkningsindustrin.
* Förståelse för gränssnittet mellan Plant Maintenance och Finance, inklusive masterdata och kostnadsuppföljning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i internationella organisationer med flera legala enheter.
* Erfarenhet av finansiell rapportering och transparens i värdekedjan.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Proaktiv och lösningsorienterad med stark analytisk förmåga.
* Kommunikativ och pedagogisk – kan förklara tekniska koncept på ett tydligt sätt.
* Samarbetsinriktad och van vid att arbeta tvärfunktionellt.
* Anpassningsbar och trivs i globala miljöer med varierande kulturer.
* Delar värderingar som präglas av omtanke, ansvarstagande och professionalism.


**Start:** 
 December 2025
   

  

**Slut:** 
 December 2026, med möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 % (1 FTE)
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Solna (onsite-arbete krävs, viss resor inom Sverige, Finland och USA)
   

  

**Språk:** 
 Engelska (primärt), svenska (meriterande)

title: Lead Java Developer
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people.
   

  

 We are looking for a forward-thinking and innovative person to join one of our dynamic development teams. Telenor is rapidly adapting to the digital future, and we are looking for people with a natural proactive drive who want to make a difference.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Lead Java Developer, you will help shape the technical vision and ensure the quality of software within your team, working primarily with AWS and Java SpringBoot microservices. You will lead the design of robust, scalable, and secure solutions, while mentoring team members in best practices for coding, design, and performance optimization.
   

  

 You will collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and team leaders to support project and development planning. Your role will also involve at least 50% hands-on coding, conducting code reviews, and continuously improving development processes, focusing on maintaining the product’s technical health. You'll also be accountable for enhancing developer experience and helping the team balance short- and long-term goals, ensuring delivery of key objectives and adhering to technical guidelines.
   

  

 In addition, you will be part of the
 **Lead Developer chapter** 
 , where you will:
   

  

* Actively drive and participate in improvement projects and ways of working.
* Contribute to coding standards and design patterns.
* Proactively share knowledge and insights across teams.
* Actively work to improve the overall developer experience.
* Assist management in tactical and strategic work.
* Host technical interviews to help grow the team with top talent.


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced software developer with a deep understanding of custom-built applications and strong expertise in Java SpringBoot microservices and system design patterns (scalability, resilience, security). We expect you to have good knowledge in cloud, preferably within AWS. You have a strategic mindset when it comes to software architecture and are proficient in DevOps practices like CI/CD.
   

  

 You are analytical, a problem solver, comfortable managing complex projects and communicating effectively. Self-leadership, time management, and a proactive approach are key attributes of your working style. You lead by example, continuously learn, and are passionate about improving technical excellence within your team.
   

  

**Our promise to you**
*We are better together.*
 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

*We support relationships and societies.*
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

*We make room for life.*
 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

*We invite you to a career in motion.*
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Anki Snis anki.snis@se.experis.com, +46 70-3775969 and Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable data pipelines and data infrastructure.
* Develop and optimize our data warehouse and intuitive, well-documented data models to support analytics, reporting, self-service, and AI-driven initiatives.
* Ensure data quality, consistency, and reliability through validation, monitoring, and testing tools.
* Work cross-functionally with stakeholders from Product, RevOps, GTM, Finance, and other teams to define key metrics and deliver actionable insights.
* Build and maintain dashboards and automated reporting systems.
* Identify patterns, trends, and opportunities through exploratory analysis and deep dives across the organization.


**Who You Are**
* Solid experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, or similar technical analytics role.
* Experience with SQL, dbt, Python, modern BI tools, and hands-on experience with Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouses).
* Deep understanding of data modeling, ELT best practices, and building systems that are reliable and scalable.
* A collaborative, curious mindset with the confidence to work independently and challenge assumptions
* Excited to partner directly with business stakeholders and drive decisions through data.
* But most importantly, you are someone who
+ “Gets stuff done” and understands building a $10bn company isn’t always glamorous and takes hard work and long hours
+ Strives in a fast-paced environment where the answers aren’t always clear and processes are few


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Compliance Officer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech bank. In just 10 years, we’ve gone from startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 businesses and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. As we continue to expand across Europe, we’re looking for a Senior Compliance Officer who thrives on clarity, ownership, and responsibility. Someone who knows how to turn regulatory language into something people understand and can act on.
   

  

 This is the perfect role for a person who enjoys taking ownership and wants to make sure everything works when things move fast. It's about creating structure and driving results in a dynamic, evolving environment.
   

  

 If this sounds like your kind of challenge - keep on reading!
   

  

 What your days might look like
   

  

 This is not a role where you will sit on the sidelines and review policies from afar. It is hands-on, in the middle of a fast-moving fintech bank, where compliance is about transforming regulations into scalable structures that empower the business.
   

  

 You will lead regulatory processes and implementation projects, coordinate audits, and review policies. You will turn regulations into clear, practical guidance while ensuring processes remain efficient and that your colleagues are informed. And when the regulatory landscape shifts, you will already be ahead of it.
   

  

 In this role you will be part of the Legal & Compliance Team, reporting to the Chief Legal Officer, and work closely with the Senior Management and teams across the company to keep our foundation solid as we scale.
   

  

 Who we think you are
   

  

 You likely have five or more years of experience in compliance, either from a financial institution, fintech company, or a consultancy firm. You’re experienced in handling SFSA engagements and well-versed in GDPR and privacy matters. You’re structured, calm under pressure, and known for your ability to run complex projects with precision and follow-through. You care about doing things right, but also about making things work. You are fluent in Swedish and English.
   

  

 Why Qred?
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech bank that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You will work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

 Here, legal and compliance are part of the conversation, not an afterthought. You will have direct access to decision-makers, real influence, and the freedom to improve things rather than just maintain them.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Producer
description:
**About Star Stable Entertainment** 




 Once upon a time in 2011, the founders of Star Stable Entertainment had a vision. They wanted to create a game that could make a difference. Although half of gamers are girls and women, they were under-represented in the gaming industry, both as characters and creators. We dreamed of an epic online world where tween and teen girls could share an amazing experience. And we wanted to challenge how things were done in a male-dominated industry. Fast forward to today, and our dream has come true tenfold - Star Stable Online stands as one of the most popular MMORPGs globally! At our HQ on Södermalm, our 140 employees are thrilled to continue to welcome players to the island of Jorvik, with its breathtaking scenery, beautiful horses, and magical quests. It’s wonderful to see that our dream resonates with so many players around the world, and we can’t wait to share more stories and experiences with them!
 



  





**The position** 




 As one of your strengths to drive collaborations with transparency and positivity? Would you like to drive the development of Star Stable projects, enabling our teams to deliver the best experience for our users and players? Then we have an opportunity that we want to share with you! We are currently looking for a Producer to join our team.
 



  





**As a Producer, you will:** 



* Drive the delivery of Star Stable projects, ensuring initiatives are completed on time, within scope, and with expected quality.
* Collaborate with project leadership and other teams to align on goals, strategy, and the execution of initiatives.
* Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between cross-functional crafts involved in the project. Ensure information and documentation flow seamlessly across teams and stakeholders.
* Act as a key point of contact, effectively balancing the needs of stakeholders, timelines, and quality requirements.
* Ensure the creation and maintenance of project plans, timelines, roadmaps, and deliverables across the entire development and delivery process.
* Oversee milestone reviews and coordinate with leads to ensure the project progresses according to schedule and aligns with Star Stable’s quality standards.
* Coordinate pre-launch, launch, and post-launch efforts with all involved teams, ensuring successful delivery and long-term outcomes for Star Stable projects.
* Collaborate with the leads to identify risks and dependencies, mitigating potential obstacles to smooth project delivery as part of the project roadmap.
* Help improve and refine Star Stable’s project management processes, ensuring efficiency and clarity of roles and responsibilities within cross-functional teams.



  





**We think you** 



* Has experience in a similar role in the games industry.
* Has good communication skills and aims to enable the project team to focus and deliver the best possible project.
* Have experience working with developers and a basic understanding of software development.



  





**Perks for joining us?** 



* A pretty sweet mission. We are developing the world's best horse-riding game for girls and we take that vision very seriously. We strive to hit that mark every single day.
* 30 vacation days (+ 3 additional squeeze days).
* A pension and insurance plan that mimics ITP1 and a parental pay top-up @90%.
* Health allowance at 5000 SEK per year.
* Hybrid working model - combine WFH and being together with the team at our new office located right amidst Södermalm GameDev cluster (Magnus Ladulåsgatan 65)
* Fitness discount of 18% at SATS gym + company workout classes.
* A dog room at the office! Bring your furry friend to work!



 Are you ready to be a chapter on this magical journey? Apply now! We can’t wait to hear your story!

title: Senior Internal Auditor
description:
Do you have a passion for Lending or Trading & Capital Markets processes?
   

  

 If you are interested to work with a broad range of business areas, from large corporates to private customers, this position may be the right one for you. Group Internal Audit is playing a crucial role not only as a 3rd line of defence control function, but also as a trusted advisor for the business. We are now looking for a colleague who can contribute and take lead in audits relating to Swedbank’s Swedish Business Areas.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Evaluate Lending and Trading & Capital Markets processes including data input quality, assumptions, methodologies, and validation processes.
* Assess Lending and Trading & Capital Markets governance frameworks to ensure they comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
* Identify potential risks associated with Lending and Trading & Capital Markets processes and provide recommendations for mitigating these risks.
* Work cross-functional with other GIA teams with different complementary competences and skills to cover the key risks for Swedbank’s Swedish Business Areas.
* Be involved in audits of Swedbank’s international branches in Norway, Finland, New York and Shanghai as well as the subsidiary Swedbank Hypotek.
* Prepare detailed audit reports documenting findings, recommendations, and management responses.
* Collaborate with stakeholders across various departments to ensure thorough understanding and transparent communication regarding audit findings.
* Stay updated on industry best practices, emerging trends in risk, and regulatory changes.
* Provide input to annual and continuous risk assessment, planning and quarterly reporting.
* Through audit engagements, assist senior management in identifying sustainable improvements towards transforming the Bank and helping it to reach its strategic goals.
* Constantly develop through structured internal and external education as well as collaboration with GIA colleagues with different competences and skills.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Demonstrated experience (minimum 5 years) from working in similar positions in the financial industry, preferably from a larger bank, external audit firm or supervisory authority.
* In-depth understanding of Lending and/or Trading & Capital Markets processes.
* Familiarity with IFRS 9 credit provisioning requirements.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to present complex information clearly to non-expert stakeholders.
* Strong interpersonal skills; being curious, courageous, maintaining high integrity as well as an adaptable mindset.
* Good analytical skills, a strategic mindset with strong business acumen. Experience from using data analytic tools such Power BI is a plus.
* Skills in project management with the ability to handle tight deadlines.
* Detailed-oriented and rigorous, however not forgetting the big picture.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration and/or Economics or a related field.
* Certification such as CIA, CISA, CFSA and SwedSec is a plus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 be a part of a department with experienced colleagues with deep knowledge of different aspects of the Swedbank. Group Internal Audit (GIA) is a valuable tool for the Board of Directors and the Group Executive Committee in the fulfilment of strategy and goals, but also when it comes to strengthen the internal control, risk management and organisational governance.
   

  

 GIA consists of ~75 employees in all our home markets Sweden, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. Our responsibilities cover all areas of Swedbank including audit activities in our branches in New York, Shanghai, Norway, and Finland. Our mission is to enhance and protect organisational value by providing risk-based and objective assurance, advice and insight. Our vision is to be a trusted advisor and to be the most attractive audit function in our home markets. We contribute to the Group’s achievement of the Strategic Direction by evaluating and improving the effectiveness of the organisation’s governance, risk management and internal control and in doing so promoting a sound and sustainable control environment and risk culture within the Group.”–
 **Lars Wålinder, your future manager.**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 21.11.2025.
   

  

**Location: Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager: Lars Wålinder**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: AVP/VP, Client Management Professional
description:
**About AB**
 We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. We realize that it's our people who give us a competitive advantage and drive success in the market, and our goal is to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work.
   

  

 Our culture of intellectual curiosity and collaboration creates an environment where you can thrive and do your best work. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, infusing new technologies into our business or providing thoughtful advice to our clients, we are fully invested in you. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us!
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
* Assist senior sales colleagues in growing and managing a book of business in keeping with agreed AUM / Revenue and business targets
* Work alongside senior sales colleagues on a dedicated base of clients & prospects
* Work with senior sales colleagues in facilitating connectivity across client / prospect relationships, helping to build relationship in collaboration with senior colleagues and independently
* Work with senior sales colleagues to build strategic plans for client & prospect organizations; mapping these organizations to ensure we have clear product / services / relationship goals. Review and update these plans as needed and track progress to ensure we are achieving our objectives
* Integrate and use third party data (where available) into account planning and client / prospect meetings to enhance, focus and improve the overall quality of all engagements. Be on the look out for new sources of data, working creatively to integrate this into the process
* Assist senior sales colleagues with the management of the sales process, participating in client & prospect meetings and facilitating the use of asset class specialists. In some instances, this may mean working independently, but to a plan carefully agreed with senior sales colleagues.
* Act as a source of leverage to senior sales colleagues, enabling a greater level of sales activity. Ensure a high level of quality client engagements (travelling as necessary) making use of roadshows & campaigns to increase sales activity across a broad range of priority products
* Share responsibility for prospecting which would involve arranging meetings, preparing prep memos, conducting research to understand potential opportunities/areas of focus
* Ensure that information on meetings and all engagements is up to date and accurate, clearly articulating opportunities and helping to monitor progress through a sales process
* Ensure close collaboration with the Consultant Relations team and partner closely with our Business Development & Cap Form teams across Multi-Asset Solutions, Fixed Income, Equities and Alternatives to help create and execute the strategy with clients and prospects.
* Build a deep understanding of AB’s product range, helping to ensuring that existing clients and prospects are familiar with the spectrum of our capabilities
* Work in partnership with our RFP teams in prioritizing and shaping responses to proposals.


**Qualifications & Key Competencies**
 Professional & Personal Profile:
   

  

* A relationship management / sales professional with a developing knowledge across asset classes (including knowledge of private alternatives) who has some experience of client management and is refining / developing their skill set
* Track record of outstanding performance and achievement
* At least 5 - 8 years of experience in the financial services industry in client service / sales experience
* Experience with the Nordics is required and having an established client network in the region is preferred
* Ability to ‘cold call’ prospects and a willingness to travel
* Willingness to work as a member of a team, either in support of senior sales & asset class specialists or more independently on occasion
* A results-orientated self-starter who can quickly understand client needs and focus on commercial delivery
* Good organizational skills with an emphasis on being able to manage multiple initiatives with diligence and care
* Ability to develop long-term relationships with clients and internal partners
* A belief that client is first and the ability to influence and lead others to prioritize in this way
* Ability to collaborate across all levels of the organization
* Exceptional verbal, written communication, and presentation skills
* Experience using data and various information sources in the management of client relationships
* CFA (or similar) designation is beneficial
* English language skills


 (NB This job description is not intended to establish a total definition of the position, but an outline of the responsibilities. Some additional tasks may be assigned.)
   

  

 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Regional Sales Director, Northern Europe - Identity & Biometric Solutions (IBS)
description:
Location: STOCKHOLM, Sweden
   

  

 Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.
   

  

 "As market leader within Digital Identity and Security, Thales makes personal digital interaction simple and secure in an increasingly connected society. From secure software to biometrics and encryption, Thales provides technologies and services that enables business and governments to authenticate identities and protect data, enabling its clients to offer trusted digital services to billions of individuals. Located in Älvsjö since 2012, the site houses both a commercial office as well as two productions within Identity & Biometric Solutions, and Banking & Payment Services. Working commercially across all business areas within Digital Identity and Security, Thales has become a trusted partner within various businesses as well as governments throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Title:** 
**Regional Sales Director, Northern Europe / Thales’ Identity and Biometric Solutions (IBS)**
**Base location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid model).**
**The position requires that you undergo and be approved in accordance with the applicable regulations for security protection. For positions where Thales has requirements for security clearance, this may entail a requirement for Swedish citizenship.**
 We are looking for the Regional Sales Director for IBS Business Line in Northern Europe (9 countries) based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Thales Identity and Biometric Solutions Business Line is part of the global Thales Group, which employs more than 80,000 people in 68 countries. Your responsibility will be to manage IBS sales team of 5 Sales Managers located in several countries in Northern Europe and to drive the sales and account management operations and to supervise the projects execution in the region with the objective to deliver sustained profitable growth.
   

  

 You will be reporting to VP Sales IBS Europe and Eurasia and be mentored and onboarded to existing customer portfolio and trained for relevant products and solutions.
   

  

 In order to apply for this role, we value that you have thorough knowledge of managing sales teams in complex sales of ICT solutions in B2G or B2B environment. Also, proven experience in public procurement processes is an asset.
   

  

**Managing a team of 5 people the ideal candidate will be expected to drive the team to:**
* Develop and maintain deep understanding of the target market per country – customer needs, priorities, trends, competitive landscape etc.
* Build strong trust-based relations with the customers and with the key partners.
* Build and maintain wide pipeline of business opportunities in mid and long term.
* Define the capture plan including winning strategy for all target opportunities and to orchestrate internal resources for capture plan execution.
* Drive the tender teams towards successful capture of the tendered projects.
* Target growth and profitability.
* Coordinate IBS actions in the country.


**Qualifications:**
* Strong background in managing complex sales of ICT solutions in B2G or B2G environment.
* Experience with managing sales teams preferably – preferably in international environment.
* Proven experience with public procurement processes is an asset.
* Ability to work with long sales-cycles.
* Experience in international matrix organizations.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* University education on Master level.
* Fluent spoken and written Swedish and English is mandatory


**Personal qualifications:**
* Autonomous, self-driven and resilient.
* Hunting gene, energetic and positive minded.
* Structured and able to comply to processes.
* Outstanding networking skills are of great importance.
* Open and transparent mindset, honest team-player.


**What We Can Offer:**
 Thales provides an excellent opportunity to develop a dynamic career in a friendly, international team and environment where we value your contribution, believe in your potential and are committed to your development. We support you with a clear career path that is underpinned by our policies of promotion from within, mobility, training and development programs. In line with our strategy of putting the needs of customers at the center of everything we do, and our commitment to innovation, we know it is our people who make it happen, and together we strive to exceed our customers’ expectations.
   

  

 Does this sound like the opportunity for you? Apply today!
   

  

 At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

title: Account Manager Wholesale EMEA (France, based in HQ Stockholm)
description:
Join one of Sweden’s most loved global brands in our mission to make life of families with young children, easier and more fun!
 



  





 We are looking for an
 **French speaking Account Manager** 
 to strengthen our Wholesale EMEA team in Stockholm.
 



  





 As an Account Manager at BabyBjörn AB you will be responsible for executing the regional wholesale strategy in alignment with BabyBjörn’s global objectives.
 



  





 This position oversees B2B partnerships across the French market, driving sustainable sales growth, optimizing account performance, and ensuring profitability targets are met.
 



  





 The role requires a strong focus on relationship management, business development, and cross-functional collaboration to enhance brand presence and commercial success with our B2B WH partners.
 



  





 You will execute, measure and analyze B2B marketing activities, working closely to the EMEA marketing team and in alignment with the commercial plan.
 



  





 The position includes regular visits to markets (up to 60 days per year / occasionally on weekends) covering go-to-market activities, staff training, store merchandising, participation in fairs and customer activities.
 



  





 This is a permanent position with a six-month probation period within the EMEA team. The position is based in Sundbyberg in our Stockholm HQ.
 



  





**WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:** 




  





**We see a team player who is passion about sales, targets & consumer insights!** 



* Good communication skills, fluent in French (mother tongue or professional level) and English.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in sales, managing areas, accounts, or partners, in a consumer goods environment preferably.
* Highly numerate, you can formulate complex terms and analyze sales data.
* Well-travelled, planning and going on business trips is something you are comfortable with.
* Curious, you dare to ask questions in your will to understand customers and situations.
* Resilient, when plan A fails, you can learn from it and explore plan B and C.
* Structured and organized, you present, motivate, plan, follow up and reflect on your actions.



  





**We are looking forward to receiving your application!** 





 We are accepting applications for this job until November 30, 2025.
 





 Send your application via Easy Apply on LinkedIn.
 




  





 Do you have any questions about the position? Please feel free to contact HR Business Partner, Malena Lindblad, malena.lindblad@babybjorn.com or Regional Manager EMEA, Frédéric Guillaume, frederic.guillaume@babybjorn.com.
 



  





*BabyBjörn AB is a Swedish, family-owned company that has around 190 employees within its Groups and develops, markets, and distributes children´s products, primarily for the group 0-3 years. The company was founded in 1961, and since then more than 50 million children have been carried in our baby carriers. We have a turnover today of more than SEK 1 billion, and 95% of our sales are exports to more than fifty countries. As we exist for all types of families, no matter their structure, lifestyle, or identity, we strive for this to be reflected in our organization as well.* 




*More information is available at www.babybjorn.com* 




  





**Important information when applying to BabyBjörn AB:** 




 By submitting your application, you consent to BabyBjörn AB storing and potentially using your personal data for recruitment purposes for a period of 24 months following the date on which the data was obtained. Your personal data will not be processed for any purpose other than previously stated, and your data will not be transferred to a third party. For more information about where and for how long we process your personal data, as well as more information about your rights regarding erasure and data portability, please contact us at mydata@babybjorn.com.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Job Description:** 
 Account Executive
 



**Locations:** 
 London, Amsterdam, Berlin, Oslo, Stockholm
 



  





**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 




 Gelato sits at the intersection of some of today’s most important trends: the continued rise and embrace of the creator economy, global supply chains, and e-commerce, and building toward a more sustainable future. These trends are having an impact on how Printers can cost-effectively scale their businesses and with GelatoConnect our goal is to provide them with an end-to-end production platform that helps them take on these global macro trends to profitably scale their operations.
 



  





 As an
 **Account Executive** 
 in GelatoConnect, you will be responsible for driving fast, transactional sales cycles and contributing directly to Gelato’s growth by converting inbound interest and outbound leads into new customers. This role gives you the opportunity to own the full sales process.
 



 You will:
 


* Own the full sales cycle for transactional SMB deals, from qualification to closing.
* Convert inbound demand quickly and efficiently into revenue.
* Manage a high volume of opportunities with speed, accuracy, and consistency.
* Consistently meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales quotas.
* Maintain excellent CRM hygiene to ensure forecasting accuracy and sales insights.
* Provide frontline feedback to Marketing, Product, and Partnerships to improve our go-to-market approach.
* Evangelize the benefits of GelatoConnect to SMB printers and help them scale profitably.



  





**Who you are** 




 You have a start-up mentality, incredible stamina, resilience, and grit. You’re a doer. You change until you win. You feel comfortable getting your hands dirty while never losing sight of long-term ambition. You are confident in your abilities and experience, yet humble and curious in your execution. Embracing change, complexity, and ambiguity while also navigating a little bit of chaos is essential for success in this role.
 



  




* 4+ years of B2B sales experience, ideally in SaaS, e-commerce, or cloud-based platforms.
* Demonstrated success in a
 **high-velocity sales environment** 
 (SMB/transactional).
* Strong track record of meeting or exceeding revenue targets.
* Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.
* Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and sales reporting tools.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a bias toward action and ownership.
* Fluency in English; additional European languages are a plus.



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Product Manager - Payment Orchestration (Parental Cover)
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**About The Role**
 As a
 **Product Manager** 
 on the
 **Payment Orchestration** 
 team, you’ll lead one of the most strategic and impactful areas within Arrive’s Payments organization. Payment Orchestration serves as the
 **brain of our real-time payment engine** 
 — determining billing models, routing logic, retry strategies, and optimizing cost and success across markets, methods, and providers.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with engineering, finance, payment teams, Risk, and PSP partners to ensure our payment flows are intelligent, adaptive, and cost-efficient — with logic that responds to risk signals, regional rules, and customer needs.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about
 **complex decisioning systems, optimization, and platform-scale payments** 
 , this is a unique opportunity to make a global impact.
   

  

**Vision**
 Deliver an
 **intelligent, adaptive, and cost-efficient** 
 orchestration engine that ensures every transaction succeeds at the
 **lowest possible cost and risk** 
 .
   

  

**Your Mission**
 Design and evolve the infrastructure that decides
 **how, when, and where transactions are routed, retried, and billed** 
 .
   

  

 Lead the strategy to
 **maximize payment success** 
 and
 **minimize processing and interchange costs** 
 across regions.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead with Logic: Define how transactions are handled based on market, customer type, payment method, and risk. Design and refine our billing logic and understand the dependencies between payment flows and orchestration rules.
* Own the Strategy: Take ownership of our retry logic and smart fallback handling. You'll champion strategies that future-proof our ability to intelligently route, retry, and recover payments.
* Optimize for Impact: Lead initiatives to optimize processing, acquiring, and interchange costs without sacrificing performance. You'll define our multi-processor strategy to reduce dependency and leverage best-in-class routing.
* Collaborate Across the Ecosystem: Work with payment, risk, fraud, and finance teams to ensure our orchestration logic aligns with our overall payment strategy. Ensure compliance with all regulatory frameworks.
* Empower Your Team: Provide clear product direction and act as the orchestration domain expert. Inspire your team to solve the right problems and foster a strong product-engineering partnership.


**You’ll Thrive If You**
* Have experience with payment routing, retry logic, or orchestration engines in PSP, fintech, or eCommerce environments.
* Understand billing models, card scheme logic, and cost structures (processing, acquiring, interchange).
* Are data-driven, using metrics to guide prioritization and decision-making.
* Communicate clearly across technical, commercial, and leadership teams.
* Enjoy tackling complex, technical, and cross-market challenges.
* Take initiative, drive results, and leverage data to improve flow success and cost efficiency.


**Key Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology, or related field (advanced degree preferred).
* 8–10 years of experience in payments or product management, ideally focused on digital payment solutions or orchestration.
* Experience across European and U.S. markets, with knowledge of regulatory and scheme requirements.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills to monitor and optimize performance.
* Strong understanding of card schemes, regional regulations, and compliance frameworks.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a track record of scaling payment platforms and driving customer-centric growth.
* Skilled in API-led development, agile methodologies, and data analysis.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with experience working in global, distributed teams.


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile, YourParkingSpace and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Scala Backend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 5–8 years of backend development experience
* Strong knowledge of Scala and functional programming
* Experience working in microservices architectures
* Familiarity with agile/Scrum workflows
* Good communication and collaboration skills
* Background in Java or similar languages
* Experience with Svelte (front-end exposure)


**Application deadline:** 
 12-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
