title: System Architect for Supporting and Coordinating Specialist Role
description:
We are at the forefront of an exciting and transformative journey – the development towards smart, sustainable, and connected factories. Embracing and driving this dynamic change in the industry, we are seeking a System Architect with a strong background in hardware, electronics, and embedded systems to play a key role in defining system-level requirements and driving architectural governance. If you are passionate about shaping the future of manufacturing, this could be your next challenge.
   

  

**Your Role**
 You will be part of the Solution Architecture and Verification Team within the System Solution Department, R&D, focusing on system requirements and interfaces for products supporting automated assembly in industrial environments - with a particular emphasis on hardware architecture in the broader system context.
   

  

 This is a supporting specialist role with broad responsibilities, including:
   

  

* Drive and coordinate the Product Architecture Governance Forum to ensure alignment and strategic consistency of system interfaces across the product portfolio.
* Act as a technical reviewer in the product development process with a focus on system-level impacts, especially hardware-software integration.
* Evaluate and review design proposals for architectural compliance and long-term system coherence.
* Support development teams by recommending proven interfaces, platforms, reusable modules and communication protocols.
* Define and maintain system-level interfaces to ensure stability and maximize reusability across products and platforms.
* Participate actively in cross-functional competence groups to promote architectural best practices and knowledge sharing.


 You will collaborate extensively across disciplines and geographies, from concept to product launch. The solutions you are part of shaping, improve efficiency, quality, safety, speed, ergonomics, and environmental performance.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm (Hybrid workplace)
   

  

 Reporting to: Team Manager, Solution Architecture/Verification
   

  

**To Succeed, You Will Need**
* A master’s degree in electronics, mechatronics or equivalent.
* Experience with system-level hardware architecture and hardware-software integration.
* Strong skills in stakeholder analysis and architectural governance.
* Fluency in English, Swedish is a plus.


**In Return, We Offer You**
 At Atlas Copco, we foster a friendly atmosphere, and a culture built on respectful interaction and ethical behavior. We value personal development and well-being, and we take pride in supporting each other.
   

  

**You’ll Have The Opportunity To**
* See your ideas realized and make a real impact.
* Work with cutting-edge technologies and global teams.
* Explore career opportunities across the Atlas Copco Group.


**Uniting curious minds**
 Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable data pipelines and data infrastructure.
* Develop and optimize our data warehouse and intuitive, well-documented data models to support analytics, reporting, self-service, and AI-driven initiatives.
* Ensure data quality, consistency, and reliability through validation, monitoring, and testing tools.
* Work cross-functionally with stakeholders from Product, RevOps, GTM, Finance, and other teams to define key metrics and deliver actionable insights.
* Build and maintain dashboards and automated reporting systems.
* Identify patterns, trends, and opportunities through exploratory analysis and deep dives across the organization.


**Who You Are**
* Solid experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, or similar technical analytics role.
* Experience with SQL, dbt, Python, modern BI tools, and hands-on experience with Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouses).
* Deep understanding of data modeling, ELT best practices, and building systems that are reliable and scalable.
* A collaborative, curious mindset with the confidence to work independently and challenge assumptions
* Excited to partner directly with business stakeholders and drive decisions through data.
* But most importantly, you are someone who
+ “Gets stuff done” and understands building a $10bn company isn’t always glamorous and takes hard work and long hours
+ Strives in a fast-paced environment where the answers aren’t always clear and processes are few


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.
 



  





 Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 We are looking for a versatile data engineer with strong software engineering skills to join our Partner Ecosystem team. In this role, you will be a major contributor in designing and implementing the big data pipelines—real-time and batch-powering our products. Moreover, you will contribute in enabling Hive Products by working closely with our partner video platforms, such as Microsoft Teams Town Hall and Vimeo!
 



  





**Working As a Data Engineer, You Will** 



* Design and implement big data pipelines on top of our data platform.
* Develop solutions leveraging our tech stack: Spark/Scala, Databricks and Delta lake.
* Work on end-to-end delivery of data to our applications.
* Contribute to shaping our product by bringing insights and innovative ideas to discussions.
* Collaborate with the team to engineer high-quality and reliable solutions.
* Help analyze our data to improve our products



  





**Working In Partner Eco, You Will** 



* Design and implement our clients for the collection of data
* Work closely with our partner developers to enable Hive with high quality
* Own the data from the collection to its manipulation
* Align and want to live by our core values: customer-centricity, innovation, and empowerment.



  





**More Details** 




**Role type:** 
 Full-timewith a standard probation period
 



**Start date:** 
 Jan/Feb 2026 (flexible)
 



**Working hours:** 
 Align with CET (Central European Time)
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: ±2 days/week in the office), can consider Berlin, Germany
 



*🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!* 




  





**Who we are looking for** 




 We're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation — but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We also don’t expect you to tick every box. If you’re excited about this role and ready to learn, we’d love to hear from you!
 



**We Are Looking For Someone With** 



* Bachelors within Computer Science or a similar field, or equivalent experience
* Expert in Apache Spark and/or other distributed data processing frameworks
* Experience in delivering tested and maintainable code in projects with multiple contributors
* Knowledgeable in cloud environments and familiar with common cloud-native data storages



**We See It As a Bonus If You Have** 



* Experience in TypeScript or JavaScript
* Prior experience working with video streaming solutions, networking, and/or peer-to-peer
* Experience with mentorship or informal leadership



**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are** 



* A team player, who shares information and expertise, promotes team effectiveness by facilitating and building on the ideas of others
* Resourceful, who are quick to change behavior to adapt to changing circumstances
* A problem solver, who loves challenges and finding creative, practical solutions
* A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood
* Service-minded, who has a visible approach and shows sincere interest in customers and their concerns



  





**Why join Hive?** 



* Global Impact: Partner with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and diverse environment that values curiosity, rapid learning, and new perspectives.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.
* Great Benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!
* Flexibility: We value flexibility and trust. Whether you’re balancing personal commitments or exploring new ideas, you’ll find support and autonomy here with flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.



  





**Recruitment process: what to expect** 




 To apply, please submit your CV and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English. Please submit applications by November 21st.
 



  





 Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:
 


1. Intro call: Meet our People & Talent Partner for a chat about your background, motivation, and what excites you about Hive. You’ll also learn more about our culture and how we work.
2. Hiring manager interview: Meet Claudio, one of our Engineering Managers and your potential future manager. This conversation focuses on your experience, career goals, and how you could contribute to the team.
3. Technical interview: Complete an at-home assessment, which will form the basis of a technical discussion with members of the Partner Ecosystem team. Together, you’ll explore your approach to problem-solving and technical design.
4. Data engineering interview: Meet a member of our Data Guild for a final conversation focused on team fit, ways of working, and your approach to data engineering. This is also your chance to ask questions and get a deeper sense of our data culture at Hive.
5. Reference checks: We take security seriously and conduct two reference checks as part of our compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
6. Decision: Timely feedback and next steps - our goal is to complete the process within around 4 weeks, depending on your availability.

title: Solution Architect to Telenor
description:
Looking for a workplace for the future? At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most - relationships between people.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Architect, you are a forward-looking, ambitious generalist with a strong interest in both business and technology. You will navigate between strategic discussions and operational execution, adapting to multiple challenges across many fields and technologies. With technical expertise and hands-on experience in software and/or product development from ideation to production and beyond, you take a holistic approach in system design - understanding how people, business processes, and applications interact to drive company success.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Drive Measurable Impact - You will impact customer experience, optimize business and IT efficiency, and accelerate time to market by designing scalable, resilient, and future-proof systems. Your architectural guidance will directly influence strategic funding decisions and investment priorities while ensuring technology aligns with business goals.
* Empower Stakeholders - You will act as a trusted advisor to business and technical teams, providing guidance on key decisions, requirement creation, and technology strategy. By producing high-value architectural deliverables and fostering strong stakeholder collaboration, you will help prepare teams for disruptive events and long-term success.
* Build the Architecture Discipline - You will drive architectural excellence by mentoring colleagues, shaping technical direction, and championing best practices across the organization. Through governance, process improvements, and a challenger mindset, you will develop a strong architectural culture, ensuring alignment with business objectives while fostering continuous learning.


**Who You Are**
 You take ownership, drive initiatives, and enjoy turning ideas into real solutions. With a combination of logical thinking, curiosity, and creativity, you communicate clearly, collaborate easily, and balance both technical and business perspectives. You are a problem solver who thrives in complex and dynamic environments, growth-minded and eager to learn, leading through clarity and influence rather than authority. You value transparency, collaboration, and integrity in everything you do.
   

  

 You are either a Solution Architect today or currently working as a Developer, Product Owner, or Business Analyst, ready to take the next step toward becoming a Solution Architect.
   

  

**Hard Skills**
* Broad exposure to multiple technologies and architectural domains, with the ability to connect technical solutions to business outcomes.
* Comfortable applying data-driven thinking to decisions
* Experience designing or contributing to scalable, secure, and resilient systems - balancing long-term vision with practical delivery.
* Nice to have: familiarity with workflow orchestration, rule engines, Spring Boot, or front-end frameworks like Vue.js.


**Soft Skills**
* Strong communicator and storyteller - able to bridge technical and non-technical perspectives and simplify complex concepts.
* Strategic and adaptable thinker - comfortable operating in evolving business and technology contexts.
* Collaborative and proactive - fosters alignment across teams, mentors peers, and helps shape a culture of clarity, learning, and technical excellence.


**Our promise to you**
*We are better together.*
 Here, you'll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other's backs through ups and downs.
   

  

*We support relationships and societies.*
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

*We make room for life.*
 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

*We invite you to a career in motion.*
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you'll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don't wait-reach out today.
   

  

 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Anki Snis anki.snis@se.experis.com, +46 70-3775969 and Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Dynamics 365 Solution Architect
description:
**Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att skapa lösningar på Microsofts mest kraftfulla plattformar? På Innofactor Solutions söker vi en senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect som vill kombinera affärsförståelse med teknisk spets och driva projekt från första idé till färdig implementering.**
**Om rollen**
 Vi växer i
 **Stockholm** 
 och möter ett ökat kundbehov av avancerade Microsoft-lösningar. Nu söker vi en
 **senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect** 
 som vill ta helhetsansvar för att designa och implementera lösningar som skapar verklig affärsnytta i regionen.
   

  

 I den här rollen leder du arbetet från första kunddialog till färdig leverans och är länken mellan affärsbehov och teknik. Du arbetar nära sälj, utvecklare och kunder och driver projekt där hela Microsoft-ekosystemet tas tillvara.
   

  

**Huvudansvar:**
* Designa och implementera lösningar i Dynamics 365 Sales och Customer Service, gärna även Field Service eller Business Central.
* Skapa integrationslösningar med API:er, Azure Service Bus och Logic Apps samt modellera processer och anpassa Dynamics efter verksamhetens behov.
* Delta i pre-sale, ta fram lösningsförslag, demo och presentationsmaterial.


 Tjänsten är placerad i
 **Stockholm** 
 . Du kan självklart arbeta både hemifrån och från vårt centrala kontor, men vi ser gärna att du bor i Stockholmsområdet och kan komma in regelbundet.
   

  

**Det vi letar efter**
 ✅ Djup erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 och Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, gärna Power Virtual Agents/AI Builder)
   

  

 ✅ Stark kompetens inom integrationslösningar (API, Azure Service Bus, Logic Apps)
   

  

 Vi tror att du trivs här om du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att samarbeta nära kund. Vårt team arbetar agilt med stor frihet under ansvar.
   

  

**Saker som kan vara till hjälp, men som du inte behöver kunna från början**
 ➕ Power BI – diskutera arkitektur och skapa enklare dashboards för demo/PoC
   

  

 ➕ Förståelse om hur AI kan användas för kundinsikter och prediktiv analys
   

  

 ➕ Certifiering Power Platform Solution Architect Expert (meriterande om du redan har Dynamics 365 Solution Architect Expert)
   

  

**Vad du får hos oss**
 Du blir en nyckelspelare i strategiska projekt för några av Nordens mest spännande kunder. Här får du frihet att forma lösningar som gör skillnad och en kultur som värdesätter innovation, kompetensdelning och balans i livet.
   

  

**Förmåner**
 Utöver lönen får du flera förmåner som gör vardagen smidigare och roligare:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling
* Flexibelt arbete
* Kollegor som stöttar och delar med sig
* Aktiviteter och nätverk


**Innofactor** 
 är den ledande drivkraften bakom den moderna digitala organisationen i Norden. Vi jobbar med över 1 000 kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, har det bredaste lösningsutbudet och den starkaste Microsoft-kompetensen i regionen. Vi är cirka 550 specialister i Finland, Sverige, Danmark och Norge.
   

  

 👉 www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou

title: Senior .Net Fullstack Developer

title: Senior Account Manager (Enterprise)
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Founded in 2018 and headquartered in Stockholm, Proxify helps 2,500+ companies globally scale their tech teams with top-tier talent in Software, Data and AI. When internal demand for tech skills arises, we deliver carefully vetted, tailored developers within 48 hours removing traditional hiring delays so clients can move fast.
 



  





 Recognised by the Financial Times as the 3rd fastest-growing company in Sweden (2025), and a member of the Deloitte Fast 50 Sweden (2024), we’re trusted by startups, scale-ups and global brands like Securitas, Electrolux and Lufthansa.
 



  





**Role overview** 




  





 As
 **Senior Account Manager** 
 , you will manage end-to-end client engagement: discovery, proposal, negotiation, onboarding, retention, and expansion. You will ensure clients derive real value from Proxify’s engineers, build lasting partnerships, and grow your account portfolio.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  





 - Build and nurture relationships with senior decision-makers; manage a portfolio of enterprise clients to drive satisfaction and loyalty.
 



 - Engage regularly with C-level and senior technical stakeholders to shape their tech-resourcing and project strategies.
 



 - Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities, negotiate contracts, and secure long-term renewals.
 



 - Coordinate with internal talent, engineering, and delivery teams to align resources, timelines, and outcomes with client expectations.
 



 - Monitor account health, report on performance, advise clients on improvements, and manage risks.
 



 - Match developers to client needs using your technical understanding, working with Client Engineering to ensure quality and fit.
 



  





**Must-have** 




  





 - 5+ years managing enterprise or large B2B client accounts; experience in tech services, software, staffing, or outsourcing (UK market preferred).
 



 - Proven
 **track record of closing deals** 
 , growing revenue, and retaining long-term clients.
 



 -
 **Credible technical fluency and understanding** 
 gained via hands-on roles (developer, project/product/engineering lead) or working closely with technical teams.
 



 -
 **Strong negotiation and commercial skills** 
 ; comfortable discussing pricing, SLAs, scope, and delivery models with senior stakeholders.
 



 - Ability and willingness to
 **travel** 
**1-2 business trips per month** 
 as needed.
 



 -
 **Native English** 
 .
 



 -
 **Self-starter attitude** 
 ; ownership of outcomes, persistence, and ability to manage multiple projects/clients.
 



 -
 **Experience with CRM** 
 , forecasting and account planning tools.
 



  





**Nice-to-have** 




  





 - Experience in staffing, developer sourcing, or tech recruitment.
 



 - Comfortable in distributed team or remote-work environments.
 



 - Knowledge of current tech trends (cloud, AI, frameworks, remote work).
 



 - Familiarity with enterprise contracting, procurement or legal norms.
 



 - Wider professional network across the UK.
 



  





**Why you will love this opportunity** 




  





 🌐 Help tech teams close skill gaps and create job opportunities for tech talent worldwide.
 



 ❤️ Be part of a humble, supportive, and tech-savvy team.
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships in the UK and Ireland.
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth.
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international team of 39 countries, with occasional in-person meetups.
 



  





**Why it may not be your match** 




  





 ❌ You like every day to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep things agile.
 



 ❌ You lack any exposure to or understanding of tech and its applications.
 



 ❌ You don’t have an English level (advanced or, ideally, native).
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Please send your CV (in English) explaining:
 



  





 1. Your experience working with enterprise clients (ideally UK).
 



 2. Your technical background working closely with developer and engineering teams.
 



 3. Why you find Proxify’s mission attractive and what excites you about this opportunity.

title: Master thesis: Life Cycle Assessment of Connected Vehicles.
description:
Doing your master thesis with us at IVL gives you the opportunity to get a unique insight into our research and our work. It's a chance to learn a lot more in your field of study. We welcome master thesis students every semester.
   

  

**About The Master Thesis**
**Background**
 Modern vehicles increasingly rely on continuous connectivity to cloud and internet services for software updates, remote diagnostics, navigation, infotainment, fleet management, and more. While these digital functions can improve efficiency (e.g. route optimization, predictive maintenance), they also impose environmental burdens through data transmission, edge/cloud computing, and data center operations (energy use, cooling, resource consumption).
   

  

**Purpose & Scope**
 The thesis aims to
 **quantify and analyse the life-cycle environmental impact** 
 of connected-vehicle services, taking into account both the digital infrastructure (network, edge, cloud, data centers) and the potential energy/efficiency gains enabled by the services themselves. Key tasks include:
   

  

* Estimating the environmental impacts from data transmission, computation, and storage per vehicle
* Assessing net impact: balancing emissions from digital operations against energy savings or emission reductions enabled by connected services (e.g. eco-driving, route optimization).
* Conducting sensitivity/scenario analysis to explore how results vary with assumptions (e.g. data volumes, electricity mix, placement of computation).


**Prerequisites**
 We welcome applicants from master programs such as industrial ecology or sustainable energy systems. Previous knowledge in LCA is preferred but not mandatory.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Flexible (earliest January 2026)
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 For questions, please contact: Julia Lindholm julia.lindholm@ivl.se
   

  

 Interested?
   

  

 Submit your interest by clicking on "Registration of interest".

title: Electronic Engineer
description:
Position: Electronic Engineer
Sweden - Danderyd - on site
Department: Trimble Optical & Imaging, Danderyd
We are looking for the future engineering stars! Are you one of them?  

Trimble Danderyd develops and manufactures optical measurement instruments, total stations and scanning total stations, for the surveying and construction markets. Our products are market leading and have a reputation of quality, productivity and reliability.
Trimble R&D in Danderyd contains a broad range of core disciplines; FW/SW, electronics, mechanics and optics. Today our R&D department consists of approximately 90 engineers, all highly qualified within their fields. The Electronics & Regulatory Compliance team consists of 14 engineers responsible for instrument hardware and product compliance.
As an Electronics Engineer at Trimble you will have the opportunity to work in cross functional teams with developers of all disciplines. To succeed in this role, you should have a genuine technical interest and like to work in teams.
Job description* Design, develop, verify and document embedded electronics for our optical total stations
* Work together with other developers in cross functional projects and pre-studies.
* General and genuine interest in technology and excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.


Required skills and experience* Applicable Bachelors or Masters degree.
* 2-5 years of experience in the field of electronics development.
* A large sense of responsibility and a high level of autonomy in electronic design and development allowing you to produce innovative solutions to the complex problems that you will encounter.
* Able to express yourself well in Swedish and English, both written and spoken (fluent)
* Experience with signal integrity/high-frequency designs.
* Experience with power integrity designs.
* Experience with sensor implementation and/or lasers.
* Experience with design verification.
* Experience with embedded systems.
* Experience with Altium.
* Experience with production requirements.


We offer* An opportunity to work in a multicultural and successful global company
* Possibilities to grow and learn
* Excellent career opportunities in a global company
* Varied work tasks and development projects

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a
Senior Software Development Engineer*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners,* *customers* *and society. Together,* *we’re* *pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food,* *water* *and shipping.*  

*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
About the job
We are now looking for a Senior Software Developer for Control Systems to join us. With this position you will become a part of the global Automation Development team, which is responsible for the development of advanced control systems and IoT solutions for all Alfa Laval core products. As the ideal candidate you will have a deep understanding of control systems, and play a crucial role in advancing our control systems and contributing to our mission of achieving "autonomous operation" for our core products. You will be engaged in a dynamic Agile environment throughout the entire product lifecycle.
Your responsibilities will include:* Software engineering on PLC and HMI platform for Alfa Laval product framework, involving feature breakdown, task specification, programming, testing, documentation, source code management, deployment, and issue tracking.
* Web-based HMI development using our design language.
* Establishing global automation standards for the platforms we use through cross-site collaboration.
* Working in sprints as a part of a self-organizing team, contributing to the evolution of our products.
* Maintaining previous released of PLC / HMI framework, toolkits, libraries.
  

If you are a passionate PLC or Embedded systems software developer with a keen interest in cutting-edge control systems and IoT solutions, this opportunity is for you!  

This position is based in Flemingsberg or Lund in Sweden or Pune in India.*Note: We do not offer relocation for this position.*
Who you are
You are a self-motivated and versatile developer with a strong interest in developing pioneering end-to-end SW solutions. As a person you are creative, problem-solving, and have troubleshooting skills. You are comfortable with working in a cross-cultural and cross-disciplinary environment. You are open minded and a team player with a high level of attention to details.  

Furthermore, we believe you have:* A university degree, preferably a Master's (MSc, MEng, MTech) or Bachelor's (BSc, BEng, BTech), from anyone of the following field:  

Mechatronics / Control & Automation / Embedded Systems / Industrial Automation / Electrical & Electronics / Instrumentation & Control / Computer Science or a related field.
* Extensive experience in PLC software development using C, C++, ST and other IEC-61131-3 programming languages.
* Some years of work experience in software development and standardizations, with PLC platform and/or embedded systems.
* Experience in industrial communication protocols such as Powerlink, ProfNet, EtherNet/IP, EtherCAT, Modbus, Profibus and OPC-UA.
* Experience in PLC platform (i.e. B&R, Siemens, Rockwell) is considered as an advantage.
* Experience in reading and understanding P&ID / Electrical drawings / FDS.
* Strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
* A customer-focused mindset and the ability to collaborate effectively within a team.
* Knowledge of Software Development Models & Methods (OOP, S88, PackML).
* Experience in developing web-based HMI Screens, with basic knowledge of HTML.

What’s in it for you
We offer an engaging role in a collaborative, globally inclusive environment where we support each other in personal and collective growth, and the creation of value. You will hold a position that actively involves you in the development of innovative and highly advanced products. This role offers the chance to be part of a worldwide organization with significant career prospects for well-suited candidates.
If you're ready to take on an exciting challenge, we want to hear from you! We hire for potential and will make sure to train you if needed!
For more information, please contact
Ranjith Rajachandran, Software Solutions Manager, Automation Development.
Ranjith.Rajachandran@alfalaval.com
Richa Sethi, Talent Acquisition Partner, richa.sethi@alfalaval.com
For union information, please contact
Anders Jansson, Unionen, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
Axel Schäring, Akademikerna, axel.scharing@alfalaval.com  

We review applications continually and interviews will be held on a rolling basis. We therefore encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible but no later than November 26th, 2025, through our career page https://career.alfalaval.com/jobs/search  

Welcome with your application! *GDPR Compliant**Applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice.* *Our commitment to integrity**We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe* *behavioral* *traits can* *provide* *important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this, we apply* *Pymetrics* *assessments. Upon application, you will be invited to play the assessment games and completing them is mandatory.**As part of our commitment to* *maintaining* *a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.*

title: R&D Engineer, Machine Tending – ABB Robotics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This role sits within ABB's Robotics business, a leading global robotics company. We're entering an exciting new chapter as we’ve announced the plan for SoftBank Group to acquire ABB Robotics. SoftBank is a globally recognized technology group and investor/operator focused on AI, robotics, and next-generation computing. By joining us now, you’ll be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of robotics—working alongside world-class experts in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment.


This Position reports to:


R&D Team Lead **Your role and responsibilities**


Are you ready to shape the future of robotics with cutting-edge AI and embedded systems? Join ABB Robotics as an **R&D Engineer** and contribute to the development of intelligent machine tending solutions. With a background in autonomous systems, computer vision, and deep learning, you’ll be part of a team driving innovation in robotics.


In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to ABB’s success through technology, software, product, and system development. Each day, you’ll identify and implement innovative solutions to relevant problems, working both independently and as part of a high-performing R&D team.


Your main responsibilities:

* Working as an independent and reliable contributor in R&D projects.
* Performing tasks across software and system development, including concept creation, implementation, integration, testing, and continuous improvement.
* Applying architectural and design constraints, standards, and processes to ensure robust solutions.
* Driving the achievement of project targets (quality, time, scope, cost) and proactively managing risks.

**Qualifications**

* 2+ years of experience in R&D roles focused on intelligent systems and robotics.
* Proven experience in developing and testing AI solutions for autonomous systems.
* A Master’s degree in AI Engineering, Embedded Systems or similar.
* Interested in and experienced with AI engineering, embedded systems, autonomous robotics, Machine learning, computer vision (camera/radar), etc.
* Programming in Python, C++, and working with tools like TensorFlow, Torch, and Git.

**More about us**


Recruiting Manager: Daniel Andersson. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Pia Sandström, +4672 525 90 30; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36. Talent Partner: Johannes Westermark Hester.


We look forward to receiving your application (PDF documents submitted in English are appreciated). **Last day to apply is 19th November.** Please note that the recruitment is ongoing, the position might be filled before this date.


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline any direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Electrical Design Engineer
description:
*Väderstad AB är en ledande aktör inom jordbruksindustrin, och vi är på en resa mot en mer avancerad och automatiserad framtid. Med en ständigt ökande befolkning och mindre och mindre jordbruksmark blir vikten av högteknologiska, robusta och kvalitativa maskiner som gör det enkelt för bönder att åstadkomma enastående resultat en förutsättning för framgång. Här ligger Väderstad AB med sina jordbearbetnings- och såmaskiner i branschens framkant vilket ställer höga krav på kontinuerlig innovation och utveckling.*
Drills Software and Electronics är en utvecklingsavdelning som arbetar med mjukvara, elsystem och elektronik för våra såmaskiner. Inom gruppen ansvarar vi för elektronisk hårdvara som egna styrsystem, sensorer, motorer och kablage. Vi befinner oss i fronten när det gäller styrsystem för jordbruksmaskiner, det betyder att nya idéer är nödvändiga och innovation tillåts att ta plats.  

Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med våra elsystem med fokus på nyutveckling och underhåll.  

Som Electrical Design Engineer kommer du att vara med i hela kedjan från produktidé till test på fysisk maskin. Vi har ett nära samarbete med externa leverantörer och våra andra avdelningar internt inom t.ex. hydraulik och mekanik. Hos oss finns goda möjligheter att växa och utvecklas.
Gruppen består idag av ett team på 5 st. medarbetare. Vi har en väldigt god sammanhållning i gruppen och samarbetsförmåga är viktigt för oss.
Den vi söker  

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med elsystem och elektronik och brinner för att säkerställa högsta kvalitet i varje steg. Du gillar robusta lösningar och snygga installationer och du vill gärna åka ut till en maskin för att se och testa dina lösningar. Du är initiativtagande och har ett driv att tillsammans med teamet leverera kvalité i dina arbetsuppgifter och nå uppsatta mål.  

Har du dessutom en teknisk utbildning på högskole- eller universitetsnivå är du en ännu bättre matchning.  

Vi värdesätter personlighet högt och söker dig som, utöver rätt kompetens, har en positiv inställning och en förmåga att bidra till vårt team med engagemang och samarbetsvilja. Vi är ett gott team med härlig stämning och ser att driv och initiativtagande är viktiga egenskaper hos dig för att trivas. För att sedan kunna göra jobbet med kvalité är noggrannhet, analytisk förmåga och problemlösning till din nytta. Att arbeta självständigt tillsammans med andra för att nå bra resultat är inte en utmaning för dig!
Vi tror att du har erfarenhet inom:  

* 3D cad. Vi jobbar I Creo/Windchill.
* Installation av kablage och elektronik
* Framtagning av Elschema
* Ta fram testspecifikationer

Meriterande kunskaper:  

* Creo Cabling modulen.
* Automationsprodukter
* Motorer, DC, BLDC, stegmotorer etc.

Övrig information  

Placeringsort är Linköping.  

För frågor gällande rollen vänligen kontakta Christian Ganbrant på 0142-812 21 eller christian.ganbrant@vaderstad.com
För frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Specialist, Ellinor Lindell på 0142-810 59 eller ellinor.lindell@vaderstad.com
Ansökan  

Är du intresserad av tjänsten och motsvarar kraven är du välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast den 2025-12-04. Notera att ansökningar via e-post inte tas emot. Urval sker löpande och tillsättning kan ske innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Electronics Hardware Design Engineer
description:
Client is looking for an Electronics Hardware Design Engineer within Electronics & Software group. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with new powertrain control development. You will work as part of a top-performance in-house team with highly skilled people, to create world-class powertrain solutions. Our scope is from hybrid engine control systems to cover fully electric powertrains with functions such as Electrical drive units, inverters, and transmissions.


There are unlimited possibilities at Client for collaborative people who are ready to make the difference. We are re-imagining motion for a brighter future. Exploring how to push our environmental impact towards zero. Designing tomorrow´s powertrain solutions for automotive and beyond.


We’re known for being caring, collaborative people with a global mindset, a passion for innovation and a drive to create excellence. Do you want to join us on our journey?

 **Assignment description**


In this position, you will be the Component Owner for key control units such as ECM or Inverter. You will carry full product responsibility over time, ensuring robust design, industrialization, and lifecycle management.


You will be the main contact between customers and suppliers and drive the product development from concept to production. You will be part of a team consisting of Software Component Owners, Architects and experts within System Safety, Cyber Security & EMC.


**Key responsibilities**


* Lead the hardware design and lifecycle management of electronic control units (ECUs).
* Drive industrialization of automotive electronics from concept to production.
* Ensure compliance with automotive standards and best practices.
* Manage and resolve challenges related to EMC, load handling, and functional in/out pinning of circuit boards.
* Collaborate closely with software engineers and system architects to secure integration and node topology.
* Act as technical expert and main contact point for suppliers and internal stakeholders.

**Skill requirements**

**Your profile**


* Master’s degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering or related field.
* Solid experience in electronics hardware development within the automotive industry.
* Proven track record working with industrialization of automotive ECUs.
* Deep knowledge of communication protocols between nodes, EMC impact, loads, and circuit board pin functionality.
* Strong understanding of software interaction and ECU topology.
* Experience from Volvo Cars, AB Volvo, or Geely Group companies in Western Sweden is a strong merit.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to take ownership of technical solutions.

**Required skills**


ECUs,Communication Protocols, Automotive, Electrical Engineering, electronics hardware

**Languages**


Swedish(Proficient) English(Proficient)

  

Assignment period


17 Nov 2025 to 17 Dec 2026

**Submission Deadline** - 6th Nov 2025

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Full Stack Engineer - Erika Insurance** 




 Do you want to help shape the future of our platforms in a modern Azure environment and leverage AI and automation throughout the development lifecycle? We are looking for a
 **Full Stack Engineer** 
 who combines technical expertise in .NET and cloud architecture with a strong sense of structure, quality, and agile methodologies. You’ll be a key member of a small team where your contribution will have a direct impact, while also being part of a truly global business.
 



  





 Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible. Submit your application today!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Work on architecture and development in .NET/C#, Vue.js., Azure – from backend to integrations and user interfaces – ensuring high-quality deliveries and clean code.
* Participate in, and occasionally lead, technical testing and test automation initiatives.
* Contribute to the development of new and improved security strategies.
* Operate within structured yet pragmatic workflows, using backlogs and visual tools to provide clarity and focus for the team and stakeholders.
* Play an important role in ensuring the team works efficiently and transparently.



  





 You will report directly to Erika’s EVP Technology.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* Relevant IT education and at least 2 years of experience with .NET/C#, Azure, Vue.js., or related technologies.
* Relevant experience of testing.
* Understanding of API architecture and design patterns, including REST.
* Commitment to secure coding practices and awareness of compliance/privacy considerations.
* Enjoys working in an agile environment and has an interest in improving structure, workflows, backlogs, and visual tools to support team success.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.



  





**Desirable** 



* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps tools.
* Advanced experience in Azure, such as API gateways, Function Apps, Front Door, Data Factory and SQL server.
* Experience with Azure B2C, especially custom policies.
* UI design and prototyping experience in Figma.
* Experience with AI-driven development.
* Strong interest in emerging machine learning.



  





**We Offer** 



* An organization with few boundaries on what’s possible.
* The opportunity to help develop the next generation of our platforms in a modern cloud environment, applying AI and automation.
* Significant responsibility and varied tasks.
* The chance to take on challenges through collaboration with an action-oriented mindset.
* A work environment where your experience is valued, and where we encourage initiative and continuous improvement.
* The ability to combine strategic and technical development with influence over work methods and structure.
* A small core team within a truly global business.



  





**Other Information** 



* Start: Immediately
* Scope: Full-time
* Location: In-person - Strandvägen, Stockholm
* Recruiting Manager: Stefan Eriksson



  





**About Erika Insurance** 




 Erika Insurance, part of EF Education First, is a Swedish insurance company. For over 30 years, our mission has been to protect travelers as they discover new places, explore new cultures, and learn more about the world and themselves. We are a small and dynamic team in a flat organization where ideas become reality in a short time span. Learn more at https://erikainsurance.com.
 



  





**About EF Education First** 




 Some companies are in the business of technology. Others in finance, sports, or soft drinks. At EF, we’re in a different kind of business – one that’s less tangible, but far more important. Because what we do makes everything else possible. We’re in the Business of Understanding – between people – between cultures.
 



  





 For 60 years, we’ve been the leader in international educational programs and experiences designed to foster such understanding. Through language learning, cultural exchange, academic studies, and educational travel, we create immersive experiences that challenge biases, open minds, and pave the way for a more understanding world.
 



  





 You’ll find our 115 offices in some of the world’s greatest cities, filled with smart, driven people who push each other to be better every day. Yes, we have technology, finance, and even sports with our own professional cycling team – and we have an insurance company. But it’s what we do with these resources –building understanding, breaking down barriers, and creating a better world – that makes all the difference.
 



 Learn more at https://ef.com

title: Fullstack Developer - AI-Enhanced Development
description:
Join Mitigram as a Fullstack Developer and help build our next-generation trade platform and AI-assisted products. We're looking for engineers who can hit the ground running in a modern, clean architecture and are eager to embrace AI as an integral part of the development workflow.
   

  

 If you're excited about the future of development—where AI amplifies your capabilities rather than replaces them — this role is for you.
   

  

**About Mitigram**
 Mitigram is the leading digital platform for global trade financing. It is on a journey to build the largest and most comprehensive trade finance network, leveraging data to enable insights and accelerate the digitalisation of global trade and trade finance.
   

  

 As a growing company with a collaborative, innovative team, we offer an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact on cutting-edge projects. Join us as we shape the future of Trade Finance!
   

  

**Why You’ll Love This Role**
 We don’t just allow AI tools -we integrate them.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with
 **AI-powered development agents** 
 like Claude Code that understand our architecture and workflows, enabling you to build faster, cleaner, and smarter.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
**Backend**
* .NET 8 with C# 13 (using the latest language features)
* Domain-Driven Design (DDD): aggregate roots, entities, value objects
* CQRS pattern via Mediator
* SQL Server + Dapper (high-performance data access)
* Redis for distributed caching
* xUnit and Test Driven Development


**Frontend**
* Svelte 4, Typescript, Angular
* SASS/CSS and design system integration
* Vite for modern build tooling with HMR
* Testing with Vitest
* Collaboration through Figma


**Infrastructure**
* Azure cloud-native deployment
* Docker + Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
* JWT/OAuth/SAML for enterprise authentication


**What You’ll Bring To Succeed**
**Must Have:**
* Comfort using AI coding assistants (Copilot, Claude, etc.)
* Strong C#/.NET background with solid DDD understanding
* Experience with CQRS or similar architectural patterns
* Proficiency in a modern reactive framework - Angular + Typescript (or Svelte experience)
* Strong TypeScript and type-safe coding practices
* SQL expertise—you write queries, not just use ORMs
* TDD mindset—tests are part of how you think
* 5-7 years of professional experience in full-stack development
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent demonstrated experience in full-stack software development.


**Nice to Have:**
* Svelte experience (or eagerness to learn fast)
* Dapper or micro-ORM familiarity
* Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services


**The Mindset We’re Looking For**
 🤖
 **AI-First Thinking** 
 – You treat AI as a collaborator that accelerates your output and quality.
   

  

 🏗️
 **Architecture Matters** 
 – You care deeply about clean code and maintainable systems.
   

  

 🧪
 **Test-Driven** 
 – You write tests to move faster and deploy confidently.
   

  

 🎨
 **Craft & Quality** 
 – You take pride in both backend elegance and frontend polish.
   

  

 🚀
 **Ownership** 
 – You ship features end-to-end, from database to UI.
   

  

**What You’ll Build**
* Secure enterprise authentication (SSO, MFA, social login)
* User and organisation management features
* Security-critical, auditable systems
* Responsive, accessible frontends
* API integrations across Mitigram’s ecosystem
* Scalable microservices


**Our Development Culture**
* API-First Development – clear contracts and strong types
* Code Review & Collaboration – we learn and grow together
* AI Integration – specialised agents that understand our patterns
* Continuous Deployment – ship fast, ship often


**About The Team**
 You’ll join a team that values technical excellence, clean architecture, and pragmatic engineering. Together, we’re building critical infrastructure for Mitigram’s global trade platform—work that matters, done right.
   

  

**As a Mitizen**
* You will be part of cutting-edge projects in Trade Finance.
* Have the opportunity to collaborate with a curious, open, and innovative team.
* You will enjoy career growth opportunities and professional development support.
* You will benefit from a learning budget, comprehensive health insurance, and a strong focus on work-life balance.
* You will make a tangible impact in a growing, fast-paced company.


**What happens next?**
 If you believe this position aligns with your skills and career goals, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We will review applications on a rolling basis.
   

  

 At Mitigram, we’re open and curious, so if you are not entirely confident you meet our exact criteria, apply anyway —we value many other qualities as well. We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse team. We welcome applications from developers of all backgrounds who share our passion for technical excellence and innovation.
   

  

**Reference and Background Checks**
 As part of the recruitment process, we will ask the final candidate for references and conduct a background check.

title: Software Engineer with QA focus
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 As a Software Engineer with a QA focus, you will be part of a cross-functional development team. In this role, you will design, implement and maintain important e-health solutions - from integrations with national services and specialist systems to medical devices and key healthcare workflows. You will work with products such as integration with national population registries, enabling electronic referrals between healthcare providers, as well as solutions in obstetrics and patient monitoring.
   

  

 Your primary responsibility is to ensure the software quality through test automation, scripting, and active involvement in the entire development lifecycle. You will write and maintain test automation, facilitate test frameworks and perform manual testing where needed – always in close collaboration with other developers, business analysts and product owners.
   

  

 Your tasks will include
   

  

* Design, implement and maintain automated tests and test frameworks
* Participate in code reviews and actively work with the team to ensure high quality in releases
* Identify and handle defects, as well as verify fixes
* Work with continuous improvements in QA practices and tooling, including improving reliability and performance of the solutions
* Involve in design and requirement phase to ensure testability


**We offer**
 This role offers a unique opportunity to work with meaningful products that directly impact patient care and healthcare professionals’ daily work. You’ll be involved in everything from early requirements analysis to deployment, always with a strong focus on quality and continuous improvement.
   

  

**About You**
 You have at least a couple of years of experience working in software development with a focus on quality assurance. You’re comfortable writing code and scripts to support testing activities and have hands-on experience with test automation tools and frameworks.
   

  

 You enjoy working in agile teams and thrive in environments where collaboration and knowledge sharing are key. You have experience testing APIs using tools like Postman or SoapUI, and you understand the importance of testing early and often.
   

  

 Fluency in spoken and written English is required.
   

  

 We believe you are curious, proactive, and passionate about delivering high-quality software. You’re not afraid to challenge assumptions, and you take pride in making things better—whether it’s through automation, smarter processes, or simply asking the right questions.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** 
**-** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.
